В этом году она посеяла пшеницу, овес, арбуз, дыню, морковь и лук. Теперь, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай, Оймхолу необходимо купить минеральные удобрения и обработать ими землю. Оймхол планирует приобрести удобрения за счет заемных средств и верит, что ей это удастся и заранее благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en: Depicted in the photograph is a very kind, peace-loving and agreeable 54-year-old woman called Oymkhol. She lives in the Vakhsh region of Khatlon Province. Oymkhol lives with her daughter, son, and daughter-in-law. She always looks forward to planting season and never misses a year. This year she has sown wheat, oats, watermelon, melon, carrots and onions. In order to get a rich and high quality harvest, Oymkhol now needs to buy artificial fertilizer and treat the soil with it. Oymkhol plans to buy the fertilizer with borrowed money and believes that she will succeed in doing so. She thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy artificial fertilizer and treat her land.

loans.name: Renan Josue

texts.es: Renan, tiene 24 años de edad, esta soltero, vive junto a sus padres en una aldea del municipio de Tela, Atlántida. El siempre realizaba trabajos de jornal para obtener ingresos y ayudar a sus padres y con sus ahorros pudo establecer su propio negocio. Lleva dos años vendiendo productos de la canasta básica en una pulpería donde vende arroz, pan, productos enlatados, papel higiénico, toallas, velas, azúcar, refrescos, churros, carnes, verduras, manteca, huevos, etc.  Y solicita un prestamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar más productos y surtir, como ser azúcar, refrescos, churros, pan, arroz, carnes, productos de higiene y otros. Esta inversión le ayudará a incrementar los ingresos y poder mejorar la calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Renan is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents in a village in the municipality of Tela, department of Atlántida. For a long time he worked as a day laborer to generate some income and help his parents; then, with his savings he was able to establish his own business. He has been selling staple goods for two years in a small grocery store where he stocks rice, bread, canned goods, toilet paper, towels, candles, sugar, soft drinks, churros, meat, vegetables, lard, eggs, etc. Renan is requesting a loan for HNL 10,000 to purchase and stock more products, such as sugar, soft drinks, churros, bread, rice, meat, hygiene items, and others. This investment will help him increase his income and enable him to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to stock more products such as sugar, soft drinks, churros, bread, rice, meat, hygiene items, and others.

loans.name: Amilcar Geovany

texts.es:
El señor Amílcar Giovanny de 36 años de edad, es soltero  tiene  2 hijos que depende de él,  radica en la comunidad de el jícaro Galán  al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace mas de 5 años  a la venta de repuestos de bicicletas como llantas, rines, monturas, bombas, accesorios y bicicletas nuevas también vende maíz y frijoles  su venta es con los pobladores de esa zona, su venta es de lunes a domingo, es un hombre trabajador con deseos de salir adelante.
Don Amilcar está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de maíz y frijoles,  con el apoyo de este crédito el mejorara sus ingresos y su negocio y suplirá de esta forma su necesidad de financiamiento.
Don Amilcar  está muy contento de trabajar con Prisma y KIVA es su tercer crédito que solicita.
Don Amilcar su sueño es mejorar su negocio y comprar un carro para tener más productos y movilizarlos de una mejor forma así su negocio estaría creciendo y aumentando sus clientes ya que tendría más acceso a visitar comunidades.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2015.
texts.en: Amílcar Geovany is 36 years old, single, and has two dependent children. He lives in the community of El Jícaro Galán in southern Honduras, where he has his own house. For more than five years, Amílcar has made a living by selling bicycle parts such as tires, rims, mounts, pumps, and accessories, as well as new bicycles. He also sells corn and beans. His customers are local residents and he works from Monday to Sunday. Amílcar is a hard-working man who wishes to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to purchase corn and beans; with the help of this loan, he will increase his income, improve his business, and thus repay the loan. Amílcar is very happy to work with Prisma and Kiva; this is his third loan request. His dream is to improve his business and purchase a car in order to offer more products and have a better way to transport them. This way, his business will grow and he will gain more clients, as he would be able to travel to more communities. San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2015

loans.use: to purchase corn and beans for his business.

loans.name: Ghislaine Marinne

texts.es:
Ghislaine tiene 39 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de material rústico con sus tres menores hijos en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de humitas así como también de espesado que es un plato típico de la región, realiza esta actividad hace muchos años y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito sera para invertir en la compra de un molino eléctrico que es una herramienta para la elaboración de las humitas que ella vende, con esto ella espera ofrecer una mayor cantidad de humitas a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ghislaine is 39 and lives in the family home, built of basic material, with her three children. They live in a rural area of the district of Pucará, a community where the residents work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. Pucará is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.
Ghislaine prepares and sells ground corn and espesado, a local traditional dish. She has been doing this for several years and has good work and personal references in the area. She will invest this loan in the purchase of an electric grinder, a tool she will use for making ground corn. With this, she hopes to offer a better quantity of corn to her clients, which will allow her to improve her income and the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of an electric grinder for making ground corn.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés es un hombre de sesenta y ocho años de edad, quien ama el trabajo en el campo, se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y tiene un poco de ganado bovino. Él ya había sido beneficiado con un préstamo de Kiva y MiCrédito, con el cual pudo llevar acabo una siembra de frijol de postrera que pensó iba a perder por los problemas climatológicos y su falta de capital. Andrés está muy agradecido y ha depositado toda su confianza a Kiva junto MiCrédito para seguir trabajando. 
En estos momentos, Andrés vuelve solicitar el apoyo de Kiva y MiCrédito, mediante un préstamo que le permita surtirse de semillas de frijol y para que pueda pagar los gastos de siembra con mano de obra. Este nuevo crédito le ayudara a seguir produciendo sin necesidad de que tenga que vender alguna vaca. En un futuro planea seguir trabajando con Kiva junto MiCrédito, para invertir en la compra de más ganado bovino.
texts.en:
Andrés is a 68-year-old man who loves working in the fields. He plants corn and beans and has some livestock. He has already received a loan from Kiva and MiCredito, with which he was able to save his previous bean crop. He thought he was going to lose the crop due to climate problems and lack of capital. Andres is very grateful and has placed all of his confidence in Kiva and MiCredito to keep working.
At this time, Andres is again requesting the support of Kiva and MiCredito. He seeks a loan which will allow him to stock up on bean seeds, and to pay the costs of labourers to plant the seeds. This new loan will help him to keep producing without having to sell any cows.
In the future, he plans to keep working with Kiva and MiCredito to invest in the purchase of more cattle.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Hermila

texts.en:
Hermila works hard to support her family. Hermila is separated and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Hermila requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell in her fruit stall.

Hermila has been in this business for 35 years now.

In the future, Hermila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her fruit stall

loans.name: Hernan Jorge

texts.es: Jorge esta casado y tiene 31 años de edad, Jorge tiene un hijo de 2 años, Jorge trabaja en la carpinteria desde que tenia 15 años , Jorge tiene su negocio propio hace 2 años que su puso su propio taller de carpinteria, la esposa de Jorge se dedica a ayudarle en su negocio y a las actividades de su casa, Jorge paga arriendo para tener un techo para su familia y de igual forma paga arriendo para tener su taller, Jorge solicita el credito para comprar madera, clavos y demas implementos para elaborar los muebles, Jorge tiene la aspiracion de seguir adelante en su negocio y trabajar para que su hijo y su esposa no pasen muchas necesidades.
texts.en: Jorge is married, 31 years old, and has a 2-year-old son. He has been working as a carpenter since he was 15 years old. Jorge established his own carpentry shop two years ago. His wife helps him in the business and at home. Jorge pays rent to provide a home for his family and also to house his shop. He is requesting a loan to purchase wood, nails, and other supplies to make furniture. Jorge aspires to move ahead with his business and work so that his son and wife may not suffer serious hardships.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Angela Eleonora

texts.es:
La Joven Ángela de 30 años de edad  es soltera, su negocio está ubicado en el barrio victoria San Lorenzo valle, se dedica desde hace 15 años a su negocio que es una Floristería, donde vende lo que es: Peluches, Jarrones, Chocolates, Arreglos Florales, para 15 años, Bodas, Sepelios, etc.  Sus clientes son todas las personas que visitan el mercado,  amigos y vecinos, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, ella es conocida por ser una joven de negocio ya que su familia fue quien le enseño a trabajar en este negocio. Radica en el municipio de san Lorenzo al sur de Honduras. 
Ángela solicita 8,000 lempiras para compra de  Arreglos Florales y  Piñatas para su negocio con este crédito Ángela pretende tener más producto en su tienda y que su negocio se vea más atractivo para sus clientes. 
Ángela con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos y aumentar sus ganancias ya que ella apoya a su familia y le gustaría brindarles más ayuda. Su sueño es  crecer más en su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2015.
texts.en: Ángela is 30 years old and single. Her business is located in the neighborhood of Victoria San Lorenzo Valle. She has had a flower shop for 15 years, where she sells stuffed animals, vases, chocolates, and floral arrangements for girl's 15th birthdays (quinceañeras), weddings, funerals, etc. Her clients are people who visit the market, friends, and neighbors, and she works from Monday to Sunday. Ángela is known as a businesswoman because her family taught her how to do business. She lives in the municipality of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. Ángela is requesting a loan for HNL 8,000 to purchase floral arrangements and piñatas for her business. Through this loan she intends to offer more products in her store and make her business more attractive to clients. Ángela hopes that this loan will help improve her income and increase her profits, since she supports her family and would like to offer them more help. Her dream is to grow her business. San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2015

loans.use: to purchase floral arrangements and piñatas for her business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 60 years old, married, and has two adult children. She lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Leonora is engaged in fish vending, which she has been doing for four years. She earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. 

Leonora requested a loan from PMPC, which she will use to pay the tuition fees of her son. She has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Leonora hopes to expand her fish vending business.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa used her previous loan for 15,000 PHP to buy additional raw materials for her business. She would like to improve her sales more and is  requesting another loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more raw materials such as threads, fabric, and other materials needed in her tailoring business. Her customers will buy more items if she can produce more clothes everyday. 

In the future, Leonisa would like to have a bigger space for her tailoring shop and be able to earn more for her family. She is also supporting her grandchildren's education, which will improve their lives in the future. 

Leonisa meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida is 50 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 12 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Naida requested her second loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spice, cooking oil, milk, sugar, coffee, and personal care products. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, milk, sugar, coffee, and personal care products

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es: Elmer, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en una comunidad de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva 4 años de tener su propia finca de café, el cual vende en la misma zona ya sea en uva o en pergamino seco. Y para obtener otros ingresos también realiza trabajos de jornal a otros productores. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizantes y aplicarle a su finca de café para obtener mejor producción la próxima cosecha. Tiene como plan mejorar su situación económica, sembrando mas café y poder ayudar a su familia y terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Elmer is 31 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. He and his partner have two children; they all live together in a village in Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. Elmer has always worked in agriculture. He has owned a coffee farm for four years and sells his produce to locals, either fresh or dried. He also works as a day laborer for other farmers in order to improve his income.

Elmer is requesting a loan of 15,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantations. This will result in a better harvest. His plan is to improve his financial situation by growing more coffee. He will be able to help his family and finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more nail polish, cosmetics and other beauty products to use in her salon

loans.name: Floramie

texts.en:
Floramie is engaged in running a small grocery store. She is married and has four children. Since she wants to generate more income, Floramie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and develop her skill in business engagements. 

Floramie has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. The previous loan was used for personal purposes. 

Now Floramie is requesting her fourth loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventory for her store to sell.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a businesswoman who earns through buying and wholesaling various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement, floor tiles, and to pay for labor and paint to complete her house. 

She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, floor tiles, and to pay for labor and paint to complete her house

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
In 2012, Gloria joined Paglaum for financial assistance. She sought help as she has to bravely feed her children on her own. Being a widow, she doubles her time to earn well for her family. 

Now she applied another loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer. Gloria has big dreams for her her children and wants to see them with stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. 

She has a business producing school uniforms, house curtains and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 59 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Philippines. She is married and has four adult children. 

She is good in doing her farming activities and has had this business for five years. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

She requested a loan to buy bags of rice fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce. In the future, Dioscora hopes to engage in a new business to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anita is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

Anita has a buy and sell beauty product business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more beauty products to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 45 years old; she is divorced with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a boutique, has a tailoring machine, motorcycle transport and practices farming to get additional income. 

She dreams of completing her residential house, however limited capital is a challenge hindering her dream. 

Margret is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.name: Nenia

texts.en:
Nenia is 49 years old, married, and has three children.

Nenia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nenia has been in this business for three years now; she also earns additional income from a general store and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, 50, is a woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gloria has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 24 years. 

Gloria requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more product to sell like lotion, soap, etc.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell like lotion, soap, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 41, is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maricel has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Maricel requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irish is 33 years old and has one child in school.

Irish has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell like lotion, deodorant, etc..

Irish has been in this business for one year now. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like lotion, deodorant, etc.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
A los diez años, Marcial pasaba la mayor parte de su niñez en el campo junto con sus hermanos y su padre cultivando frijoles y maíz. Al pasar el tiempo, fue aprendiendo y apasionándose más por este trabajo como agricultor, hasta llegar a sus veinte años e independizarse con la ayuda de su actual esposa para consumo personal y para empezar a vender, una manera para sustentar a su familia que estaba empezando a expandirse. Ahora a sus 42 años de edad tiene seis hijos entre las edades de 21 a 7 años, quienes son la principal motivación para salir adelante y quienes apoyan a su padre en el campo sin dejar de ir al colegio. 
La agricultura sin duda se ha convertido en el estilo de vida de Marcial durante 25 años, quien además de sembrar en tierras nicaragüenses, tiene que viajar en verano a Costa Rica para poder darle una buena vida a su familia. Por esta razón es que solicita un préstamo para comprar abono, refrescante, herbicidas y pagar mano de obra para está próxima cosecha de frijol y así poder producir un cultivo de calidad. Además también planea comprar una vaquilla para incursionar en el mundo de la ganadería.  En sus planes está comprar más terreno y otra vaquilla para seguir creciendo.
texts.en: When he was ten years old, Marcial would spend most of his childhood in the fields, together with his siblings and father, cultivating beans and corn. Over time, he learned and became passionate about this work as a farmer, until he was twenty and started working on his own with help of his current wife. He started farming for personal consumption and to sell as a way to support his family, which was starting to grow. Now at 42 years of age, he has six children between the ages of 21 and 7 years old, who are his main motivation to prosper, and who support their father in the field as well as attending school. Undoubtedly, farming has become a way of life for Marcial during 25 years. Besides farming in Nicaraguan soil, he needs to travel to Costa Rica in the summer to give his family a good life. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy manure, refresher, herbicides, and to pay for hand labor for this next bean harvest, so that he is able to produce a quality crop. Also, he wants to buy a heifer to start working in animal husbandry. Among his plans are to buy more land and another heifer to keep on growing.

loans.use: to buy manure, refresher, herbicides, and to pay for hand labor.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 35, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. She is very hardworking and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work for managing her household expenses. 

She owns an embroidery business at home and husband provides transportation services. Both contribute their full income for household expenses. Her children go to school in the morning and for tuition classes in the evening. It is challenging to them to afford the school and tuition fee, so that both are doing a lot of hard work to run their house. They always try to establish their businesses so that they can generate maximum income and can cherish their children and teach them good manners.

Salma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use part of this amount for her embroidery business by purchasing material and her husband will use part for maintaining his rickshaw.

She hopes that through this amount both would be able to enhance their businesses. 

She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials and maintain the rickshaw.

loans.name: Fermelita

texts.en:
Fermelita is married to a fisherman and the family lives in Lopez Jaena. She has eight children. 

Fermelita is managing her fishing business. She earns a meager income each month doing this type of work with her husband, supporting the needs of their big family, especially her children's education, until they graduated and got their own jobs. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new nets and other fishing accessories. 

In the future, Fermelita hopes to repair her house for a safe and comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase new nets and other fishing accessories.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita is a widow; she is from Danao, Plaridel. Ramonita has a fish vending business. She earns a good return doing this type of activity, enabling her to support her two grandchildren. 

Ramonita wants to live with a simple yet comfortable living space for all of them. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house. 

Ramonita became an active member of PMPC. Now, she is on her way to repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio tiene 68 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad rural dedicada a la agricultura y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 05 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más pavos, gallinas, patos, entre otros animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ventas y por ende su nivel de ingresos, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 68 years old, and lives in his own home with his partner in Oyotun, a rural farming community located in the Chiclayo province in Lambayaque, on Peru's northern coast. 

He raises and sells poultry animals such as chickens, ducks, and turkeys, among others. He has been running this business for five years, so he has experience and very good personal and professional references in his district. He is requesting a loan to buy more turkeys, chickens, ducks, and other animals to increase his business stock, to ultimately grow his business and meet his customers' needs, which will increase his sales and therefore his income, improving his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more turkeys, chickens, ducks, and other animals to increase his business stock.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are still in school.

Mary Jean is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mary Jean has been in this business for five years now, she also earns additional income from a beauty parlor. She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 32 years old; she is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Grace has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 55 years old and has 11 children. She is widowed, and has two children who are in school.

Isabelita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Isabelita has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jose Bismark

texts.es:
Todas las mañanas para José son de aventura, pues goza cada momento desde que sale a las 4:00 am a cuidar su siembra actual. Desde hace 25 años este hombre emprendedor, padre de cuatro hijos que aman ir al colegio y que son apasionados también por la agricultura, igual que su padre, y esposo de una mujer que lo apoya en todo momento disfruta ser parte de estas jornadas. Este hombre de 42 años de edad inició a trabajar en el campo desde que era un pequeño, cuando ayudaba a su tío a cultivar frijoles, maíz y trigo. 
Poco a poco la actividad de agricultor se fue convirtiendo en la fuente de ingresos de José. Ahora que está casado y es padre se ha convertido, junto con sus cortes de café en Costa Rica, en la forma de llevar los alimentos a su hogar. Ahora las metas se han extendido, él quiere sembrar cada vez más frijoles para ahorrar y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Por esta razón es que solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como refrescantes, urea, pesticida y para pagar mano de obra. Esto le permitirá tener mayor producción y por ende más ingresos para cumplir su sueño de comprar una vaca y ahorrar para comprar terreno.
texts.en:
Every morning is a new adventure for José. He enjoys each moment, starting with when he goes out at 4:00 am to care for his crops. This enterprising man, father of four children who love going to school and who, like him, are equally passionate about agriculture, and husband of a woman who supports him wholeheartedly, has taken pleasure in his working days for the last 25 years.

The 42 year-old began working in the fields at a very young age, helping his uncle to grow beans, corn and wheat. Little by little farming became a source of income for José. Now that he is married and a father, this and his coffee fields have become his means of bringing food to the table. 

Now, his goals have expanded. He wants to continue to grow more beans in order to save and improve the condition of his home.

This is why he is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as refreshers, urea, and pesticides, and to pay for labor. This will enable him to increase production and income and reach his goal of buying a cow and saving money to buy land.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as refreshers, urea, and pesticides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Yongming

texts.en:
Yongming is 46 years old. He married his wife and had two children. His wife is working outside, and is not home all year round. His two children are in senior and primary school. Also, he has to support his father who was ill, without the ability to taking care of himself. 

Yongming began to feed chicks more than five years ago. He is honest and hardworking. During those years, he used the income to build their house and build a pig pen. They lead to a happy big family life.

This year, Yongming met a serious problem that more chicks died without reason. It puts the family in an embarrassing situation. 

So he requested ￥20,000 from MicroCred so that he could engage in feeding pigs; he want to buy more pigs this year. He hopes that his family can have an easier life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita works hard to support her family. Warlita is married and has a rice milling business in the Philippines.

Warlita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill.

Warlita has been in this business for 22 years now, and she also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad pequeña cuyas actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica al cultivo de café de variedad catimore, adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencia personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, de esta manera ella espera incrementar su nivel de ingresos para que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Violeta, age 43, lives with her husband and their two children in the Colasay district.  It is a small community, and the main business activities there are agriculture, commerce, and raising animals.  It is in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

She grows Catimore variety coffee.  She also works as an agricultural day worker.  She has experience in this business, and she has very good personal and work references in her district.

She will use the loan to buy compost and fertilizer and to provide maintenance to her coffee crop. This way she hopes to increase her level of income in order to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer and to provide maintenance to her coffee crop.

loans.name: Maybe Joy

texts.en:
Maybe Joy is a woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maybe Joy is 30 years old now.

Maybe Joy has a Xerox and printing business in the Philippines. Maybe Joy requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy supplies to use in her business like bond paper, etc.

Maybe Joy has been in this business for four years. In the future, Maybe Joy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to use in her business like bond paper, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Norma is 52 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Norma has a food-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Norma has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Omurbek

texts.ru: Омурбек, 51 год, женат, отец 2 детей. У Омурбека средне-специальное образование, уже много лет он занимается животноводством и полеводством. Сумев развить свой бизнес, на сегодняшний день, благодаря его упорству и целеустремленности в хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 4 теленка, бычок и 10 овец.Также занимается куплей-продажей картофеля. Омурбек обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS), на полученные средства он приобретет картофель. На доходы от кредита Омурбек хочет увеличить поголовье скота и в скором будущем открыть мини ферму.
texts.en: Omurbek is 51 years old, married, and the father of two children. Omurbek has a secondary vocational education and he has been engaged in animal rearing and crop growing for many years. Having managed to develop his business, thanks to his persistence and dedication today his smallholding has four cows, four calves, a bullock and ten sheep. He also buys and resells potatoes. Omurbek has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) and he will buy potatoes with these funds. Omurbek wants to use the profits from the loan to increase the headcount of his livestock and to open a mini farm in the near future.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Grupo De Tzamjuyup 1 Group

texts.es:
Pascuala (es la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) es una mujer muy trabajadora, amable y sincera que agradece  por el crédito anterior porque gracias a ello logro mejorar su negocio  y sus ingresos, ella y los integrantes del grupo se encuentran satisfechos por la inversión que realizaron y  que los ayudo a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familia, pero ella quieren seguir prosperando por tal razón solicita un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá en su negocio de compra y venta de ropa para satisfacer aún más las necesidades de la clientela.
Pascuala tiene el anhelo de tener una casa más grande para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pascuala (pictured on the far right in the photo) is a very hard-working, friendly and honest woman. She appreciates the previous loan because it enabled her to improve her business and earnings; she and the members of the group are satisfied with the investment they made, which helped them to improve their and their families' quality of life. But they would like to continue to prosper, so they are seeking a new loan which they will invest in their business buying and selling clothing, to better satisfy their customers' needs. 
Pascuala wishes to have a bigger house, so that her children will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in buying and selling traditional clothing.

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Thom province, Reth is 58 years old and a mother of four children. She grows rice as the main source of income and does fishing to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 26,000 KHR per day. 

This is her group’s first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a decent latrine. Through this loan, she hopes that her family members will have good health and an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 37-year-old lady living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to save so that she can provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a motor rickshaw for several years, but his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the motorbike and rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband will be able to maintain the motorbike and its body. She hopes that she will be able to save enough to meet the sudden needs of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's motor rickshaw.

loans.name: Jianlin

texts.en:
Jianlin is 35 years old. His wife is working outside, not at home, all the year round. They have a child who is in primary school. Also, he has to support his parents who are over 70 years old and help him to feed the pigs.

Jianlin began to feed and sell pigs and pork two years ago. The income from pigs is used to support the big family with a happy life. As to the bad economic environment, the business has not gone well in these two years; it can just afford them the living necessities. 

A few months ago, Jianlin had a bad illness, which cost almost all of his savings. Fortunately, he is better now.
 
Jianlin requested ￥12,000 from MicroCred to buy piglets to earn enough money. This is the third time he borrowed money. He hopes their lives become better and better in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Ella vive en un unión libre con su pareja, desde hace años padece una enfermedad de riesgo en el colon se ha sometido a diferentes tratamientos y por el momento se encuentra estable.
Recientemente le detectaron una catarata traumática en su ojo Izquierdo esto le ocasiona dificultad para transportarse sola e incluso caminar en su propia casa, ella necesita urgentemente una operación y de momento no cuenta con los recursos suficientes.
texts.en:
She lives with her life partner in a common-law marriage.  For years she has suffered from a life-threatening disease in her colon.  She has undergone different treatments, and for the moment she is stable.

They recently detected a traumatic cataract in her left eye.  This makes it difficult for her to go anywhere alone, including walking in her own house.  She urgently needs an operation, and at the moment she does not have sufficient resources.

loans.use: to pay for opthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chairs to make customers comfortable while taking tea or coffee and buy two bags of sugar to make tea and coffee for customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase beans

loans.name: Diloro

texts.en:
Diloro is a creative woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is married and has five children. Her husband is working in agriculture. The standard of their living is poor and hard. 

Diloro decided to help and support her husband to feed their family. She has work experience in agriculture, helping to keep livestock. She is planning to buy livestock and start a new business. She hopes her activity will help and be to her family’s benefit. 

She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn Lý Tây Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Hiền is 29 years old and married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 thôn Lý Tây xã Thăng Bình solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

Hiền works in the agriculture business of farming food crops and has been involved in this business for 8 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more seeds and tools for farming food crops.

In 2012, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. Hiền has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and tools for farming food crops.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a 30-year-old married man from Khanyounis city. He lives with his wife and one son in a very simple house. Sulaiman works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. He would like to improve his family's living conditions and find an additional job.

Sulaiman took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods on it. By taking this loan, Sulaiman will be able to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

Sulaiman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods on it

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a married mother of four children, and all of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house. The family has electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

She operates a beauty salon and has been in this business for five years. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality. Her goal is to get her own permanent residence.

She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy braids, weaves, oils, relaxers and treatments. She aspires to buy a plot of land on which to build a house.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, oils, relaxers and treatments

loans.name: Mayra Ivonne

texts.es:
Mayra tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa familiar con su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, pollos, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 06 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más cuyes, pavos, gallinas, patos, entre otros animales para su negocio, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mayra is 30 years old, she is married, and she lives with her husband and two children in the district of Cayalti, a community that works in agriculture, commerce, and raising animals. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, in the northern coast of Peru.
She works breeding and selling farm animals such as chickens, ducks, and chicks, among others. She has had this occupation for 6 years, her business is located in her home, and she has good personal and work references in her district. She asks for a loan to purchase more guinea pigs, turkeys, chickens, ducks, among other animals, for her business, with the goal of increasing her sales and satisfying the needs of her clients, which will generate more income and will allow her to improve her quality of live and of her family.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs, turkeys, chickens, and ducks, among other animals, for her business.

loans.name: Dolor

texts.en:
Dolor sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan helped her improve her profits from her business. She was able to buy more supplies of meat products which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business even more if you will lend her again an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will help her increase the supplies of meat products she sells. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family.

Dolor aspires to become a wholesaler or a manager her own company someday. She wants for her family to be always happy. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of pork, chicken and other supplies that she usually trades.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, 48, is a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Violeta has a food processing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years.  She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Eath's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two schoolchildren living in Kampong Thom province, Eath is 41 years old. To support her living, she grows rice and does fishing to earn more income. 

For Eath, this is the first loan cycle for her group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a decent latrine. Through this loan, she hopes that her family members will have good health and an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years. It has been depreciating with the passage of time. He sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new rickshaw. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children. Now, his children are growing old, and their needs are growing, as well.
 
Saima has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing, they were short some money. Therefore, Saima has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings. 

Saima is a 39-year-old woman, and she is living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Saima hopes that now her husband would be able to generate more income. She is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Ham's Group

texts.en:
Ham, 34 years old, is living in Kampong Thom province. She is a mother of three children, and two of them are in school. Growing rice and fishing are the sources of her family’s income. She could earn about 22,000 KHR per day. 

Now she wants to apply for this first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund in a group of two members. She will use her portion to build a private toilet for family use. She hopes that her family will have good health.

loans.use: to build a private toilet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Hồng

texts.en:
Hồng is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She grows industrial crops, which she has been doing for 10 years. The main hardship that Hồng  faces is not having hygenic latrine. 

Hồng is requesting a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which she will use to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipments to build toilet. She joined joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2015 to improve her business. With her profits, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipments to build a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as tomato paste and salt.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Her name is Lolita, 50, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Georle, a driver, and she has children. She works to augment their income to meet their daily personal, household needs.

Lolita has a small food stall by her house where sells snacks such as coffee and "halo-halo," which is a traditional Filipino treat consisting of a blend of fruits, sweet preserves, evaporated milk, and shaved ice. It is frequently topped with a scoop of ice cream. The name literally means "mix-mix." Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 700 a day. 

To help her continue the operation of her general store business she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to buy coffee mix and the ingredients such as bananas, jack fruit, beans, gelatin, milk, sugar, and other ingredients needed to make her "halo-halo." She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her, which will surely help fund their daily needs. 

Lolita hopes to have more snack stands in other areas. She prays for good health and long life to see her future grandchildren. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for coffee mix and ingredients to make her "halo-halo" to sell.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
Jaramijó por el hecho de estar frente al Océano Pacifico hace que sus habitantes  se dediquen a la pesca artesanal y sea su mayor soporte económico para sus familias y para la provincia,  cuentan con un muelle propicio para acoderar más de 300 embarcaciones de menor calado frente al mirador turístico el peñón.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 5 y 2 años. El cónyuge es pescador. Viven alquilando una casa.
Doña María es ama de casa  qué para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene una mini tienda donde vende arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros , esto lo logro con la ayuda de los créditos de la fundación, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde,  su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo cuando él puede y está desocupado, pero por lo general es ella la que más pasa en su negocio ya que es ahí donde le gusta estar ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor. Tiene dos años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, ropa interior, colas, bolos gelatinas, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 5 años y le gusta porque las socias pagan al día. Su sueño es tener su casa propia
texts.en:
Jaramijó, because it faces the Pacific Ocean, lives by small scale fishing which is the major economic support for it's families and for the province. It has a dock capable of holding more than 300 small boats in front of the tourist viewpoint "el Peñón".

María lives in this place. She is 23 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has 2 children aged 5 and 2 years old. Her spouse is a fisherman. They rent a house. María is a housewife who in order to help with the household expenses sells clothing and has a small store where she sells rice, sugar and oil amongst others. She has managed this with the help of loans from the Foundation.

She works every day from 8 am until 8 pm and later at times. Her husband helps her with the work when he can and is not working but generally it is her that spends more time in the business. This is where she likes to be and making a living is entertaining and she learns of the events that happen around her.

She has been doing this for 2 years and things are going well. She will use the loan to buy clothing, underwear, soft drinks, jelly, cold cuts and other basic food items. She has been in the communal bank for 5 years and she likes it as the members pay on time. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothing, underwear, soft drinks, jelly

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gloria is 40 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Gloria has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 57 ans et mère de cinq enfants. Yawa vit à Adidogomé pour exercer son activité qui consiste à traiter du manioc pour produire de la farine qu’elle vend. Ce commerce lui génère un bon bénéfice et Yawa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de manioc, Yawa demande ce microcrédit pour réaliser son achat et favoriser une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Yawa is a married woman, 57 years old, and the mother of five. She lives in Adidogomé to carry out her work involving the processing of cassava to make flour, which she sells. This business generates a good profit. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market. To put in an order for sacks of cassava, Yawa is asking for this loan for making her purchase and for the sake of educating her children well.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cassava

loans.name: Akofa

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans, Akofa est une jeune femme célibataire qui vit à Adidogomé. Akofa est une commerçante ambulante de friperies dans son quartier et réalise un revenu grâce à son activité pour répondre à ses besoins quotidiens. Akofa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des robes et des jupes, Akofa demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour faire accroitre son activité.
texts.en: Akofa, aged 29, is a young woman, unmarried, who lives in Adidogomé. She is a street vendor of secondhand clothing in her district and makes an income, thanks to her business, for supporting herself. She gets her supplies once a month at the market. To put in an order for dresses and skirts, Akofa is asking for this loan to reach her goals and to earn a good profit margin, so as to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 dozen dresses and 7 dozen skirts

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré le 12 Septembre 2013, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Kadiatou, âgée de 22 ans (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est célibataire et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 garçons et 01 fille. Elle s’active dans le commerce en bétail. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés régionaux.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 08 chèvres à 20000f l’une et le revendre 25 000f l’une et ceci mensuellement.

Ses bénéfices sont destinées à la dépense quotidienne et à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Inaugurated on September 12, 2013, this 'banc villageois' is composed of women from a village group who joined the program to make their small-scale businesses profitable. A nice ambiance presides over the group meetings.

Ms. Kadiatou, aged 22, is standing at the far right in the photo. She is the group’s featured borrower. She is unmarried and the mother of three children (2 boys and 1 girl). She is active in livestock sales and supplies herself at regional markets. 

With her new loan, she intends to purchase 8 goats at 20,000 francs each and resell each one at 25,000 francs on a monthly basis.  Her profits are for cover her children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase 8 goats at 20,000 francs each to be resold at 25,000 francs each on a monthly basis

loans.name: Thiết

texts.en:
Mr Thiết works in agriculture farming food.

Thiết is 34 years old and he is married with 2 children. Thiết lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thiết's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thiết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thiết faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Thiết hopes for his business to do well, for his children to find a good job, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga has a service business laying bricks. She is 49 years old and married with two children.

Nga lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nga first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in her business for six years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

In the future, Nga hopes her children will do well in school, for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
Jaramijó por el hecho de estar frente al Océano Pacifico hace que sus habitantes  se dediquen a la pesca artesanal y sea su mayor soporte económico para sus familias y para la provincia,  cuentan con un muelle propicio para acoderar más de 300 embarcaciones de menor calado frente al mirador turístico el peñón.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa,  tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  5  hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es pescador.
Doña Rosa para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como colas, detergentes, hielo, bolos, jabones, etc. trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Con el primer crédito empezó el negocio y es ahí donde le gusta estar ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor. Tiene cinco años  con esta actividad, su esposo y el hijo también le ayudan de vez en cuando.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar colas, fundas, leches, achiote, jabones, cloro  y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 7 años y le gusta porque son unidas las socias y los intereses son bajos. Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Because it faces the Pacific Ocean, Jaramijó’s inhabitants work in artisanal fishing, and makes it the biggest economic support for their families and for their province. They have their own dock, which allows them to hold more than 300 boats of lower depth in front of the touristic lookout, ‘el peñón.’
This is where Rosa lives, she is 65 years old, she is married, and from this relationship she has 5 children who are independent adults. Her husband is a fisherman.
To get ahead with her family, Rosa has a grocery shop in her house. There she sells all type of products, such as soft drinks, detergents, ice, frozen sweets, soaps, etc. She works every day from 8:00 until 20:00 and sometimes even later. With the first loan she started her business, and this is where she likes to be, as besides from making a living, she has fun and learns about all the news happening around her. She has had this occupation for five years, and her husband and son also help from time to time. 
 She will use this loan to stock her store, she is going to purchase soft drinks, pillowcases, milk, achiote (a type of fruit), soap, chlorine, and other basic goods. She has been in the loan group for 7 years and she likes it because the members are very united and the interests are low. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, pillowcases, milk, achiote (a type of fruit), soap, chlorine, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza de animales de corral como patos, pollos, pavos y crianza de cerdos, Juan también brinda servicio de jornalería en un molino de su distrito, tiene una familia unida. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de materiales para el arreglo de los corrales donde cría a sus animales, lo que le permitirá tener una mejor distribución para el desarrollo de su negocio y esto le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos que mejorarán su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is thirty-six years old, he lives with his wife and children in the Oyotun district, a community dedicated to farming, commerce and raising livestock, located in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. 

He and his wife raise farm animals such as ducks, chickens, turkeys and pigs. Juan also works as a day laborer at a mill in his district, he has a close-knit family. He has requested a loan to purchase materials to repair the pens where he raises his animals, which will allow him to have better distribution for the development of his business, and this will allow him to increase his earnings, which will improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair the pens where he raises his animals.

loans.name: Geoconda Monserrate

texts.es:
Jaramijó por el hecho de estar frente al Océano Pacifico hace que sus habitantes  se dediquen a la pesca artesanal y sea su mayor soporte económico para sus familias y para la provincia,  cuentan con un muelle propicio para acoderar más de 300 embarcaciones de menor calado frente al mirador turístico el peñón.
En este lugar vive la señorita Geoconda,  tiene 23  años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres.
Doña Geoconda es muy buena hija que para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarles a sus padres con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos por catálogo. Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son blusas y ropa interior. 
Este crédito es para comprar blusas, brasieres, perfumes, cremas, bisutería, labiales y colonias de niños. En el Grupo De Crédito tiene 7 años y  le gusta los temas educativos y los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Su sueño es estudiar hotelería y turismo.
texts.en:
Because Jaramijó is on the Pacific Ocean, its inhabitants make their living with traditional local fishing, and this is their largest source of economic support for their families and for the province. The town has a dock that allows for more than 300 shallow-depth across from the rocky tourist lookout.

Geoconda, 23 years old, lives here. She is single, has no children, and lives with her parents.

Geoconda is a very good daughter, since she makes her own income to help their parents with the household expenses by selling clothes and cosmetics by catalog. She works three days a week for two to three hours a day. She sells her products on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this for three years and is doing very well. Blouses and underwear are her bestsellers.

This loan is to buy blouses, bras, perfumes, creams, jewelry, lipstick, and children’s perfume. She has been in the credit group for  7 years; she likes the educational topics, and payments are easy to make. Her dream is to study hospitality and tourism.

loans.use: to buy blouses, bras, perfumes, creams, jewelry, lipstick, and children’s perfume.

loans.name: Kha's Group

texts.en:
Kha, 41, living in Kampong Thom province, is a mother of five children and two of them are in school. 

Rice farming and working for other people have been the sources of her family’s income for 27 years. These businesses earn her about 52,000 KHR per day. 

Her group consists of two members, and this is the first loan for them with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will use her loan portion to build a private toilet for her family’s use. 

She hopes to improve her family’s living and health.

loans.use: to build a private toilet

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Salida A Palilic Group

texts.es:
Manuela (es la primera del lado derecho de blusa café) la es una mujer de  46 años edad, es casada tiene un hijo que ya cuenta con su propia familia, ella vive en una comunidad de Sololá.

Manuela para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica desde hace cuatro años.
Manuela ahora junto a un grupo de personas a tomado la iniciativa  de mejorar su negocio comprando más ropas típicas, para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de la clientela.
Ella anhela darle a su hijo una casa propia para que no parezca de necesidades.
texts.en: Manuela (the first on the left in the coffee colored blouse) is a 46 year old married woman who has a son who now has his own family. She lives in a community of Sololá. Manuela has worked selling traditional clothing for the past 4 years in order to make income and help her husband with the household expenses. Manuela together with a group of people has taken the initiative to improve her business buying traditional clothing to better satisfy the needs of her clients. She hopes to give her son his own house so that he has everything he needs.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Yaovi est un homme marié et âgé de 44 ans qui habite le quartier de Tokoin. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses trois enfants à charge, Yaovi est un cordonnier qui fabrique et vend des chaussures de peau. Grâce à cette activité, Yaovi arrive à trouver une épargne et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des plaques de semelles, une boite de colle et des matériaux pour la fabrication, Yaovi demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et améliorer ses prestations afin d’augmenter son profit.
texts.en: Yaovi is a married man, 44 years old, who lives in the Tokoin district. To support himself and his three children in his care, he is a cobbler who makes and sells leather shoes. Thanks to this business, he manages to save money. He gets his supplies twice a month at the market. To put in an order for sole plates, a can of glue, and some fabrication material, Yaovi is asking for this loan to realize his purchase and to improve his range of services, so as to grow his profits.

loans.use: to purchase sole plates and a can of glue

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Sector Campo Group

texts.es:
Josefa  (es la primera del lado derecho de blusa celeste) es una señora de 44 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de los cuales dos de ellos está estudiando y tres de ellos se encuentran ya casados, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Josefa con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica  a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella tiene cinco años de realizar esta labor.
Josefa ahora ha tenido la iniciativa de mejorar la calidad de su servicio a la clientela, comprando más cortes típicas pero de estilos modernos y de mejor calidad, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, por tal razón se ha unido a un grupo de personas con las mismas necesidades, para  junta solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá comprando cortes típicas.

Josefa tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para mejorar su negocio y obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Josefa is a 44-year-old woman who is married and has a beautiful family of five children. two of whom are studying and three of whom are already married. This humble family lives in a community in Suchitepéquez. In the photo, Josefa is the one on the right-hand-side in the blue blouse.

In her desire to make income and help her husband with the household costs, Josefa buys and sells traditional clothing. She has been doing this for five years. 

Josefa now wants to improve the quality of the service that she offers to her customers by buying more traditional clothing but in modern styles and of a better quality. One of the difficulties that she faces is that she doesn't have the sufficient capital. This is why she has joined a group of people with the same needs, so that together they can ask for a loan. She will invest her portion in buying traditional clothing. 

Josefa hopes to get the loan so that she can improve her business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh works in agriculture farming food.

Thanh is 27 years old and she is married with 1 child. Thanh lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thanh has been involved in this business for 4 years.

The main hardship that Thanh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Hân

texts.en:
Hân has a service business cutting hair. She is 29 years old, married with two children and supports two additional dependents.

Her business in located in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Hân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan. Hân has been involved in this business for seven years.

Her main hardship in life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hân hopes her children to do well in school, for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Deisy Hudubella

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto con sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad pequeña que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad desde hace varios años, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad para incrementar el stock de su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Deysi is 25 years old and lives with her two children in the district of Oyotún, a small community where the population work in farming, trade and  livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque on the north coast of Peru.

Deysi has made a living selling essential products for several years. She has experience in this business and has good personal and professional contacts in her district. 

She has asked for a loan to buy essential products to increase her business' stock so that she can generate more income for her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy essential products to increase the stock in her business

loans.name: Tiến

texts.en:
Tiến has sold medication for five years. He is 28 years old and single with no children. Tiến lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tiến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

His main hardship in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Tiến hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ebiy

texts.en:
Ebiy is 52 years old, married to Robert and blessed with six children between 33 years and 8years old.  

She has been in dairy farming for the last 15 years, from which she only makes a monthly income of twenty three thousand shillings. 

This is her first loan with Visionfund Kapsabet and she intends to use the loan to buy dairy feed and farm inputs.

Ebiy will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her two grandparents. Her future dreams is to live a good life and start a zero grazing unit.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed and farm inputs.

loans.name: Ma. Edralin

texts.en:
Ma. Edralin, 31, is a married woman with three children. Two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Edralin has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other supplies. She has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Ma. Edralin would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other supplies.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 39-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He is a cobbler by profession and very expert in his arts. He has been manufacturing shoes for many years; this is the reason he has a lot of experience in his profession. He sews leather and rexine shoes through a machine, after that attaching its sole through stitching by hand. In this way he is generating income for his family. 

He has been making shoes at home, but now he has established a shop to continue his business on a wide level. But he does not have cash in hand to buy the initial raw materials for making shoes. Therefore, Rehana requested a loan for her husband so he can buy the initial raw materials for making shoes.
