Rehana thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase initial raw materials such as leather, rexine, glue, and nails for the establishment of her husband's shoe-making business.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 58 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has raised pigs for six years and also earns income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all attend school. 

She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis and has been in business for three years. Amina works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses includes school fees and food.

Amina has requested a loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. 

Her major business challenges include transportation of charcoal from village to market. 

Amina's goal is to build a house. She currently lives in rented house and her family has access to electricity but not and piped water.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala. She is married with one child who goes to school. She takes care of three additional family members. 

She operates a canteen at the school on a retail basis from the market. She has been in business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy sweets, biscuits, sweet bananas, chapati, cookies, juice, soda, soap, and sugar. 

Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a fridge so as to serve cold drinks. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medications.

loans.use: to buy sweets, biscuits, sweet bananas, chapati, cookies, juice, and soda

loans.name: Juleisy Belen

texts.es:
Jaramijó por el hecho de estar frente al Océano Pacifico hace que sus habitantes  se dediquen a la pesca artesanal y sea su mayor soporte económico para sus familias y para la provincia,  cuentan con un muelle propicio para acoderar más de 300 embarcaciones de menor calado frente al mirador turístico el peñón.
En este lugar vive la señora Juleisy, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 2 años que son gemelas. El cónyuge es estibador en una fábrica privada.
Doña Juleisy para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 19h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su  esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando él puede y está desocupado, pero por lo general es ella la que más pasa en su negocio ya que es ahí donde le gusta estar ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor. Tiene diez  meses la pequeña tienda  y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar  golosinas, colas, jugos,  hielo, bolos, gelatina, fundas, palitos para helados y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 1 año y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos y puede invertir en la tienda e incrementar las ganancias. Su sueño es agrandar su negocio y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Because Jaramijó is located in front of the Pacific Ocean the people there engage in traditional fishing, making this their main source of income for the families and for the province. They have their own pier to berth more than 300 small boats in front of the Peñón tourist scenic overlook.

This is where Juleisy lives, she is 21 years old, has a partner and they have 2 children who are twins. Her partner is a longshoreman in a private factory. Juleisy, to support her family, has a grocery store where she sells all kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, legumes, vegetables and fruits. She works every day from 9:00 to 19:00 and sometimes later. Her partner helps her when he can and when he is not busy, but in general she is the one who tends to the business. This is where she likes to be, in addition to making a living, it is entertaining and she learns about what is going on in the area. The small store has been open for 10 months and it is going well.

She will use the loan to stock the store.  She will buy candy, sodas, juices, ice, “bolos” (a frozen sweet in a plastic sleeve), gelatin, covers, ice cream sticks, and other basic products. She has been a part of the Grupo De Crédito for 1 year and she likes it because of the low interest rates and because she can invest in her store and increase her revenues. Her dream is to expand her business and to own a home.

loans.use: to buy candy, sodas, juices, ice, "bolos" (frozen sweets in a plastic sleeve), covers, ice cream sticks and other basic products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply milk for more income.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a farmer based in Kapsowar, Kenya. She owns a one acre piece of land that she uses to grow maize and dairy animals. She has also planted trees on it for aesthetic reasons and to promote environmental health. 

Not only does the land provide her with capital for her business but also a home for her family. She is blessed to have a lovely family with a husband to whom she has stayed married for more than five years! 

Jeniffer is seeking a loan to purchase cereal for business. The demand for cereal in the Kapsowar market, only a few kilometers from her home, is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. 

By supplying cereal seeds and by farming cereal, Jeniffer gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. 

Jeniffer is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others. Your loan will directly elevate Jeniffer’s livelihood. She strives to give her children a better life than the tough upbringing she had.

loans.use: to purchase cereal seeds.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita, age 51, is a married woman with four children; one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Pacita has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. She has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Pacita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other supplies.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
When you are young and starting a new family with a fragment of land, it is a challenge for people in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. 

Norah has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary source of income has been selling eggs, maize and milk, as well as some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income (motorbike business). 

Norah, who is an ever-smiling farmer, has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is for the older generation. She passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early-riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. 

Although this humble mom makes a profit by selling milk to her neighbors and at the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. because Norah is known for having the best quality milk. 

Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. Norah is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. 

Through the loan she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk daily. This will help fully satisfy the demand. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is the field partner, Norah attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to fully repay the loan and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna, 44, is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a nipa (bamboo strips) roofing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. Lorna has requested a 6000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy materials for her business such as bamboo. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her roofing business

loans.name: Hamera

texts.en:
Hamera is a 30-year-old married mother of three children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband provides whitewash and oil paint services to his customers in the community; sometimes out of city as well. 
He has gotten a new contract for painting newly constructed houses but he cannot afford to buy tools and supplies for providing his services.
Hamera requested a loan for her husband to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil etc.
Hamera wants to improve her family's living conditions and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband.
She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil etc. for her husband's painting service.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
Lim, 56-year-old, is a mother of five children who are still depending upon her. 

She has been a rice farmer in Kampong Thom province for more than ten years. In order to get additional income, she works for other farmers as well. Lim can earn about 50,000KHR per day. 

Now she is leading a group of three to apply for this loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to build a private toilet for her family’s use. 

Lim hopes her family will have good health and her standard of living will improved.

loans.use: to build a private toilet.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra, 33, is a married mother of one child, living in Kampong Thom province. 

The source of her family’s income is from rice farming and fishing. She been farming for more than five years. 

Now Ra has decides to form a group of four to take this loan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. She will use her portion of the loan to buy a decent latrine. 

Ra hopes that her whole family will have better living condition and good health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Eak's Group

texts.en: Eak, 42, is a married mother of four children, living in a rural area of Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. Growing rice has been the main source of her family’s income for more than five years. Eak’s group consists of four members, and this is the first loan for her with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As a leader, she will use her portion to buy a decent latrine. Through this loan, she hopes that her family’s members will have good health, which will improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods on it.

loans.name: 031411040004.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Thái operates a food stall/restaurant selling processed food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients to cook processed food to sell.

Thái is 61 years old and married with two children.
Thái is the group leader of the 031411040004.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Thái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thái has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thái has been involved in this business for seven years.
The main hardship that Thái faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thái hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to cook processed food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables (eggplant, tomatoes and beans) to sell.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is 32 years old and married. He is from Dier Al-Balah. He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income, which barely covers all his family's needs. He would like to improve his family's living conditions and find an additional job.

Hani requested a loan from FATEN, which he will use to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods. With this loan, he will be able to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow allowing him to supply milk to his clients in the Kisii Region.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a 49-year-old mother of one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jovita has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks.

Jovita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jovita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 27-year-old married woman with three children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks and bamboo leaves..

Erlinda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks and bamboo leaves.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, age 32, is a married woman with two children. One attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. 

Marivic requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed, like bamboo stick, etc. She has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to build roofs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates, bottles and bottle labels for his business.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David is the leader of his group in Matete District representing 11 farmers, including himself. He is married and a proud father of three children. David joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for 20 years.

Like many other farmers, David decided to work with One Acre Fund to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seed and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

David's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 7.75 acres of land. They will also receive a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seed and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en: Sor, 45, is a married mother of five children, one of them in school. She is living in Kampong Thom province. The source of her family’s income has been from rice farming for more than five years. Now, she is leading a group of two to apply for this loan with a portion used to pay for a decent latrine for her family’s uses. She hopes that her family will enjoy good health as a result of this loan.

loans.use: to pay for a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.

Josphine operates a green grocer business selling assorted vegetables and fruits. She is borrowing 10,000 KES to buy more vegetables and fruits such as carrots, tomatoes,cabbages, mangoes and pawpaws to add stock and meet her customers' demand.

She is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for its continuing support.

loans.use: To buy assorted vegetables and fruits to add stock to her green grocer shop and meet customers' demand.

loans.name: 030103130001.thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xuân works in agriculture, raising cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in future.

Xuân is 28 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 030103130001.Thiệu Phú solidarity group. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Xuân  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xuân  has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuân  has been involved in this business for 4 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Xếp hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Merly Maribel

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Merly,  tiene 37  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 2  hijos de 11 y 5 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es abogado. Viven  en casa arrendada.
Doña Merly es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo. Trabaja de lunes a sábados, de 9h00 a 5h30, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene cuatro años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, medias, faldas, etc. Está en el  Grupo De Crédito 3 años y le gusta por la unidad entre las compañeras y trabajo de la promotora. Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important beach in Ecuador, popular and visited for it's beautiful and inviting beaches. It is the largest deep water port in Ecuador and all of South America.

Merly lives in this place. She is 37 years old , married and from this relationship has two children aged 11 and 5 years old who study in Secondary and Primary school. Her husband is a lawyer. They live in a leased house. Merly is a housewife who in order to make her own resources and help her husband with the household expenses, works selling clothing of all types. She works from Monday to Saturday from 9 am until 5:30 pm. She leaves her products on credit and collects every 8 days. She has had this business for 4 years and things are going well for her.

This loan will be used to buy blouses, pants, underwear, socks, skirts, etc. She has been in the communal bank for 3 years and she likes it because of the closeness of the members and the work of the promoter. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, underwear, socks, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Munisa

texts.en:
Munisa is a hardworking woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1976. Tajikistan is one of the most amazing parts of the world, where rugged mountains and fabulous valleys, rushing mountain streams and quiet lakes with crystal clear water, Alpine meadows and mountain forests, create a wonderful harmony, which is characteristic only of the nature. 

Munisa has a big family. Her older son went to the army and her two other children are small. The standard of their living is hard and her husband does the business in agriculture. She has many years of experience in agriculture and wants to open a new business keeping livestock. She was one of participants at training provided by IMON to start-up clients. Now, she is asking financial support from IMON and Kiva lenders to get a loan and buy livestock. 

She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to open a new business keeping livestock.

loans.name: 030909150003.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hà works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hà is 35 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the 030909150003.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Hà lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Germania Ivonne

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Germania, tiene 39 años de edad y  está separada,  tiene dos hijos de 23 y 6 años, una  estudian en escuela y otra es mayor de edad e independiente. Viven en casa arrendada.
Doña Germania para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, etc.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija le ayuda en su trabajo cuando ella puede y está desocupada, ella puso su negocio con el primer crédito que le dio a fundación, tiene siete años  a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar leche, queso, huevos, yogurt  y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 7 años y le gusta porque el crédito es rápido y ágil, ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Su sueño es tener su  casa propia.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important and popular seaside resort in Ecuador. It is visited because of its beautiful and welcoming beaches. It was the first deep water port of Ecuador and South America.

Germania lives here. She is 39 years old and is separated with two children who are 23 and 6 years old. One studies in school and the other is an independent adult. They live in a rented house.

In order to bring up her family Germania has a grocery store in her home. There she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, beans, vegetables, fruit, etc. She works very day from 8:00AM until 7:00PM and sometimes later. Her daughter helps her in her work when she can and when she is not working. She opened her business with her first loan from the foundation. She has seven years of experience in this activity and it is going very well. 

She will use this loan to supply her store. She is going to buy milk, cheese, eggs, yogurt, and other staples. She has been in the Grupo de Crédito for seven years and she likes it because loans are fast and flexible. She has made many friends in the group. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy milk, cheese, eggs, yogurt, and other staples for her grocery store.

loans.name: Zhumabubu

texts.ru: Жумабубу, 52 года, не замужем, мать 2 детей, они взрослые и самостоятельные. У Жумабубу- среднее образование, уже 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Стартовав с 9,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у Жумабубу в хозяйстве есть 5 коров, лошадь и 15 овец, выращивает картофель и люцерну. Жумабубу в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки скота. Доходы от кредита Жумабубу хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Zhumabubu is 52 years old, unmarried, and the mother of two children who are grown up and independent. Zhumabubu has a secondary education, and for the past five years has been engaged in rearing animals and growing crops. Starting with 9,000 som (KGS), thanks to hard work, today Zhumabubu has has five cows, a horse and fifteen sheep on her smallholding, and grows potatoes and alfalfa. In order to further develop her smallholding, Zhumabubu has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. Zhumabubu wants to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of domesticated livestock, and plans to save up money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 49 years old. She is a married woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Susana has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a 11000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Susana has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Susana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very reliable person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Rose is representing her group of 16 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Rose has been a farmer for 10 years and, in order to earn enough to feed her family, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Rose is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 9.75 acres will be planted by Rose's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Furaha Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Rachael, a member of Furaha Self Help Group in Nakuru West, Kenya. She is a married mother of one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in April 2014.

Rachael practices maize and bean farming, and she is also a tailor. She is grateful to HiH EA for both the enterprise training she received and instilling in her a culture of saving. 

Rachael is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a sewing machine to put her sewing skills to good use. She will be able to earn extra income which will supplement her farming business. With this income, she will be able to better provide for her family's needs, such as food and medical care.

Rachael is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support. She promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rose, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 7 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 3 children, known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Rose joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has had more profits from each harvest. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Rose plans to save more money for the future.

Between the 7 farmers in Rose's Group, a total of 3.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en:
Mahina is a skillful woman. She was born in Tajikistan in 1994. This is one of the most amazing parts of the world, where rugged mountains and fabulous valleys, rushing mountain streams and quiet lakes with crystal clear water, Alpine meadows and mountain forests create a wonderful harmony, which is characteristic only of nature. 

Mahina is single and lives with her parents. She is a goal-oriented and hardworking woman. Her family's standard of living was hard before Mahina decided to open her business of serving people. Before, she was busy in agriculture with her parents, but then she participated in training provided by IMON International and decided to open a beauty salon. 

As she lives in a rural area, there had been no opportunity to open a salon by her, so she requested a loan to open a beauty salon. She has experience in this field of business and has clients who want to use her service. She wishes to have permanent clients and be useful to residents of this area.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon

loans.name: 030904160002.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nga works in agriculture raising cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase more calves to raise and sell. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. 

Nga is 62 years old, and she is a married mother of one child. She lives with no dependents in Thiệu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoá province. She leads a 4-member group, the 030904160002.Thiệu Dương solidarity group. 

In 2011, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and since then, she has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more calves to raise and sell.

loans.name: Bwera Bakali Babughirana Group

texts.en:
Moses is 57 years old, still strong, married with six children, and a member of Bwera Bakali Babughirana group who lives in Kasese Uganda. 

He has run a hardware shop for ten years now which he began with 1,000,000 UGX which he borrowed from Hofokam. He now has a stock of around 15 million. He has a dream of expanding his business into wholesale. However, he is faced with the challenges of competition and high license fees. 

Moses intends to use the loan to buy cement, paint, and iron bars for selling.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint, and iron bars for selling.

loans.name: Lech's Group

texts.en:
Lech, 51, is a married mother of four dependent children, living in Kampong Thom province. Growing rice has been the main source of her income for more than five years, and working for other farms supplements her income. She could earn about 60,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for her group, which contain of four members. As a leader, she will use her portion to buy a decent latrine for her family’s use. She hopes that this loan will help her to have a better, healthier standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Josphat's Group

texts.en:
Josphat is the group leader of his group in Matete District, and he is representing ten farmers, including himself. He is married and a proud father of four children. Josphat joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for thirteen years.

Like many other farmers, Josphat decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed his family. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to invest in a business.

Josphat's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of seven acres of land. They will also receive a total of three solar lights, as, even though Josphat decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna signed up her membership with Paglaum MPC in 2010. She has accessed several loans already. She has paid all her obligations in a timely manner. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. 

In the future, Lorna wants to open a market stall where she can display her farm produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 20-year-old single man from Dier El Balah city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family’s needs.

Mahmoud works in transferring goods using his rickshaw. It is a good business and supports the family with a good income.

Mahmoud took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy goods from the wholesalers and resell them to the local traders. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions.

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy goods from the wholesalers and resell them to the local traders.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
Jaramijó por el hecho de estar frente al Océano Pacifico hace que sus habitantes  se dediquen a la pesca artesanal y sea su mayor soporte económico para sus familias y para la provincia,  cuentan con un muelle propicio para acoderar más de 300 embarcaciones de menor calado frente al mirador turístico el peñón.
En este lugar vive la señora, María  tiene  47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6  hijos, tres mayores de edad e independientes y tres de 16, 13 y 6 años de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es pescador.
Doña María es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de jugos que ella mismo elabora, colas, hielo, bolos y venta de anzuelos para la pesca. Trabaja todos los días, tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para implementar una mini tienda comprando anzuelos, colas, jugos, fundas, vasos, caramelos, leche, entre otros. Está en el Grupo De Crédito 4 años y le gusta porque el asesor es responsable y está pendiente. Su sueño es tener su negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Due to the fact that Jaramijó is by the Pacific Ocean, its inhabitants devote themselves to fishing.  It is their greatest financial support for their families and for the province.  They have an advantageous wharf that accommodates over 300 small vessels from the tourist spot of El Peñón.

María, age 47, lives in this place.  She is married, and they have six children.  The three oldest are independent.  The other three are 16, 13, and 6 years old.  They go to high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

María is a housewife who, in order to get her own resources to help her husband with the household expenses, sells juices that she makes herself.  She also sells colas, ice, ‘bolos’ [a frozen sweet in a plastic sleeve], and fishing bait.  She works every day.  She has been engaged in this business activity for ten years, and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to set up a mini-store by purchasing bait, colas, juices, bags, cups, candy, and milk, among other items.

She has been in her loan group for four years.  She likes it because the adviser is responsible and alert.  María’s dream is to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy bait, colas, juices, bags, cups, candy, and milk, among other items.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 53, is living in Russey Keo district of Phnom Penh city, and she is a mother of five children. 

Selling beverages has been the main source of her family’s income for ten years and to earn more income, her husband also works as a construction worker. She could earn about USD $6.98 per day. 

This is the fourth loan for her with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She applies for this loan in order to pay for school fees and buy some training tools to support her child’s studying. 

She hopes that her children will have their own skills in the future.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and buy some training tools

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man with one dependent living in Kasese, Uganda. Jackson sells textiles, and he has been in that business since 2000. He practices farming to earn additional income to meet his family's increasing demands. 

Jackson dreams of expanding his business, but is limited by inadequate capital and high transport costs to the market. Jackson wants money to buy clothes, bags and shoes to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bags and shoes to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Cerestine

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Cerestine from Kenyenya, Kenya, a woman from a community not known for farming, but one who is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married and together with her husband, is blessed with a lovely family.

For the past five years, Cerestine has been practicing mixed farming and, due to the experience she has, commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers who regard her as a mentor. Selling milk, eggs, and vegetables has allowed her to earn a decent income. To make extra money, Cerestine also engages in a small personal business.

Cerestine passionately loves dairy farming, and one of the animals on her farm has been given a nickname. Milking and feeding the cow makes her very proud. Through milk selling, she has had quite good returns, and the demand for milk has been expanding. Through extensive use of her mobile phone, she has been receiving orders from customers.

Because demand has been overwhelming, Cerestine is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow, a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce 10-20 litres of rich, creamy milk daily. The increased milk production will result in more income, and Cerestine will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children.

When people listen to Cerestine speak, they can be forgiven for thinking that she is an expert in dairy farming because of her passion and determination. This loan will permanently change the living standards of Cerestine, and there is no doubt that rewarding employment can be found in dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is an old member of BRAC and is taking her third loan. She is receiving this loan for her husband; in fact, he drives an auto rickshaw.

He has been driving the auto rickshaw for many years using petrol, which is very costly nowadays. Due to the increase in the cost of petrol, he wants to convert his auto rickshaw over to LP gas, but his rickshaw does not have a CNG kit.

Therefore, Sajida contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, her husband will buy a CNG kit for his rickshaw so that he can minimize the fuel cost and can grow his income.

Sajida seems very happy after receiving this loan and thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new CNG kit (for conversion to natural gas) for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida used her loan for 50,000 PHP loan for the repair and maintenance of her jeepney. Her earnings helped with the education costs for her children and with her family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

Bienvinida requested another loan for 51,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase tires and for the maintenance of her jeepney.  Her income from her transportation business will cover her family's everyday needs and assist her less fortunate relatives. 

Bienvinida hopes to buy one more jeepney for her transportation business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for and to maintain for her jeepney

loans.name: Sasha

texts.en:
Sasha is 30 years old and he lives with his lovely mother in Gavar city of Gegharkunik region. He also has two sisters and, being already married, they live separately with their families.

Sasha has a higher economical education, and he works at a private company and simultaneously is engaged in farming. Of course, his farm is very small since here he has only five cows and ten chickens, but he seriously decided to make it bigger and richer with farm animals. Still, from his farm he sells eggs, milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, curd, and butter made by his mother.

Sasha greatly wants to start selling meat from his farm, which may bring significant income to his family. So, to realize this idea, he hopes Kiva lenders will support him with a loan amount of 700,000 Armenian drams. He wants to buy two calves and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two calves and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 60 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the village of Nerkin Hand in the Syunik region. Aida’s two sons are married and live separately. Her husband is a farmer and together they do their best to take care of their family and pay for their daughter’s education. Aida has worked at the village library as a librarian for many years and is also good at farming. Her farm has cows, calves, pigs, chickens and many bee colonies. She sells many farm products herself, including milk, cheese, macun (a national dairy-product), curd, meat, eggs and honey. She farms with help from her husband. On their plot of land they have a lot of fruit trees such as apple, fig, persimmon, mulberry, apricot and plum. They sell the produce from these trees to re-sellers. Aida also has several farm machines (a truck, a hay mowing machine and a tractor) which her husband uses both for their land and also to work neighbor's land for a fee. She has requested this loan to repair and fuel several of their machines.

loans.use: to repair and fuel farm equipment.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз, 43 года, замужем. У нее - высшее образование, работает в музыкальной школе преподавателем. С 1991 года занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая свою семью доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдыз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, лошадь, 8 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнес деятельности составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Жылдыз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку  дойной коровы для увеличения объемов продажи экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита позволят Жылдыз развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Zhyldyz is 43 years old and married. She has a higher education and works as a teacher in a music school. She has been engaged in farming since 1991, providing for her family with the income. Thanks to Zhyldyz's hard work, today her smallholding has a cow, a horse, and eight sheep. The monthly profit from the business is about 15,000 som (KGS). Zhyldyz has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow to increase her sales of organic milk. The income from the loan will allow Zhyldyz to develop her business and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase organic milk sales.

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Matete District. She is 48 years old, is married, and has 7 children.

Lilian likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Lilian plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Lilian’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 63 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos todos ellos ya cuentan con su propia familia, él vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Miguel para obtener sus ingresos  y sostener  a su familia trabaja como farmacéutico desde hace 30 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes y cultivo de café, gracias a esta labor ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Miguel ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito que lo utilizara para remodelar el piso de su casa, ya que con la que cuenta se encuentra ya en mal estado.
El objetivo de esta remodelación es brindarle a su familia una mejor comodidad y el sueña con tener una farmacia propia.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 63-year-old man. He is married, and he has a beautiful family of five children. All of his children already have their own families. He lives in a community in Suchitepéquez.

In order to obtain an income and support his family, Miguel has been working as a pharmacist for the past 30 years. Hoping to improve his earnings, he also has a grocery store as well as coffee crops. Thanks to this work, he has been able to move his family forward.

Miguel has now decided to request a loan, which he will use to remodel the floor of his house because his current floor is in poor condition. The goal of this remodeling is to give his family greater comfort. He dreams of having his own pharmacy.

loans.use: to remodel the floor of his house.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 30-year-old old lady. She is married and is passing her life with her two children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is taking loan for her husband because he owns an embroidery shop. He has been selling raw embroidery materials for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles, and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive, but its turnover is very high. 

Due to high costs, he is facing a shortage of materials and is unable to purchase expensive raw materials to sell. Therefore, Bushra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can overcome the shortage of embroidery materials. With this loan he will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones, and pearls of various colors.

Bushra is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase raw embroidery materials for her husband to resell from his shop.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 26 años de edad es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 4 y 11 años de edad, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuela desde hace 10 años se dedica a la compra y venta de barrotes, esta actividad lo realiza con el fin de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia.
Manuela gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende su tienda tiene mucha demanda, por lo que ahora ve la necesidad de mejorar sus servicios comprando más productos como arroz, golosinas, dulces, jugos, azúcar, pero ella no tiene el capital necesario por tal razón solicita el crédito para comprar sus productos.
Manuela tiene el anhelo  de comprar un terreno para construir una tienda.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 26 year old married woman who with a lovely family of three children ages 4 to 11. This lovely family lives in the community of Solola. For 10 years Manuela's job has been buying and selling groceries, and she does this work to generate income to support her family. Thanks to her friendly service Manuela has lots of customers so she now sees a need to improve her service by purchasing more products such as rice, sweets, candies, juices, and sugar but she lacks the necessary capital. For this reason she's applying for a loan to purchase more products.

Manuela's dream is to purchase some land and build a store.

loans.use: To purchase groceries such as: rice, sweets, candies, juices, and sugar.

loans.name: Saroeury

texts.en:
Saroeury, 24, is a villager living in Pouk district of Siem Reap province. Growing rice has been the source of his income for six years, and he has been working in hotel service to earn additional income for a year. Through these businesses, he can earn about USD 9.20 per day.

Now he is applying for this loan in order to pay for his school fee for his second year of studying. He hopes that he can continue his studying until he graduates.

loans.use: to pay for his school fee.

loans.name: Langalanga Organic Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Pauline, a member of LangaLanga Organic Farmers Self-Help Group. She is fifty-five years old and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in June 2014.

She does poultry and vegetable farming. Pauline is grateful to HiH EA for enterprise training and broadening her mind in business ideas. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase chicks and chicken feed. This will enable her to increase her poultry flock and satisfy the demand for eggs in her locality. With better income, she will educate her children and meet other family needs.

Pauline is happy for Kiva and their lenders for their support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed that will improve egg production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle and increase the headcount of his herd.

loans.name: Azza

texts.en:
Azza is a 33-year-old married woman from Dier Al-Balah city. She is a mother for two sons and one daughter. Her husband is an employee in the public sector. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Azza took USD loan from FATEN to buy a new solar system for heating water. This system helps Azza to decrease electricity expenses for the family.

Azza appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new solar system for heating water.

loans.name: 030906070003.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Chiến has a retail business selling shoes. She is applying for a loan to purchase more shoes to resell. 

Chiến is 22 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the 030906070003.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Chiến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chiến has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chiến has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Chiến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and to make enough money to provide for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 31-year-old divorced woman from Gaza. She is a mother for one son. 

Fatima has a good talent and potential to become a skilled tailor. She makes traditional clothing. 

She took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to buy yarns and fabrics. By taking this loan, Fatima will use the materials to make new dresses to sell. 

After taking this loan, Fatima will increase productivity and also her income.

Fatima appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy yarn and fabrics for her new business

loans.name: Petronilla

texts.en:
Petronilla is a 60 years old, married to James, and she supports six family members. 

She has been a small scale farmer for the last 20 years, and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES. 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which she plans to buy a dairy cow to enable her make rental houses from the sale of the milk. 

Her hope is to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan, and to educate her children to higher levels. Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her make rental houses from the sale of milk.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran sends his greatest thanks to Kiva and Nor Horizon for his first loan and greatly relies on the second support.

He graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of Painting and Drawing. As previously, he lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. He is a Deputy Director of Education at the school, and at the same time, he is a lecturer in drawing and painting at the college.

Tigran, in his small workshop, takes orders for different pictures and paints them here, sometimes for sale and sometimes just for him. He has a nice collection of paintings, which as he says, he can never sell since he is in love with these. This artistic person is much respected and beloved by his students, who are so thankful to him for the precious knowledge that he gives them.

This time, with the Kiva loan amount, he wants to buy a computer with more modern capabilities, which will be useful in his work, and also to buy canvases for painting.

loans.use: to buy a computer with more modern capabilities, which will be useful in his work, and also to buy canvases for painting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him to buy plots from the sale of milk.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Wonderful Lenders! The above picture presents to you Joshua, who is a hard-working, creative, and ingenious man and a passionate farmer. He is the father of three lovely children. He hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya, a region known for growing bananas.

Joshua was raised in challenging circumstances and his basic needs were never covered, so he vowed he would turn his life around and live a comfortable life. That is why he started mixed farming, and he has been farming for the past 42 years. Through dedication, hard work and commitment, he has been able to provide for the basic needs of his family. 

Although he makes some profit, he has the challenge of an inadequate water supply for irrigating his crops and even for his home consumption. Most of the rain water is wasted, and Joshua wants to harvest that water. That is why he is kindly requesting a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. The Nkubu area has no piped water, and this means that you have to travel for long distances in search of “this precious commodity.” But, with the loan, he will be able to store water for home consumption. The loan will also help Joshua irrigate his farm. He plans to use the sprinkle irrigation method, so that there will be a high production level on his farm. Joshua always says water is a very precious commodity and should not go to waste. 

Having access to funds is very challenging for smallholder farmers in Kenya, but with partners such as Kiva and Juhudi Kilimo, Joshua is sure that his dreams will become a reality and he will be able to improve his living conditions. The profits from increased production of crops will be used to repay the loan and also to improve his living conditions. He also plans to buy more water tanks and water pipes so that he can harvest as much water as possible. 

Joshua awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a smallholder farmer in Etono, located in the Kenyenya region of Kenya. She is in love with farming. She started farming 10 years ago, around the same time she got married. The couple engages in numerous income-generating activities to provide for their children. Linet keeps a dairy cow and poultry birds, for milk, and eggs, for both consumption and sale. 

She is seeking a loan to add another dairy cow on their farm. This investment will double her milk production quantity when both cows are on their lactation days, and cushion shortages on 'off-lactation' days (so to speak). This investment will ensure a steady flow of income throughout the year and less dependence on her husband.

A portion of the profits that will remain, after feeding the family, will be rolled back into the business for development and maintenance. 

Help Linet scale up her business and elevate her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a second dairy cow.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 31-year-old married, hardworking lady with seven children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a retail shop of general merchandise, plus a small bar and farming to get additional income. Limited capital alongside price fluctuations hinder her business growth. 

Margret wants a loan to buy beers, sodas, sugar, salt, and cooking oil for selling.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, sugar, salt, and cooking oil for selling.

loans.name: Shahen

texts.en:
Shahen lives and runs his farm in the village Geghamavan of Gegharkunik region. He lives with his wife and son. His son works at the local police station. 

For a long time, Shahen used to work as a driver, but now his single occupation is farming. He has cows, calves, a bull, a heifer, sheep, piglets and chickens. Shahen is a very active and skilled farmer and, he also very skillfully finds customers for his farm products. He sells his farm’s milk, macun (a national dairy-product), meat (beef, mutton and pork) and eggs. He manages all his work about his farm with his beloved wife. 

Shahen asks a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams, as he wants to buy two pigs and enlarge his meat selling, especially pork selling, since it is greatly demanded by his customers.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and enlarge his meat selling

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 29-year-old woman living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her brother is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three-wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving it and is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body. Therefore, Farah has requested a loan for her brother so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. Farah hopes that now her brother will be able to generate more income. 

Farah is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her brother in purchasing a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
Paul is a 40-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Paul has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Paul described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Paul’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Esther, who is 42 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in April 2014.

Esther is a maize, beans, and dairy farmer. She is grateful to HiH EA for the enterprise training that has enabled her pursue farming as a business, unlike before when she practiced subsistence farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase feed and inseminate her cow. She hopes to obtain higher milk production and thus more income. This will allow her to provide family needs such as food and education for her children.

Esther is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed and pay for cow insemination, which will help boost milk productivity.

loans.name: María Soledad

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 49  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 2 hijos de 31 y 13 años, uno es mayor de edad e independiente y el otro estudia en colegio. Su esposo es gasfitero.
Doña María es un ama de casa que para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo. Trabaja de lunes a sábados cuatro horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, su esposo le ayuda en las ventas.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa. Esta en el grupo de crédito  7 años y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos y es rápido. Su sueño es  tener su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered to be the most important and popular seaside resort town in Ecuador because of its beautiful, friendly beaches. It was the first deep sea port in Ecuador and South America.

This place is where the señora María lives. She is 49 years old, married, and she and her husband have two children, ages 31 and 13. One is of age and independent and the other studies in secondary school. Her husband is a plumber.

Doña María is a housewife who sells all kinds of clothing to help her husband with the expenses of there home. She works Mondays through Saturdays, four hours a day. She sells her products on credit and charges every eight days. She has been doing this for three years and it goes very well for her. Her husband helps her with the sales.

This loan is for purchasing clothing. She has been in this credit group for seven years and she likes it because the interest is low and it's fast. Her dream is to have a well-stocked business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is a 33-year-old young businessman who lives with his parents in Vanadzor city of Lori region. He is thankful for his first deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon, which greatly developed his business. He hopes that this time, it will be profitable as well.

Arman has already for seven years been running a delivery business around his region. He delivers juices, other drinks, and cans for nearly 300 small and big markets of Lori region. In his business, his father greatly helps him now, especially with bringing all the needed products from Yerevan.

Arman manages his business using his own truck, which he managed to buy thanks to his business income. Now Arman has a new idea, and he hopes that Kiva lenders will help him one more time to realize it. With this loan amount, he wants to buy an assortment of household goods that, with his usual products, he will deliver to the markets of villages far from the city, where people have a lack of assortment in household goods.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of household goods that, with his usual products, he will deliver to the markets.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 64 years old and single.

Denia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Denia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Denia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina, 37, lives in the village of Zovaber in the Gegharkunik region of Albania. Her husband goes abroad for seasonal work, and she stays with her two sons and father-in-law, who is poor health, in their little house.

Evelina has become a skilled farmer, as all of the care of her farm is in her hands when her husband is gone. She has a cow, sheep and chickens, which enables her to make some money by selling some of the milk, a little meat and eggs.

Evelina says if not for her husband’s support from abroad, her small farm’s income would not be enough to cover her family’s everyday needs. Therefore, she is applying for a 500,000 AMD loan through Kiva’s partner Nor Horizon to buy another cow and five sheep. She wants to expand her farm and hopes that Kiva lenders will help her make this possible.

loans.use: to buy a cow and five sheep for her farm

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is forty years old, married and has four children. She has been a farmer for ten years and is often referred to as a very reliable person. She is also the leader of a One Acre Fund group comprised of eleven farmers in the Matete district of Kenya.

Grace joined the One Acre Fund program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year Grace will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during the night and have a way to charge her phone.

Overall, Grace's Group is receiving a 101,400 KES loan, which will be used on farming inputs to be planted on a total of 6.25 acres. The group will also be buying a total of ten solar lights.

loans.use: to buy hybrid maize seed and fertilizer plus two solar lights

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan tiene una carpintería, y a la vez también trabaja como guardia de seguridad, es una persona muy trabajadora que esta poniendo todo de si para poder crecer y salir adelante. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder comprar materias primas para su carpintería, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para la compra de maderas varias para su carpintería, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con su negocio como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The señor Juan has a carpentry business and also works as a security guard. He is a very hardworking person who is giving his all to be able to grow and get ahead. He commented that his previous loan was used to purchase primary materials for his carpentry business and it was extremely helpful.

Today, he is requesting another loan for the purchase of various types of wood for his carpentry business, which will be of great help to hime in order to continue with his business. He is grateful for this new opportunity he receives to improve his life.

loans.use: to purchase different types of wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La Sra. Wilma es de la ciudad de Concepción, ella se dedica a las confecciones de prendas para damas y prendas deportivas, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros, para poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo, y de esta forma poder continuar con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Wilma is from the city of Concepcion, she makes women's clothing and active wear for a living. She is a very hard-working and determined woman who is putting forth her best effort to be able to grow and move forward.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other things so she can continue making clothing as she has been doing.

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to allow her to grow.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other things.

loans.name: Dado Group

texts.en:
Najla, 51, is the second woman from the right in this group photo (Diana is on the far left, Rana is next and Dalia is on the right). She is married and has six children. For seventeen years Najla has worked hard selling clothes from her home to provide necessities for her family and pay for her children’s school expenses.

Najla is the leader of the Dado Group, which is comprised of these four ambitious women who work hard to develop their businesses and are seeking better incomes and ways of life. The women are seeking a 1,600 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to be apportioned among them.

Najla will be using her portion to buy a special spring and summer collection to sell. She hopes that in the future she can open her own clothes shop and please her customers.

loans.use: to buy a special spring and summer clothing collection to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family. Ahmed's father owns a coffee shop which has been open for the past 15 years. Ahmed thinks he will improve his family business.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy soft drinks from the wholesalers and buy new chairs and tables for the cafe. This will increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks from the wholesalers and buy new chairs and tables for his cafe.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en: This young man is 27 years old and he lives with his nice wife and a year-old daughter in the village of Geghamavan in the Gegharkunik region. Arman has higher education and he graduated from Polytechnic Institute in the faculty of Transport, but being born in this village and greatly interested in farming, he decided to stay in his native village and develop the farm that his father once established and he had inherited. Now on his farm Arman has cows, calves, bulls, heifers, sheep and chickens. With the help of his nice wife, Arman sells milk, meat and eggs and also his land’s harvest – potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes and greens. As mentioned, Arman is happy and full of new ideas connected with his farm and is sure that he will manage to develop it and be richer with cattle. He needs this loan in order to buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel for his land cultivation and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel for his land cultivation and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela es una muchacha de 24 años, es soltera y tiene una hija de siete años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Micaela con el afán de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia cuenta con un molino de nixtamal desde hace cuatro años con el que obtiene ganancias y mantiene a su hija.
Con el paso de los años el uso constante que se le da al molino, ha afectado ahora los ingresos de Micaela porque el molino ya no responde como deberá ser, por tal motivo ella ha decidido comprar otro, pero ella no cuenta con el dinero necesario por tal razón solicita un crédito para comprar un molino de nixtamal.
Ella anhela seguir prosperando con su tienda para mejorar sus ingresos así mismo comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Micaela is a 24-year-old young woman. She is single and has a seven-year-old daughter. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá.

Micaela, with the eagerness to generate her own earnings and take care of her family. She has had a nixtamal (boiled corn) grinder for four years and with the machine, she makes a living and takes care of her daughter.

With the passage of time, the constant use of her grinder has affected Micaela's earnings because the machine no longer responds as it should. Because of this, Micaela has decided to purchase another machine, but she doesn't have enough money. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase a nixtamal grinder.

She yearns to continue prospering with her shop in order to improve her income and to purchase a plot of land to construct her house.

loans.use: to purchase a nixtamal (boiled corn) grinder.

loans.name: Nafosat

texts.en:
Nafosat is a skillful woman. She was born in Tajikistan in 1986. She is living in a rural area. 

Among the sky-high mountain peaks, glaciers and flowing from beneath them the rivers, among Alpine meadows and mountain forests with numerous springs, you feel that time stops your progress and gives an opportunity to be alone and throw away all your cargo of worldly vanities and stay alone with nature. 

She is married and has two children. Her husband does business in agriculture. Nafosat wanted to help her husband with their finances and decided to start a business and earn money to raise their children and feed the family. She participated in training provided by IMON to startup clients. She is planning to buy livestock and open a business. 

She requested a loan to buy livestock and open her business. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy livestock and open a business

loans.name: Emitiot Interest Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Judy, who is twenty-nine years old and married and has four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. 

She does farming of maize, potatoes, and beans. She gained knowledge through Hand in Hand training on enterprise start-up and development. 

She is borrowing a loan to boost potato farming and purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer in order to increase her produce, thus meeting the demand for potatoes in the area. This will improve her income and put her in a position to continue supporting her family's needs, thus improving their standard of living. 

Judy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds to improve productivity and thus help boost farming.

loans.name: Vibol

texts.en: Vibol is a 21-year-old single freshman, and he lives with his parents in the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. His parents are in business. Vibol is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in management of human resources. Currently, he is lacking the finances to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year, so he has decided to take out a loan. With the loan, he will be able to graduate and earn skills for his future job. For his future dreams, he wants to have a good job with a reasonable salary, and therefore will be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es una persona muy trabajadora que viene trabajando en la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo esta creciendo y saliendo adelante, tiene ya muy buena clientela y es por ello que le va mu bien. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en la compra de productos varios para la venta.
El pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias, artículos de bazar y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hard-working person who makes a living selling all types of products as a street vendor. He mentions that luckily for his efforts, he is growing and moving forward. He already has a good customer base, which is why things are going well for him. 

His previous loan was used to buy various products to sell. He is asking for this new loan to buy an assortment of clothing, bazaar items and other things, with which he will be able to continue his sales as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothing, bazaar items and other things.

loans.name: Las Chavas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Chavas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Yessica, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo ha ido mejorando cada día.
Ella se dedica a hacer y vender tortas de todo tipo para eventos, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, y es con ello que mantiene a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus tortas como ser: harina, levadura, dulce de leche, manteca, huevos y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group Las Chavas is in its first cycle with the women's committee program. They are completing the poverty elimination survey. 

Yessica is one of the members of this group. She has been gradually improving day by day through her effort and consistent work. She works baking and selling cakes for all sorts of events. This woman is very good at what she does, and her work allows her to support her family and her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy ingredients for baking her cakes, such as flour, baking powder, condensed milk, lard, eggs, and other items. This will allow her to continue working as she has been doing thus far. She is grateful for this opportunity to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the course fees for his study

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
