Elham is a 46-year-old widowed mother of two children. She is totally responsible for raising and supporting her children since her husband passed away in 2008. She is a Palestinian refugee living in a camp like most Palestinians living in Lebanon who subsist through low-income businesses.

Elham sells jewelry from her home. She is well known in her region and knows how to sell her products well. She has requested a 1,000 USD loan to be used to pay for her daughter-in-law to travel to Jordan to see her parents. Elham is very proud of her children and hopes to stay healthy and able to support them as much as she can.

loans.use: pay for her daughter-in-law to travel to Jordan to see her parents.

loans.name: Georgina Del Jesús

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Georgina, tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres  hijos de 25, 24 y 17 años, los dos mayores son independientes y la última estudia en colegio. Ella vive en casa arrendada.
Doña Georgina aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, ahí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas y  niñas, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares. Trabaja sola de lunes a viernes y tiene 30 años a esta actividad. También hace cinco años tiene el servicio de  hospedaje para estudiantes.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y materiales para la costura y hacer adecuaciones en los cuartos para los huéspedes. Su sueño es comprar una casa.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered to be the most important, popular, and visited resort town in Ecuador as a result of its beautiful and welcoming beaches. It is the first deepwater port in Ecuador and South America.

In this place lives Georgina. She is 59 years old, and she is a single mother with three children, who are 25, 24, and 17 years old. Her two oldest children are independent, and the youngest is in school. She lives in a rented house.

Georgina, taking advantage of her knowledge of dressmaking, established a small sewing workshop at her house. There, she spends her time making all kinds of clothing for women and girls. She works based on orders from certain individuals. She works alone from Monday through Friday, and she has been in this business for 30 years. In addition, she has been offering accommodations to students for the past five years.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics and materials for sewing and to make improvements to her guest rooms. Her dream is to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials for sewing and to make improvements to her guest rooms.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 53-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son. He is a tailor and very expert in his profession. He has been sewing clothes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot of experience in his profession. His sewing machine has become out of order and it needs to be replaced with a new one, but he does not have sufficient money to buy a new machine. Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan for her son, so that he can buy a new professional sewing machine as well as an additional over-lock machine. Her family has to do hard work to generate income for a huge family. Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son purchase a sewing and over-lock machine.

loans.name: Atom

texts.en:
Atom is 27 years old and lives with his nice woman in the village Geghamavan in Gegharkunik region. They are just married and are also doing their first steps in establishing a farm and earning their living cleverly thanks to their farming. 

Now in his farm, Atom has cows, calves, bulls, and heifers. Atom sells his farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product) made by his wife, and also meat. As Atom describes, he is happy with his occupation and dreams of the day that his children will also help them in farming and each of his family members will develop the farm on its turn. 

Now Atom asks this loan as he needs to buy fodder for his farm cattle. He is sure that, in the future, Kiva and Nor Horizon will also have important role in his farm development.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Washington Octavio

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive señor Washington, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 8 y 1 años. Su esposa es comerciante de ropa. 
Don Washington es comerciante de pecado, conchas, camarones, calamares y otros frutos del mar desde hace ocho años, él trabaja de lunes a sábados todo el día,  en su casa vende  sus productos en gran cantidad ya que él es distribuidor. Trabaja solo y tiene ocho años en este negocio, siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren porque tiene buen marisco, a buen precio y fresco. Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pescado, camarones, conchas, calamares, etc. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 ciclos y le gusta porque tiene buena organización. Su sueño es tener un gran depósito de mariscos.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most impprtant, popular, and busiest seaside resort in Ecuador because of its beautiful and welcoming beaches, the first deepwater port of Ecuador and South America.
This is where Washington lives, a 40 year old man in a commonlaw marriage that has given him two children ages 8 and 1. His wife is a clothing salesperson.
Washington has sold fish, shells, shrimp, squid, and other bounties of the sea for eight years. He works from Monday to Saturday all day, selling large amounts of products from his home since he's a distributor. He works by himself and has been in this business for eight years. Things have always gone very well for him because his customers prefer his good seafood because of its freshness and the good prices. He'll be using this loan to purchase fish, shrimp. shells, squid, etc. He's been in the borrowing group for 3 cycles and he likes it because it's well organized. His dream is to have a great seafood warehouse.

loans.use: To purchase fish, shrimp, shells, and squid, etc.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 44-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He has been working as a barber for seventeen years. He is a hard worker and sacrificing father who is trying hard to improve his family's living conditions inside the camp, thus today Adnan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate his house in order to make it a better and healthier place for his family.

Adnan hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of providing his family with better financial and social living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his house to improve his family's living conditions inside the camp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance, and new mobile phones to resell.

loans.name: Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Trabajadoras está en su ciclo número 1° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gladys, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que quiere salir adelante, y es por eso que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas para la venta, como camisas, remeras, pantalones, jeans y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The "Trabajadoras" group is in its first season of the women's communal bank program, where they all work and help each other get ahead.
They are conducting a survey to eliminate poverty, where each one puts forth their best effort to be able to move forward.

One of the members is Gladys, who makes a living selling an assortment of clothing. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who wants to be successful. This is why she is trying her best to help her family and loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to buy clothing to sell such as dress shirts, t-shirts, pants, jeans and other things to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to help her grow and to help her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy dress shirts, t-shirts, pants, jeans and other things to sell.

loans.name: Romel David

texts.es:
Hace 13 años, Romel comenzó con la venta de ropa interior,  en varias zonas aledañas a su hogar, con el tiempo atrajo muchos clientes que le demandaron más mercadería, por lo cual, amplió su negocio hasta convertirlo en una línea de ropa que le provee mercancía a distribuidoras y boutiques.
 
Para mantener satisfechos a sus clientes, solicita un préstamo para la compra de camisas, pantalones, ropa interior, blusas, jeans, camisolines, etc. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer mayor variedad y calidad en sus productos, en consiguiente aumentará las ventas y las ganancias. Entre los planes de Romel esta convertirse en un distribuidor mayorista y  mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en:
Thirteen years ago, Romel started selling underwear in several areas around his home. In time he attracted many customers who demanded more merchandise, which is why he expanded his business until it became a clothing line providing merchandise to distributors and boutiques.
 
In order to keep his customers satisfied, he is requesting a loan to buy shirts, pants, underwear, blouses, jeans, camisoles, etc. This will help him because he will be able to offer a wider variety of higher quality products. This will translate into increased sales and profit. One of Romel's plans is to become a wholesale distributor. He also wants to improve his home infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, underwear, blouses, jeans, camisoles, etc.

loans.name: Zhaneta

texts.en: Zhaneta is 44 years old and she lives with her son in the village of Geghamavan in the Gegharkunik region. Zhaneta’s husband regularly goes to the Russian Federation to work abroad, and sometimes for a long time Zhaneta is left alone with her farm work. Her son is also employed and he comes back very late from his work and does not manage to help his mother. On her farm Zhaneta has a not small quantity of cattle such as cows, calves, sheep and chickens. She sells a rather great amount of milk, meat and chickens. She is also engaged in land cultivation and on it she cultivates potatoes, greens and cabbage. Zhaneta sells all her farm products at the wholesale market during the week. Zhaneta is asking for this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams as she needs to buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel and fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel and fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Hedaya

texts.en:
Hedaya, 20, is single and lives with her parents and seven brothers and sisters in a small house in Nablus. Her father works in construction, sporadic work from which he receives a low income.

Hedaya is a university student; her studies are in technology. She has taken out an 840 USD murabaha loan (a type of loan compliant with shariah law) from FATEN. This will help her buy a new laptop that will help her to do her homework and write reports easily.

Hedaya’s plans are to get her BA degree and find a job to help her family cover their expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to help her in her studies.

loans.name: Bisan

texts.en:
Bisan is a 19-year-old single lady from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a small house. Her father works as an employee and gets a low and unstable income. Bisan is a university student studying elementary education. She would like to take the BA degree and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses.

Bisan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. This will help her to do her homework and write reports easily.

Bisan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit, age 48, lives in a village in Kutaisi district with his wife and two children. Davit keeps busy running the family's small-scale dairy farm. They have five milk cows and produce cheese to sell at the market. 

Davit has requested credit for the purpose of building a greenhouse. The new business will be an additional source of the income for the family, which will allow them to combat the poverty in which they live. Davit’s loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program offers business start-up capital and re-startup credit with generous lending conditions to country rural poor, who often do not have access to credit as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Davit will purchase materials for greenhouse construction (iron pillars and polyethylene covering) and will then construct the greenhouse where vegetables and greens will be grown throughout the year. The family will work in the greenhouse themselves. They will sell their harvested produce at the local open market. The income of the family will significantly increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Veronica's Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 32 years old and is often described as a very reliable person. She has two children and is married. As a group leader, Veronica is representing her group of 12 farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Veronica's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce their consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Veronica and her group will receive a total of eight solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Neddy's Group

texts.en:
Neddy, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She is 49 years old and a married mother of 11 children, and she is often described as a very experienced farmer. 

Although Neddy has been a farmer for more than 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Neddy wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Neddy hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights, as, even though Neddy decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian, pictured above, has been a farmer for 10 years and is now proud to represent her group of 15 farmers in Matete District. She is 35 years old, is married, and has five children.

Lilian likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Lilian plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Lilian’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 10 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anwer

texts.en:
Anwer is 57 and her husband has grown old and stays at home. She is the mother of eight children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Anwer sews bags along with her two daughters and two sons at home to feed her family. She has two sewing machines for sewing schoolbags, handbags and wallets, which are operated by her daughters. Both of her sons deal with outside customers, take orders from them and sew the bags on order.

Anwer wants to sell her sewed bags directly into the market, so that she can get the maximum reward for their mutual efforts. However, she does not have initial capital to buy raw material for sewing bags and wallets.

Anwer requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy raw material such as leather, rexine, zippers, buckles, etc. for sewing wallets and bags.

Anwer thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, leather, rexine, zippers, buckles and spools for sewing bags and wallets.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith is 55 years old and has six children. For the past ten years she has farmed her land. She is also the leader of a One Acre Fund group comprised of sixteen farmers in the Matete district of Kenya.

Judith joined the One Acre Fund program in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to access quality training and acquire new farming methods. While she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have an even better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Judith's Group is applying for a 162,160 KES loan, which will be used on farming inputs to be planted on a total of 11.75 acres. The group will also be buying eleven solar lights.

Judith decided to buy two of the solar lights mentioned as part of this loan. She is very excited about these, as they will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save her more money.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient hybrid maize seed and fertilizer and to purchase two solar lights

loans.name: Titus's Group

texts.en:
Titus's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Titus, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 35 years old, is married and has four children. Titus has been a farmer for 14 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Titus isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2012 and has noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Titus will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Titus's Group will purchase a total of nine solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La señora es casada,tiene dos hijas por lo que tiene que apoyar a su esposo trabajando en una pequeña farmacia desde hace 7 años, a pesar de que su salario es bajo, apoya economicamente a una sobrina de 17 años quien vive con ella y su familia desde que tiene 5 años, ya que perdió a sus padres. La joven nunca ha recibido atencion dental por lo que sufrió una fuerte infección en sus dientes al grado de que perdió varias piezas a su corta edad. La señora con su salario no puede pagar un tratamiento para su sobrina pero tampoco quiere dejarla sin tratamiento porque el problema le esta afectando mucho su autoestima y salud porque para comer le duelen mucho los dientes.
texts.en:
This woman is married and has two daughters. She has had to help her husband by working at a small pharmacy for seven years. Despite earning a low salary, she also financially supports a 17-year-old niece who has been living with her and her family for the past five years because she lost her parents. This young woman never received dental care and is now suffering from a severe infection in her teeth. She has already lost several teeth at such a young age.

The borrower does not earn enough from her salary to pay for her niece’s care, but she does not want her to go without treatment because it could severely affect her self-esteem and her health. Her niece currently experiences a great amount of pain in her teeth when eating.

loans.use: to pay for her niece's dental treatment.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en: Tigran is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three school-aged children in the village of Varser in the Geaghrkunik region. Tigran is a skilled bricklayer and he works on contract. Tigran’s wife is unemployed but she helps her husband a lot with the farm work. On his farm Tigran has a cow, a calf, a heifer, sheep, lambs and chickens. Tigran sells his farm meat to customers in the city of Sevan and he sells milk and eggs to his neighbors. He also cultivates potatoes, greens and tomatoes both to sell and for their family use. Tigran is requesting a loan of 200,000 Armenian drams to prepare for spring sowing and for other land cultivation activities.

loans.use: to prepare for spring sowing at the family farm.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 20-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small house. He works as an employee an aluminum workshop where he gets a low and unstable income. Khaled is also a university student where he studies accounting. He would like to take the BA degree and find a better job to improve his family's living conditions.

Khaled took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him to do his homework and write reports easily.

Khaled appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia from Pakistan! She is married and has six children. 

Razia has requested a loan for her son; he conducts business in a food stall, offering burgers to the common people of his area in the evening. He has been changing his menus from time to time according to weather, climate, and taste. Nowadays he wants to offer burgers; for this is reason he is in better need of eggs, spices, oil, onion, cauliflower, and tomato ketchup. Earlier he was selling Alu Chat (Pakistani Food), which is cheaper than burgers. He does not have enough cash in hand to buy ingredients for offering his next food item.

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can do financially help her son. With the help of this loan, he can easily buy the described ingredients. 

Razia is 59 years old, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Razia and her son offer thanks to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps RAZIA's son in purchasing burger's ingredients such as eggs, spices, oil, onion, cauliflower and tomato ketchup for food stall.

loans.name: Stanley's Group

texts.en:
Stanley, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years and is now proud to represent his group of five farmers in Matete District. He is 47 years old, is married, and has six children.

Stanley likes to think of himself as a very reliable person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Stanley plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Stanley’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.75 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Annah's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Annah, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by nine farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to three children, and is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Annah joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Annah plans to send her children to school.

Among the nine farmers in Annah's Group, a total of 4.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. 

Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Abraham's Group

texts.en:
Abraham is 61 years old and has nine children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Abraham is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Abraham started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has learnt a lot from farming training sessions ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community.

Abraham’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for the chickens

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a resident of Badian, a municipality in Cebu. She is 54 years old with two adult children.

Loreta owns a sari-sari (variety) store business and also raises hogs for a living. Sometimes she also raises and sells cattle for additional income. She is asking for a loan to buy more hog feed and to restock her store shelves with products such as noodles, canned goods, coffee, sugar, shampoo, seasoning and spices.

She hopes that eventually her businesses will be more sustainable and will earn a better profit that she can reinvest without relying on loans.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs and to buy noodles, canned goods, coffee, sugar, shampoo, seasoning and spices to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Mary has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Mary also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce their consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Mary's Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is a 45-year-old married woman from village of Likhauri. She has four family members and all of them are unemployed. Lali is the only breadwinner; she works as a nurse at the emergency hospital and gets 450 GEL monthly. 

With the help of her family members, Lali works hard to develop an agricultural business. She takes care of cattle and milk-cows and cultivates a plot of land, where she harvests maize and nuts. The family sells agricultural produce at the local market and gets a little income. 

In order to improve her family's living conditions and find a stable source of income, Lali requested financial support. With the loan she will start her own business, purchase stock of food products and have money for working capital. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

After starting the business, the family members will be involved in their own business and make it work on a profitable way, that will help them to cover everyday expenses. 

Lali and her family members rely on the goodwill of Kiva lenders and will be very thankful for the financial support.

loans.use: To open a general store and start trading

loans.name: Jones Group

texts.en:
Jones, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Jones will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Jones plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

Jones’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow; after milk sale, he will be able to buy certified seeds and fertilizer for planting and produce a higher quality and quantity produce for sale in the market.

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet is 27 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Janet is representing her group of eight farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Janet's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Janet and her group will receive a total of six solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María del Rosario es una mujer emprendedora que vive junto a sus tres hijos, en su pequeña finca de 7 manzanas, ubicada en la zona norte de Nicaragua. Desde hace más de diez años, ella se dedica a la producción de café, como principal actividad económica. En este período, ha venido mejorando las condiciones de la finca, la cual ha logrado certificar por Comercio Justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, a través de la asociación Pueblos Acción Comunitaria (PAC) a la cual está afiliada.

La producción promedio de café de esta productora, en los últimos tres años, ha sido de 90 quintales de café pergamino. El mayor desafío que ha enfrentado en esta actividad, es la presencia de plagas y enfermedades, lo cual está segura logrará mantener bajo control con un plan de fertilización adecuado.

Para ello, María del Rosario está solicitando un financiamiento para la adquisición de insumos agrícolas que le permitirá garantizar un adecuado mantenimiento de sus plantaciones y con ello asegurar buenos rendimientos y calidad en este ciclo.

Su meta es continuar mejorando su finca bajo un plan de manejo integrado que le permita continuar invirtiendo en el desarrollo y diversificación de su finca, lo cual está segura logrará con  su dedicación al trabajo
texts.en:
Maria del Rosario is an enterprising woman who lives with her three children on her small, seven block farm, located in the north part of Nicaragua.  She has been raising coffee as her main income source for ten years.  She has been improving her farm this season and has managed to be certified under Fair Trade Practices by UTZ and C.A.F.E., through Pueblos Acción Comunitaria (PAC) of which she is a member.

This producer’s average coffee production has been 90 quintals of coffee over the past three years.  Her main challenges are insects and disease, but she is certain that she can maintain them under control with an adequate fertilization plan.

Maria del Rosario is requesting a loan for this so she can buy adequate farming supplies so she can guarantee adequate maintenance for her plants and ensure an adequate and quality harvest this cycle. 

Her goal is to continue improving her farm under a management plan that will allow her to continue investing in the development and diversification of her farm through dedication to her work.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 51-year-old married mother of three children who has been selling artificial flowers for 7 years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She loves arts and flowers, and she is trying hard to develop her business. Thus today, Elham is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start selling natural flowers instead of the artificial ones.

Elham hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to start selling natural flowers

loans.name: Aylin Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado AYLIN forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer e ir superando su situación cada día. 
La Sra. Maria, vende calzados de todo tipo, es una muy buena vendedora, y es por ello que tiene muchos clientes, poco a poco se está abriendo camino y de esa forma está saliendo adelante. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que pone todo de sí.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar calzados varios, ya que con ello podrá seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y de esa forma poder luchar por trabajar y ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
The group called AYLIN is part of the poverty elimination program, where everyone is putting in their best efforts to be able to grow and go on improving their situation every day.

Maria sells footwear of every type. She is a very good saleswoman, and that is why she has many customers. Little by little, she is making headway and moving forward. She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who wants to move forward, and is giving it her all. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy various footwear so that she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. This way she will be able to continue fighting for work and be someone in life.

loans.use: to buy various footwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric to continue running her favorite business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production, to meet the demand of his clients for milk.

loans.name: Vidal  Antonio

texts.es: Don Vidal de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, también trabaja como jornal, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con las ganancias que obtiene es como logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos,controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder tener una mejor cosecha y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Vidal is 37 years old and lives at home with his family group. He makes a living in agriculture planting corn, and also works as a day laborer. He sells his products in the surrounding areas of the region he lives in and with the profits he earns he is able to get by. 

He is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. to be able to have a better harvest and therefore give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him to add more stock to his electronic appliances shop.

loans.name: Rollan

texts.en:
This entrepreneur's name is Rollan. He is 56 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Shirly and has two children who are still at the elementary level in school. He works hard to support his family and for the schooling of his children. 

Rollan has been running a food business for eight years already. He sells snacks such as "puto pao," which is a steamed Filipino mini rice cake made out of rice flour (galapong) with meat filling. It can be eaten for breakfast or for a snack. It is perfect with "dinuguan," a pork blood stew. He makes his "puto pao" upon order during special family gatherings, as it is served as a special food. He delivers his "puto pao" to his regular customers in his community. Aside from his food business, he also sells health books. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 net income a day.

To help him maintain his business, Rollan is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to pay for ingredients like flour, pork, and seasonings as well as gas needed to make his "puto pao" and also to buy more health books to sell. He believes that with this financial assistance, his sales and earnings will increase. He is thanking God in advance for your financial help and a good return on his investment, for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and fund his children's schooling.

Rollan's dream is to build and expand his business to secure the education of his children and allow them better opportunities in life. He meets up with his fellowship group* every week to share stories of his life and business and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for his snacks business and to buy more health books to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Elizabeth is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and she is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Elizabeth's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to repair her home.

Elizabeth and her group will receive a total of 13 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Wilbrodah's Group

texts.en:
Wilbrodah is a 36-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Wilbrodah has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Wilbrodah described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to rent more land to cultivate.

With this loan, Wilbrodah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Kabateraine Schools

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Rodney. He is the Business Administrator of Kabateraine Schools, a mixed nursery and primary school in the urban area of Mbarara, with a total of 920 students. Kabateraine Schools has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kabateraine Schools will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Rodney ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Hoeum's Group

texts.en:
Hoeum, 52, lives with family members in a rural village of Kampong Thom province. She is a mother of six children. To overcome her family’s hardships, she grows rice and works for others for a fee. She has been involved this business for ages and earns her about 50,000 KHR per day. 

Hoeum leads a group of seven in order to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a decent latrine. She hopes that her family will have a better standard of living and better health.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine

loans.name: Kiuukuni Women Group

texts.en:
The woman raising her hand in the photo is Christine, 50 years old, married and a mother of six. Christine is a member of Kiuukuni Women Group that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from the training on saving mobilization and enterprise development.

Christine's economic activity is dairy farming and keeping poultry. She is borrowing this Kiva loan to buy dairy and chicken feeds that will increase production of milk and eggs.

She is thankful to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: To buy dairy and chicken feeds that will increase production of milk and eggs.

loans.name: Madrasat School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Dauda. He is the Head teacher of Madrasat Noorulisl Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Nyamitanga with 300 students. Madrasat School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Madrasat School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Dauda ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sharifamo

texts.ru: Шарифамо добрая и ответственная жительница города Куляб. Ей 47 лет. Она разведена с мужем, и имеет детей. Сыновья находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Они зарабатывает и отправляет день маме, чтобы обеспечить семью. Дочка занимается шитьем женской одежды дома уже 3 лет. Сама Шарифамо дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. У нее есть свои постоянные клиенты. Она опытная швея. Шарифамо решила взять кредит привлечь больше клиентов  и расширить деятельность. За счет кредита она купить швейные принадлежности, чтобы сшить разные и стильные женские одежды.
texts.en: Sharifamo is a kind and responsible resident of the town of Kulob. She is 47 years old. She is divorced from her husband and has children. Her sons currently work in the Russian Federation. They earn money and send it home to their mother in order to provide for the family. Her daughter has been involved in sewing women's clothing for 3 years. Sharifamo provides seamstress services at home too. She has regular clients. She is an experienced seamstress. Sharifamo decided to obtain a loan and attract more clients and expand her business. She will use this loan to buy sewing accessories to sew various, stylish women's clothing.

loans.use: to buy sewing accessories to sew various, stylish women's clothing and expand her business

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.ru: Шабнам успешно погасила предыдущий кредит. Блвгодаря Вам сейчас Шабнам имеет свой собственный маленький бизнес. У нее сейчас хорошо получается. Шабнам хочет стать хорошим портнихой. Шабнам решила ускорить процесс работы и расширить деятельностью. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить швейные принадлежности и ускорить работу. Шабнам верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Поддержите молодую девушка достичь своих целей.
texts.en: Shabnam sucessfully repaid her previous loan. Thanks to You, now Shabnam has her own small business. She is now doing well. Shabnam wants to become a good seamstress. She decided to speed up her work process and expand her business. She requested a loan to buy sewing accessories and speed up her work. Shabnam believes in You and Your support. Please support this young woman in achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy sewing accessories and speed up her work process

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 28-year-old single lady who has been working in her beauty salon for the past six years. She works hard, loves her work a lot, and seeks perfection. She studied at a technical school to teach kindergarten but has found herself in the beauty business.

Zeinab hopes to develop her business to make it number one in her area, thus today she is requesting a YOUTH loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a special tattoo machine that is requested by her customers.

Acquiring this machine will add value to her business and attract new customers in the region who are seeking such a service.

loans.use: to buy a special tattoo machine

loans.name: Judith Isabel

texts.es:
Judith una mujer trabajadora, que ha dado todo por su familia, ella vende pescado los cuales transporta en la canasta que pueden en la foto, junto con bloques de hielo para conservar la temperatura ideal para los peces, realiza gran esfuerzo su edad le pesa pero todo ello lo hace porque cree en un mejor futuro, uno donde su negocio sea muy rentable, que pueda organizar su casa, y tener vendedores para ella por fin descansar de ese peso del transporte del pescado, por esto trabaja duramente y tiene la fe que lo lograra.

Ella es madre de tres hijos, ellos mayores de edad con su respectiva familia y vive junto con su esposo, rebuscándose siempre el dinero para comprar el alimento y pagar las deudas.

Judith quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de pescado y pollo, los productos que más comercializa.
texts.en:
Judith is a hard working woman who has given everything for her family. She sells fish which she transports in the tub that can be seen in the photo along with blocks of ice to keep the fish at the ideal temperature. It takes a lot of strength at her age because of the weight but everything she does is because she believes in a better future, one where her business is very profitable so she can organize her house and have her own vendors so she can rest at last from transporting the heavy weight of fish. So she works hard and has faith that she can do it.

She is the mother of three children who are adults with their own families. She lives with her husband always searching carefully for money to buy food and pay the bills.

Judith is asking for a loan to buy fish and chicken, the products she sells the most.

loans.use: to buy fish and chicken which are the products that generate higher profits.

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 46 years old and has 9 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Gladys has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Gladys also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Gladys' Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jonathan Alexis

texts.es:
Jhonatan es un hombre soltero de 23 años, un emprendedor que progresara, tiene futuro, siempre mostró ganas de trabajar, desde su juventud trabajaba con su madre en talleres de confección, ella le enseño todo y cuando se sintió listo tomo la decisión una noche cualquiera del año 2012, hoy en día tiene su pequeño taller en casa y genera 3 empleos y quiere seguir en esta tónica de progreso y los invita a participar en su proyecto, apoyándolo  con un aliento económico que invertirá en la compra de una máquina recubridora y una máquina fileteadora que le servirán para aumentar su producción.

Este préstamo le ayudara a Jhonatan a generar empleo, tener una sostenibilidad del negocio, aumentar sus ventas, su producción, clientes y todos estos beneficios los enfoca en un sueño de comprar una vivienda propia a su nombre.
texts.en: Jhonatan is a 23 year old single man, an entrepreneur who is moving ahead and has a future. He has always shown a desire to work, he has worked with his mom in sewing shops since he was a youth. She taught him everything and when he felt ready he made the decision to open his own shop on a night in 2012. Today he has a small shop in his house that generates 3 jobs. He wants to continue with this trend of growth. He is inviting you to participate in his project, helping him with an economic boost that he will invest in the purchase of a cover stitch machine and a serger which will serve him to increase his production. This loan will help Jhonatan to generate employment, create sustainability in his business, increase his sales, production and clients. All these benefits lead to his dream of buying his own house.

loans.use: to buy a cover stitch machine and a serger which will allow him to sew other types of clothing.

loans.name: Langalanga Organic Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Jane. She is married and blessed with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in June 2014.

Jane is a farmer of maize, beans and potatoes. She is grateful to HiH EA for developing her entrepreneurial spirit through training and mentorship. This has enabled her to pursue farming as a business, unlike before, where it was predominantly for subsistence.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy farm inputs in readiness for the upcoming planting season. She hopes that with better seeds and fertilizers, she will get a bumper harvest at the end of the season, enough for her family consumption and to sell, which will enable her to support her family needs and education for her children.

Jane is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer that will help boost her harvest.

loans.name: Mamadur

texts.ru: Мамадур благодарить Вас за кредит. Она достигла своей цели. Сейчас Мамадур занимается торговлей в магазине. Она продает сухарики, шоколады, чипсы, напитки, сок, конфеты, мороженное и другие питание. Ей  в работе помогает старший сын. Мамадур хорошо справляется с торговлей. Сейчас Мамадур решила расширить деятельность и увеличить доход торговли. Она просит кредит, чтобы привозит больше продуктов питания.  По этой причине Мамадур обратилась за кредитом.  Мамадур верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Mamadur is grateful to You for the loan. She achieved her goal. Now Mamadur is involved in sales at a store. She sells croutons, chocolate, chips, beverages, juice, candy, ice-cream and other products. Her oldest son helps her with the work. Mamadur handles the sales very well. Now Mamadur decided to expand her business and increase her sales income. She is requesting this loan to bring in more food products. This is why Mamadur requested this loan. Mamadur believes in You and Your support.

loans.use: to bring in more food products and expand her business

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary es una joven de 22 años de edad que se dedica a la venta por catálogo, una profesión que inicio en el año 2014 y la ejerció pro necesidad económica, ya que es madre soltera cabeza de familia, su hija tiene 4 años de edad, está en guardería, come bien y sonríe gracias a que tiene una madre responsable que está dispuesta a hacer lo que sea por mantenerla.

Está joven trabaja todos los días de la semana 8 horas por día, lo más impresionante es que Mary tiene una incapacidad que la imposibilita realizar algunas trabajos y por ello opto por trabajar en la venta por catálogo.

Su sueño es poder comprar una vivienda propia para poder tener por lo menos una vivienda asegurada para su hija y en el caso de que ella pueda faltar tenga un hogar a donde ir.

Solicita un préstamo para cubrir un pedido que tiene de lociones, pijamas, ropa, cosméticos y accesorios para mujer, este pedido le permitirá generar confianza en los clientes, entregarlo a tiempo será un plus para que ellos recompren, aumentara sus ventas y su utilidad.
texts.en:
Mary is a young 22 year old woman who makes a living selling in catalogs, a profession that she began in 2014 and served for economic necessity. She is a single mother and the head of her household, she has a daughter who is 4 years old and is in kindergarten. She eats well and smiles thanks to her responsible mother who will do anything to take care of her.

She is young and works every day of the week for 8 hours per day. The most impressive is that Mary has a disability that makes it impossible for her to do some work and this is why she works in the sale of catalogs.

Her dream is to be able to buy her own home and to have at least a secure home for her daughter in case she misses and needs a home to go.

She is requesting a loan to cover an order that has lotions, pajamas, clothes, cosmetics and accessories for women. This order will allow confidence for her customers and will allow her to deliver on time and will be a plus for them to buy back, which will increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: to cover an order of lotions, pajamas, clothes, cosmetics, and accessories for women, which will generate confidence in her customers.

loans.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es:
María una mujer de 59 años de edad, ella es separada de su esposo, no tiene hijos, solo un hogar que  mantener, tiene varias ideas para ganar dinero, inicialmente trato de emplearse en una actividad que por lo general requieren hombres la cual es la ebanistería, es poco común ver una mujer realizando este trabajo ya que por el esfuerzo físico piden un perfil masculino, es por ello que María en el año 2014 decidió montar su propio negocio aprovechando todos los conocimientos que adquirió de su ex-esposo.

Se ubica en el patio de su casa, tiene alguna herramienta de segunda mano que consiguió,  con ello puede laborar y realizar reparaciones y construir algunos buenos muebles.

Ella en el momento se encuentra solicitando un préstamo, el cual destinara en la compra de madera y pintura, insumos principales en la ebanistería.

Apoya a esta mujer que quiere destacar en un gremio donde los hombres siempre han reinado, tu apoyo será muy significativo. María trabaja por un sueño el cual es poder comprar la casa donde se encuentra viviendo actualmente.
texts.en:
María is a 59-year-old woman. She is separated from her husband and has no children; she has only a home to maintain. She has a few ideas on how to make money. Initially, she tried to work in woodworking, a field dominated by men. It is rare to see a woman working in this capacity due to the physical effort required. In 2014, María decided to start her own business using all the knowledge she had acquired from her former husband.

She works in her backyard with secondhand tools she acquired. With these she can work and make repairs and build some nice furniture.

She is requesting a loan to buy wood, paint and other necessary materials for woodworking.

Support this woman who wants to stand out in a profession men have always dominated. Your support will be very significant. María is working toward the dream of buying the house where she is currently living.

loans.use: buy wood and paint and bolster herself in the occupation of woodworking, a profession very dominated by men.

loans.name: Flor Elena

texts.es:
Flor es una mujer soltera de 55 años de edad, no tiene hijos ni una persona que la apoye, se vale de sí misma, de sus habilidades culinarias para generar ingresos, pero no quiere estar más sola, necesita poyo, capital de trabajo para sacar su idea de negocio adelante, por ello acude ante la corporación Interactuar para solicitar un préstamo el cual destinara para tratar de aumentar las ventas y la rentabilidad de sus ventas.

Flor Inicio el negocio en su hogar por dos motivos, uno la necesidad de toda persona de generar recursos para su sostenimiento y el numero dos es que ella es una persona incapacitada para realizar trabajas que demanden mucho esfuerzo físico.

A pesar de estas dificultades ella sigue en pie, trabajando, sonriendo, tiene sueños como comprar una vivienda propia y para ello necesita de su negocio, sostenerlo, mejorar ventas, etc., una de las dificultades son los altos costos de insumos y la competencia del sector, pero como dice flor, “nadie dijo que sería fácil”.

Como anteriormente se mencionó ella busca un préstamo para la compra de insumos en cantidades como aceite, papa, carne, masa, maíz, frutas y vegetales, al comprar en cantidades saldrá más económico, su producto saldrá mas económico y podrá sacarle mayor utilidad a cada venta.
texts.en:
Flor is a single 55 year old woman. She has no children, nor any person for support. She uses her culinary skills to earn income, but does not want to be more alone in her efforts. She needs help in the form of working capital to get her business idea moving. This is why she went to Interactuar to ask for a loan with which she intends to try to increase sales and profitability of her sales.

Flor started the business in her home for two reasons: one the need for all people to generate income for sustenance and two she is unable to perform work demanding much physical exertion.

Despite these difficulties, she is still on her feet, working and smiling. She has dreams like buying her own home and sustaining her business, improving sales, etc. One of her difficulties is the large cost of inputs and the competition in the sector, but like Flor says "nobody said it would be easy."

As previously she mentioned, she seeks a loan to purchase inputs in quantity, such as oil, potatoes, meat, dough, corn, fruits, and vegetables. To buy in quantity will be cheaper, and her products will be cheaper, thus she can get more use out of each sale.

loans.use: to purchase inputs in quantity like oil, potatoes, meat, dough, corn, fruits, and vegetables to use in food preparation.

loans.name: Grolai's Group

texts.en:
Grolai is 55 years old and has 10 children. She has been a farmer for more than 40 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Grolai is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Grolai started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Grolai’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru:
Зебинисо умная,  заботливая женщина  в возрасте 42 лет. У нее  трое прекрасных детей. В настоящее время она вдова и одна воспитывает детей. Она работает с столовой. Но к сожалению зарплата которую она получает не хватает на проживание. Для дополнительного дохода она занимается животноводством. И пока у неё недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. 
В данный момент Зебинисо  хочет купить несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Зебинисо заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Zebiniso is a smart and caring 42-year-old woman. She has three beautiful children. She is currently a widow and raising her children by herself. She works at a cafeteria, but, unfortunately, the salary that she earns is not enough for her living expenses. She is involved in animal husbandry to provide additional income, and she still does not have enough money to cover all of her current needs.

At the present time, Zebiniso wants to buy more livestock for fattening up. This is why she came to Arvand to obtain a loan to buy livestock. Zebiniso is in advance grateful to Arvand for the support, due to which her family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to livestock for fattening up

loans.name: Rozalina

texts.ru: Розалина, 22 года, не замужем, детей нет. У нее высшее образование. Розалина живет с родителями, в поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей парфюмерными изделиями. Магазин арендованный, начала она свою деятельность в 2012 году. Товар привозит из Бишкека. На сегодняшний день в обороте есть товар на сумму 200,000 сом (KGS). Ее ежемесячная прибыль около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Розалина обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение оборотных средств. Доходы от кредита Розалина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и хочет накопить на покупку собственного жилья.
texts.en: Rozalina is 22 years old, not married and does not have children. She has a college education. Rozalina lives with her parents. To provide additional income for her family, she is involved in selling perfumes. She leases her store and started this business in 2012. She brings her merchandise from Bishkek. Today, she has a merchandise inventory valued at 200,000 som (KGS). Her monthly profit is about 20,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Rozalina requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to increase her working capital. Rozalina plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and wants to save money to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy perfumes in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas integrado  por  12 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Pilar, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gloria, quien se dedica a la venta de queso y de leche.
Ella vende por su barrio y las zonas aledañas, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar cada día para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar leche en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar y poder con ello ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas [Women United] group is made up of 12 women, all of whom are friends and neighbors in the city of Pilar.  One of the members is Gloria, who sells cheese and milk.  She sells her products in her neighborhood and nearby neighborhoods.  She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who wants to get ahead.  That is why she puts forth her best effort to grow and improve everyday so she can help her family.  

She is requesting this loan so she can buy large quantities of milk and continue her sales as she has in the past.  She is grateful for this opportunity that she has been given to improve and be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of milk to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 27-year-old smallholder farmer, living in Karachine, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Like many smallholder farmers in Kenya, He owns a tiny inherited plot of land to live off, just under half an acre, and has always struggled to support his family. His primary source of income has been milk, poultry, crops and some small personal business he engages in to supplement his meager income.

James passionately loves dairy farming, but one challenge he has been facing is lack of water for home consumption and irrigating his farm. Most of the rainwater goes to waste and therefore James is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a water tank and water pipes. With the water tank he will be able to harvest and store rainwater in the tank. This loan will be of much help because James will not be walking for long distances in search of this precious commodity. The tank will assist him in irrigating his farm, hence increasing productivity and his income level. All that James waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Israel Armando

texts.es: Israel de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de mariscos, desde hace 20 años con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el lugar que muestra en la fotografía pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra, así el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en:
Israel is 42 and lives in his own home with his family.  He has sold seafood for the last 20 years and with the income from his sales he has been able to cover some of his household expenses.  

He would like to improve his property by cementing over the area shown in the photograph but he does not make enough from his sales to do it.  That is why he is requesting a loan to buy sand and cement, and to pay for the labor. With this, he and his family can live more comfortably and cleaner.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Juana Estela

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer honesta, trabajadora y emprendedora; desde hace 8 años inició  a trabajar en la limpieza de unos locales, y con el tiempo se hizo socia de ellos. Ahora es dueña de una distribuidora de  venta de productos Herbalife. Ella confiesa que el comienzo no fue fácil, pero con el tiempo pudo  ganarse la confianza de sus clientes.

Por ello, solicita un crédito para la compra de productos Herbalife como: Té, batidos, concentrados en polvo, etc.  Lo cual, le será de gran ayuda porque podrá aumentar sus ventas, al ofrecer mayor variedad de mercancías. Entre los planes de Juana esta ampliar su negocio y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa con las ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana is an honest, hard-working, and enterprising woman. 

Eight years ago, she began working as a cleaning lady at some shops, and, eventually, she joined the business. Today, she owns a Herbalife distributorship. She admits that it wasn't an easy beginning but that she was able to earn her customers' trust over time. 

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy Herbalife products such as teas, shakes, powder mixes, and the like. This purchase will help her greatly because she will be able to increase her sales by offering a wider range of merchandise. 

Juana's plans include using the profits to expand her business and make improvements to the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to purchase Herbalife products such as teas, shakes, powder mixes, and the like.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 54 year old married man, from Batumi city, west Georgia. He wife is a housekeeper and they have a kindergarten-aged son. Nugzar is the only breadwinner in the family. He works as a conductor at the local bus station and gets 200 GEL monthly. The salary is really hardly enough for the family to cover even basic needs and daily expenses.

Due to the above mentioned situation, Nugzar lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require enough income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of 3000 USD. He plans to cover the remaining amount of the car, that he has already found and start a transportation business. Nugzar will start serving clients and transfer them from his city to the capital.

With support of the Start Up program Nugzar will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business, generate significant income and tackle his financial difficulties.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a car and start working as a driver.

loans.name: Abigael's Group

texts.en:
Abigael is 50 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 9 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Abigael has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Abigael also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Abigael's Group will be able to receive a total of 5 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en: Melitona is a 45-year-old woman with various businesses. She operates a sari-sari store and also raise broiler chickens for a living. This has been her business for eight years now. She usually sells basic commodities like canned goods, rice, seasoning, and toiletries. She also buy chicks to raise for 45 days before selling them. She is asking a loan to buy feed, soft drinks, rice, canned goods, and toiletries. Melitona hopes to expand her business so she can live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy feed, soft drinks, rice, canned goods, and toiletries

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 40 year-old Palestinian refugee and a married father of three children. 

He works hard as a transporter of students and employees to provide his children with necessary things

In addition, to his current business, Mohamad has worked in the cleaning business since age 15, to make sure he increases his family's income, because his children have lived in a Palestinian Refugees camp, since they were born.

Today, Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new business dealing with electronic games for children.

He hopes to keep improving his family's standard of living while seeking new business opportunities.

loans.use: to start a electronic games business for children.

loans.name: Hassane

texts.en:
Hassane is a 26-year-old single Palestinian refugee, who has been living and working in a Palestinian refugee camp since he was born.

Hassane used to work in a construction business as a painter. But, after saving a good amount of money, he decided a year ago to change his career path completely, and he purchased his friend's clothing retail shop.

Hassane's business is going just fine, but he needs additional financial support so he can develop it further. Thus, he is taking a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to develop his business by increasing his spring and summer clothing collections.

Hassane hopes that when his income improves, he will be able to start his own family.

loans.use: To develop his business by increasing his spring and summer clothing collections.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: A sus 44 años de edad Juana esta casada, Juana tiene  3 hijos y una hija, sus hijos tienen 15,17,19, y su hija  tiene 11 años de edad, Juana se vive en el campo y su esposo se dedica  a trabajar al jornal y a sembrar pequeñas huertas  de papas y  otros productos, Juana le ayuda en la agricultura a su esposo y  tambien se dedica a la crianza de animales , Juana necesita el dinero del credito para invertirlo en la compra de abono y fungicidas para cuidar sus cultivos, la aspiracion de Juana es de sembrar mas cultivos de papas y asi hacer buena cosecha y vender su producto a buen precio para tener los ingresos que cobran la educacion de sus hijos que en la actualidad 3 de ellos estan estudiando.
texts.en:
Juana is 44 years old, married, has three sons and a daughter. Her sons are aged 15, 17 and 19, and her daughter is 11 years old. Juana lives in the country. Her husband works as a day laborer and also plants small orchards of potatoes and other products. Juana helps him with the farming and also raises animals. 

Juana is in need of capital to purchase fertilizer and fungicides to care for her crops. Juana's hope is to plant more potato crops and have a good harvest so that she can sell her produce at a good price and have enough income to pay for her children's educations. Three of her kids are currently in school.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and fungicides.

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Everlyne, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by seven farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

She joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Everlyne will purchase maize seeds, fertilizer for the coming harvesting season and a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study. 

Everlyne plans to use the profits she gains to send her children to school.

In total Everlyne’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of four acres of land. They will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to buy maize, fertilizer and a solar light.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is 64 years old and has 9 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Joseph has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although he described his last harvest as excellent, he believes he will have an even better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Joseph also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Joseph's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.
