loans.name: Bengamin

texts.en:
Bengamin is 33 years old and is from Matag-ob, Leyte. He is married with a 2-year-old son. 

Bengamin is a hardworking man. He makes and sells fruit juice that, when frozen, is a favorite of many children. They are known as popsicles or ice candy in his community. He also sells the tasty bread "pandesal" which is in high demand in the mornings. 

Bengamin is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase both a franchise for a multicab - a type of passenger vehicle that can accommodate 15 or more passengers - and ingredients such as sugar, juice powder, sweetener, and flavorings. 

In the future, Bengamin hopes to be successful in business and in educating his son.

loans.use: to purchase a multicab franchise and popsicle ingredients.

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es:
Ella es Flor María es una madre cabeza de familia de 2 dos hermosas princesas de tan solo 10 y 15 años de edad, es una mujer muy responsable y cariñosa, ama a sus hijas y a los animales, por esto quiso tener una profesión que de alguna manera estuviera involucrada con las mascotas pero sin de hacer de hacer lo que aprendió a lo largo de su vida que es la venta de mercancía, por ello constituyo un negocio de venta de alimento, juguetes y accesorios para animales domésticos. 

Flor tiene una idea para mejorar sus ventas, ser más competitiva y atraer clientes, la cual es iniciar a vender medicamentos, es por esta razón que quiere solicitar un préstamo y lo enfocara todo en la compra de alimentos, enfatizara en perros y gatos que es el común de mascotas. 

Este préstamo le ayudara a flor a mejorar en todos los ámbitos de su negocio, tendrá mejores ventas, consolidara su negocio, tendrá un nuevo producto.

Su mayor sueño es tener un negocio rentable que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Flor María is the head of her household.  She has two lovely daughters, aged 10 and 15. She is a very responsible and caring woman who loves her daughters and loves animals. Her love of animals led her to seek a career that would allow her to work with pets.  Through her life, she learned retail, and she used this knowledge of retail to start a business selling food, toys and accessories for pets.  

Flor has an idea to improve her sales, be more competitive and attract new customers. Her idea is to sell medications, which is why she is seeking this loan. She will focus the money on purchasing food for dogs and cats, since those are the most common pets.  This loan will help Flor to improve her business, increase her sales, strengthen her business, and diversify her offerings. Her biggest dream is to have a profitable business that will allow her and her family to have a better quality of life and pay for their education.

loans.use: start selling pet medication.

loans.name: Rusia

texts.en:
Rusia lives on a hilltop in Kenyenya, Kenya with her husband and their children. 

She can see a bright future, thanks to the income she earns by practicing mixed farming. Rusia passionately loves dairy farming. 

Because of her extensive farming knowledge, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers. However, her biggest challenge is satisfying the demand for milk in her village. The demand is overwhelming. 

She is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. She believes that through the loan, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. 

Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, Rusia is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her profit enabling her to pay back the loan. 

Rusia is confident that if you invest in her dream, you will impact the life of her family and children. Please consider lending to Rusia.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.en:
Julia is 68 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of 15 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Julia has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she will have an even better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Julia also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan. She is very excited about this purchase as it will allow her to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Obtaining this loan means that Julia's Group will be able to receive a total of 13 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 42-year-old, proud father of nine children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Emmanuel has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Emmanuel described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Emmanuel’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make a first digging on 2 hectares of land to plant maize crops.

loans.name: Kulangwa Group

texts.en: Mwanaid, who is in her early 40s, is married and the mother of five children, three of whom are still in school while the other two are grown-up. For the last eight years, she has earned a living by running a gengeduka (or small grocery store) and selling items to people who live in her area.  She works from 6 a.m. to 9.30 p.m. daily and is able to make good monthly profit. This will be Mwanaid's 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she will use her portion of this loan, which will go to the people in her six-person loan group, to buy more produce to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in a small grocery store.

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
Rukia is in her late thirties, single and has got three children, two schooling and the third grown. She supports her family by running a beauty salon business. Rukia has been in this business for sixteen years now. She works from 8 am to 11 pm daily. She is able to make a small profit each month.

This is her third credit request to be apportioned among Iringa's two members group from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Rukia used the previous loans, which she repaid successfully, to improve her business. With those loans she bought hair products which enabled her to service more people.

She is a good hairstylist able to service many people. Rukia has managed to generate a small profit which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. She dreams that one day she will be able to improve her business to look classic.

She will use this loan to buy hair products for her business.

loans.use: to buy hair products for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply milk for more income.

loans.name: Lameck

texts.en:
Lameck, a husband and father of two children, is a mixed, small-scale farmer based in the remote village of, Kisii. He has been practicing agribusiness for the past ten years and has never looked back. For a living, Lameck sells milk and food products from his farm to the local market. He enjoys seeing clients coming back for more of his products and he really feels satisfied. 

Although Lameck has been making profits through farming, he has always wanted to do poultry farming. The main challenge he has encountered is a lack of funds to get his business off the ground. Lameck is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kisii and is a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Lameck does not worry too much about competition, because the market for poultry products is good - chicken is a popular meal for many people and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint. 

With this loan, Lameck is confident that his income will increase and this will allow a permanent change in his life. He plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. He also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on his farm. Other than profits from selling eggs, poultry feathers, and poultry meat, Lameck will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for his farm. Through this loan, he will assure his large family a secure future and improved living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans, from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, decided to become a full-time small holder farmer. He decided that he will be independent and contribute to his community by practicing mixed farming. His primary sources of income are milk, maize and poultry farming, as well as some personal business that he does to supplement his meager income. For the past five years, Evans has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and he wants to increase his poultry stock, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. He is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunities for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity and is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Evans is going to make more income that will enable him to take care of his family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Evans is doing all he can do to ensure that his family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en: Abishyizehamwe is a group led by Kapitoline who is 38 years old. The group name means “altogether” in English. Kapitoline is married with five children ages 3 to 10 years. She sells food stuffs and has been in business for the past eight years. The group members sell different items and they share the same ideas for changing their lives. With the loan, Kapitoline would like to buy more sugar, maize flour, sorghum and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour,sorghum and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, cassava flour, and cooking oil for selling.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 25-year-old, married man with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a farmer, growing crops such as bananas, beans, maize and others. He managed to buy a motorcycle, which helps him to carry his goods to the market and also makes motorcycle transport to get additional income. Charles is faced with a challenge of floods, which destroy his crops. 

He has a dream of expanding his business of bananas to the city, where there is a readily available market. Charles will use the loan to buy fertilizers and manure to improve his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to improve his banana plantation.

loans.name: Mexido

texts.en: Mexido is a hardworking married man with one child who lives in in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is self-employed and earns a living by providing transportation services. In the future, he hopes to buy a car to provide better service to his customers. He is requesting this loan to help pay for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to help pay for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una mujer de 56 años de edad, ella vive junto a su esposo rodeada del lindo paisaje del campo, su esposo agricultor y ella un ama de casa que por sentirse útil y apoyar a su esposo en el mantenimiento del hogar monto un negocio de cría y levante de aves, en parte para complementar las actividades de su marido y que ambos ganen recursos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Gabriela empezó el negocio por gusto al trabajo independiente, también lo hizo pensando mucho en los tiempos de cosecha de la agricultura donde no se generan recursos, con este negocio ella puede ocuparse de los gastos mientras sale la cosecha, es muy solidaria y laboriosa.

Gabriela es una persona ambiciosa, tiene una mera clara de engrandecer su negocio, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra de 100 gallinas ponedoras, iniciara con la venta de huevos, una actividad que le servirá para su alimento y para la venta ya que el huevo de gallina criolla es muy apetecido. 

Este préstamo le aportara mucho a la consolidación de su negocio, y la mejora de su calidad de vida a partir de los nuevos recursos que ganara con la venta de huevos.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 56 year old woman who lives with her husband surrounded by the beautiful landscape of the field. Her husband is a farmer, and she is a housewife who feels useful and helps her husband with home maintenance. She started a business breeding and raising chickens, in part to complement the activities of her husband and gain resources to improve their quality of life.

Gabriela started the business by choice to work independently, and also to provide resources during the times of the year when agriculture does not. With this business she can handle the expense while the harvest comes and goes, it is very stable.

Gabriela is an ambitious person and has a clear path to grow her business. For this reason she wants to ask for a loan to invest in the purchase of 100 laying hens. She will start with the sale of eggs, an item that will additionally serve as food. She will sell creole chicken eggs, which are very much in demand.

This loan will bring a lot to the consolidation of her business, and improve the quality of life from the new resources earned by selling eggs.

loans.use: to purchase 100 laying hens, to have a new line of service that will be selling eggs.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab, who is 34 years old, lives in the village Nasakirali. He has a wife, two school-aged children, and pensioner mother. Sadly, for lack of economic resources, and because he had to start working at a very young age, Zurab was unable to study a professional career. He works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing maize and nuts, and breeds cattle and has a milk-cow to produce milk products. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price.  

As the family has only seasonal income, Zurab decided to start a retail business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,000 GEL for purchasing a stock of polyethylene bags and to start selling them at the local market.

After the business is started, the family will have a stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs, as well as expand the business in the future.  With support of the startup program, Zurab will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and to make better living conditions for his family members.

loans.use: to start a trading business with polyethylene bags.

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en:
Edward is 61 years old and has eight children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Edward is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Edward started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Edward’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Emani's Group

texts.en:
Emani, pictured above, has 11 children and is described as a very trustworthy person. That's why he was selected to become the leader of his group of eight farmers in Matete District. Emani is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Emani has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, to make more farmer friends in his community, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only buy farming inputs but also a solar light. He will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Emani is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 3.5 acres will be planted by Emani's Group which will receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Priscila's Group

texts.en:
Priscila, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Priscila will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Priscila plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Priscila’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of five acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and supply her cafe with milk and meet her clients' demand for tea.

loans.name: Festus's Group

texts.en:
Festus's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Festus, who is the group leader, pictured above. He is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Festus has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Festus isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family. This year, Festus will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition, since now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Festus's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Haji

texts.en:
Haji, who is a 66-year-old man, is from the village of Sartichala. He has a son, daughter-in-law, and little granddaughter. The family earns a living by the work of his daughter-in-law, who is a private teacher and trains the local pupils. However, the income is very insignificant for a family of four to meet even basic needs, so they live under poverty and require additional income to have financial stability.

Haji has a great desire to do his bit for the family's welfare and start his own business. He needs financial support to purchase stock of products and to have money for working capital.

Haji has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Haji will purchase various kinds of men's and women's clothing, and also linens and other small things, and will sell them in his community with price mark-ups.

The loan will greatly assist Haji, and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: to start a clothing trading business and become financially independent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor on the farm

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 34 years old, married with three children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. George does commercial farming, mainly growing tomatoes to generate income for his family and to earn a living. George is a hard-working man with a dream of expanding his business by growing cotton and fighting poverty. However, he is faced with a challenge of floods, pests and diseases. He'll use the money to buy pesticide and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry feed for faster and healthier growth

loans.name: Mahmadsaid

texts.ru:
Махмасаид ответственный человек. Он на районе занимается животноводством. Махмасаид 3 лет выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Ему научили родители. Сейчас он идет по их стопам. Махмасаид любит домашних животных, и поэтому он выбрал животноводческую деятельность. Он выращивает скота у себя во дворе.
Ему 31 лет. Он женат и имеет детей. Махмасаид вместе семьей и родителям живет на районе. Жена домохозяйка, она ведет домашние хозяйство и ухаживает о родителях мужа.
Махмасаид хочет приобрести крупнорогатого скота и увеличить их численность. Потому что животноводческая деятельность является основной деятельности. Его доходы от этой деятельности. Махмасаид надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahmadsaid is a responsible man.  He works in agriculture, in his own district.  For the past three years he has also been raising cattle, an activity he learned from his parents.  He is now following in their footsteps.  Mahmadsaid loves domestic animals, which is the reason why he chose animal husbandry.  He raises cattle at home.

Mahmadsaid is 31 years old, married, with children.  He lives with his family and his parents.  His wife is a homemaker; she takes care of the household and of her husband's parents.  Mahmadsaid wants to purchase cattle in order to increase his livestock headcount.  Animal husbandry is his main activity and his only source of income.  He is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and increase his livestock headcount.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 45-year-old, hard-working woman from Tskhaltubo district. She has a pensioner mother-in-law and three children. Her children get financial assistance from the local government, since Nana became a widow. The family has very poor living conditions, and has no source of significant income. Somehow to improve the situation, Nana started working as a hired person who harvests agricultural products seasonally. She gets a small income and finds it hard to meet the financial difficulties. 

Nana couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions for starting her own activity, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the startup program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows the rural poor like Nana, to get a chance for starting or re-starting a business. She will purchase a stock of clothing at wholesale prices and will sell door-to-door at increased prices. 

She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person, with a great desire to ensure her children with good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Nana is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothing and to start trading.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dry foods for her shop.

loans.name: James's Group

texts.en: James is the proud 47-year-old father of five children. He is often described as very hardworking, and leads a loan group made up of 12 farmers who live and work in the Matete District. Since joining the One Acre Fund in 2014, James has been able to consistently feed his family. He described last year's harvest as good, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with the One Acre Fund. He is very excited to be applying for a loan which will allow him to buy a solar light, fertilizer and maize seeds. He is excited to have a solar light because this will provide illumination at night, which will help everyone feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future. With this loan, James’s group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and buy a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy a solar light and cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ledy Andrea

texts.es:
Hoy comienza el gran sueño de Ledy y tú puedes ser partícipe de él, iniciara un negocio donde no solo ella se ve involucrada, ella quiere crear un negocio para incentivar la creatividad, la pasión de las personas, Ledy quiere montar una academia musical, con esto aspira a realizar una obra social de alejar personas de malos caminos y guiarlos por el camino de la música, una labor muy hermosa y digna de incentivar.

Para lograr este sueño Ledy necesita una importante suma de dinero, pues tendrá que adecuar el espacio, y comprar los instrumentos musicales.

Tu prestamo ayudara significativamente a iniciar un negocio, un estilo de vida, algo que cada vez se ve menos y que Ledy quiere recuperar, apoyala.
texts.en: Ledy's greatest dream begins today, and you can be a part of it. She will start a business in which, not only she will be involved: she wants to create a business to boost people's creativity and passion. Ledy wants to start a musical academy. With it she wants to do social work by keeping people away from bad influences and guiding them through the music path, a beautiful work that deserves to be supported. In order to achieve this dream, Ledy needs an important amount of money, because she will have to adequate space and buy musical instruments. Your loan will significantly help to start a business, a lifestyle, something that is seen less and less and that Ledy wants to bring back. Support her.

loans.use: to open a musical academy in order to keep young people away from bad influences, and to buy musical instruments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system and provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru:
Шарифа молодая женщина 51 лет. Она  вдова. Она одна воспитывает двоих детей.  Она работает специалистом в Военном комиссариате более 12 лет. На работе её все уважают и дома она добрая  отзывчивая   бабушка,  внуки её обожают.  
Она  хочет обустроить дом своего младшего сына.   Для энергосбережения и тепла дома она решила поставить пластиковые окна и двери. Она обратилась в МДО Арванд за кредитом и заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Sharifa is a young, 51-year-old widowed woman.  She raises two children by herself and she has been working as an expert for the military commissariat for more than 12 years.  She is respected by all at work and, at home, she is a kind and caring grandmother, adored by her grandchildren.  She wants to finish building her youngest son's house.  In order to save energy and properly heat the house, she has decided to install plastic doors and windows.  She has turned to MDO Arvand for a loan, and she thanks you in advance for your support and your trust.

loans.use: to buy plastic windows and doors

loans.name: Gladys Group

texts.en:
Gladys' Group was formed by twelve farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Gladys, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 54 years old, is married and has four children. Gladys has been a farmer for more than thirty years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Gladys isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money ever since.

This year, Gladys will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Gladys' Group will purchase a total of thirteen solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is aged 40 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 13 and 18 years; they all go to school. She sells domestic animals such as goats, and she has been in business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more goats to resell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more goats to resell.

loans.name: Once De Mayo - Huancarani Group

texts.es:
La socia Benita pertenece al banco comunal ONCE DE MAYO-HUANCARANI.
La socia Benita tiene 47 años de edad y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Benita is a member of the Commuanl Bank “Once de Mayo – Huancarani” (May 11th – Huancarani). She is 47 years old and has one child. Benita divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling food. She has been in this business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her business. At the same time, she manages a grocery store. Benita wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family. She is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, and other items.

The members of this group appreciate the loan that has been issued and promise to complete their payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 28 years old. She is married with one child of 3 years, who does not yet go to school. She sells domestic animals and has been in business for the past 3 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more cows and goats to resell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more cows and goats to resell.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 26 years old. He owns a shop and he has been in business for the past 2 years. With this loan, he would like to buy more soap, sugar and Colgate to resell. The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare and to increase his savings.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar and Colgate to resell.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal used the previous loan for construction purposes. He is a married man with three children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, and has a business of mobile money that he started with a hope of sustaining himself.

He is faced with challenges of inadequate capital and the ever-increasing losses due to network problems, yet demand is high. Besides that, Micheal has future prospects of expanding his business to new areas. Michael has asked for a loan boost his mobile money business.

The extra persons in the photo are Michael's wife and child, who were at the business premises when the photo was being taken.

loans.use: to boost his mobile money business.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
From the village of Makvaneti, Nino is 53 years old and married. She lives with her husband, who works as a sales person and earns a fixed salary. 

Nino seasonally harvests nuts and earns a small income. Her salary is not enough to meet the basic needs of her family. As it becomes harder to earn a living, she wants to expand her business to include clothing in order to more effectively cover the daily costs of her family. 

A loan of 2,500 GEL will be a great support to this hardworking woman, enabling Nino to purchase clothing inventory and start selling in her community. 

The startup loan program, created together by Kiva and Credo, provides credit with soft conditions to business startups and re-startups. The program targets the country's rural poor who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income and otherwise do not have access to credit products.

After starting her clothing business, Nino will increase her role in her family's well-being. She will be very thankful to all Kiva lenders for the chance to make  a better standard of living for herself.

loans.use: To buy and sell clothing and earn her own income.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
Orlando es un veterano de 50 años de edad junto con su tienda han librado muchas batallas, para consolidarse, competir, no dejarse absorber por la competencia, por tener una vida digna, este hombre que comparte su hogar con su pareja y que lleva todas las responsabilidades económicas en sus hombros quiere solicitar un préstamo para impulsar la venta de alimentos en su negocio, quiere comprar productos congelados como pasteles, palitos de queso, panzerotis, paralelo a estos productos vende bebidas y cerveza,

A Orlando se le ocurrió la idea de comprometerse con un crédito para poder realizar su cometido de impulsar la venta de alimentos en su negocio, ya que con el crédito podría comprar insumos en cantidades y pagar en cuotas cómodas, esto el ayudaría a no descuidar los demás productos de la tienda y tener capital para cubrir sus gastos.


Orlando quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido en cantidad de los siguientes productos congelados que venderá en su tienda pasteles, palitos de queso, panzerotis, tú puedes apoyar a Orlando con un aporte, para comprar surtido y tener una línea de alimentos para vender.
texts.en:
Orlando is a 50-year-old veteran, with his store he has made through several battles to establish, compete and not let himself get absorbed by the competition and have a dignified life.  This man shares a home with his partner and carries all economic responsibilities under his shoulders. He wants to request a loan to boost food sales in his business, he wants to sell frozen products such as cakes, cheesecakes, panzerotis (Colombian stuffed pastry), in parallel he also sells drinks and beer.  

Orlando thought about committing to a credit to be able to achieve his goal and boost food sales at his business because with the loan he can buy ingredients in higher amounts and be able to pay them in comfortable schedules.  This would help him without affecting other products at the store and he would have capital to cover expenses.

Orlando wants to request a loan to buy stock in large quantities of frozen products he will sell in his store such as cakes, cheesecakes and panzerotis. You can help Orlando with a loan to have stock and a line of food products to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock in large quantities of frozen products he will sell in his store such as cakes, cheesecakes and panzerotis.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
En el año 2009 con poco capital, cumpliendo su sueño de tener negocio propio inicio la señora María con un restaurante, ella una mujer soltera busca todos los medios posibles para producir capital para su mantenimiento. 

María inicio su negocio con mesas, manteles e incluso implementos de segunda mano, gasto todos su ahorros para tener algo con que empezar, pues tenía la convicción de que este negocio iba a mantenerse y poco a poco iría cambiando todos los implementos y mesas conforme el negocio diera rentabilidad.

Este año 2015 por fin llego la oportunidad de cambiar, de actualizar sus mesas, sus implementos, ollas, los que tienen han cumplido un ciclo de vida más que largo y necesitan un recambio, Maria busca un apoyo crediticio, ya que se puede comprometer con el pago de cuotas, con este préstamo realizara lo siguiente:
•	Pintura y reparación de algunos muros del negocio
•	Cambio de mesas y sillas 
•	Comprar ollas, cucharones, pailas, locería, vasos de cristal nuevos.
Este préstamo será muy significativo para la empresaria pues sabe el mucho que influye una buena primera impresión de un negocio como un restaurante.
texts.en:
In 2009, with little capital, María fulfilled her dream of having her own business and set up a restaurant.

She is a single woman and does everything she can to generate capital to keep the restaurant in good condition.

María started her business with second-hand tables and tablecloths—and even second-hand utensils. She spent all her savings in order to have something to start with because she believed that this business was going to stay afloat, and, little by little, she would replace all the utensils and tables as the business became profitable.

This year, 2015, the opportunity to replace and upgrade her tables, utensils, and pots has finally arrived. The ones that she has are way past their life cycle and need to be replaced. 

Maria is opting for a loan because she can commit to make the repayments on time. 

She will use the loan to do the following:
•	Paint and repair some of the restaurant's walls
•	Replace tables and chairs
•	Buy new pots, ladles, frying pans, crockery, and glassware

This loan will be very important for this businesswoman because she knows how much leaving a good first impression matters in a business such as a restaurant.

loans.use: to make some improvements to her restaurant such as repair and paint walls; replace tables and chairs; and buy pots, ladles, frying pans, and crockery.

loans.name: Ney Antonio

texts.es:
Ney un hombre de 47 años de edad, residente de Momil, una zona humilde pero con buenas proyecciones gracias a sus ciudadanos que con emprendimiento, han logrado sacar sus vidas y familias adelante, uno de ellos es Ney quien se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos, este negocio le permite generar los ingresos para llevar el pan de cada día a casa, donde lo espera su pareja y 4 hijos, tres mujeres y 1 un hombre. 

El sueño de Ney es uno muy común entre los emprendedores colombianos el cual es aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia, para ello quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual le permitirá aumentar un 15% su inventario puesto que con este comprara cerdos y pollos, esto lo hace con la idea de mejorar sus ventas, clientes y utilidad, parte del préstamo lo destinara para la compra de madera con los que construirá un canal de alimentación para los cerdos.
texts.en:
Ney is 47 years old, married, and the father of four children: three sons and a daughter. He lives in Momil, which is not a wealthy area, but has a bright future due to the work ethic and entrepreneurship of its people. Local residents manage to improve the lives of their families, as Ney does by raising and selling pigs. 

Like many Colombian entrepreneurs, Ney's ambition is to improve his family's quality of life. He is therefore applying for a loan that he'll use to increase his pig herd and chicken flock by 15%. Growing the herd and flock will allow Ney to increase his sales, gain new customers, and increase the value of his business. He'll also use part of the loan to purchase wood for construction of a feeding trough for his pigs.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to add to his herd and wood for construction of a feeding trough.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
Donald, es un pequeño caficultor con más de 15 años de experiencia en este rubro. Desde su infancia ha estado relacionado a la actividad cafetalera ya que su familia y ahora también él, han contado con pequeñas fincas en áreas propicias para la producción de este rubro. 

Este año, Donald se ha propuesto incrementar los rendimientos de su cafetal, mediante un manejo adecuado de sus plantaciones, para ello está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le asegure el mantenimiento adecuado de café, y con ello una mayor producción y calidad de su cosecha.

Para este pequeño emprendedor, el café es un rubro con el cual podría mejorar las condiciones de su familia y darles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Donald is a small coffee grower with more than 15 years of experience in this field. Since he was a baby, he's been involved in the coffee growing trade, as his family and now him have had small farms in areas well-suited to growing this item.

This year, it's been proposed to Donald that he increase the yields of his coffee farm through proper management of his fields. For this, he's seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs that will ensure proper maintenance of coffee, and with this, increased production and quality for his crop.

For this small entrepreneur, coffee is an item that can improve his family's conditions and give his children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs he will apply to his coffee field to have a good crop.

loans.name: Abigil

texts.en:
Abigil is a hardworking woman from Rwentobo cell, in the Rwampara Mbarara district of Uganda. She has applied for a 3,000,000 UGX loan to add stock of baby chicks and chicken feed for her poultry business. 

Abigil has an additional business processing dried banana products, and her husband is a good farmer in the area with a banana plantation. 

Abigil started small, together with her family members, but her business is growing, and her children are in good schools in Mbarara town. Indeed, she is expanding, but she needs to buy feed and other business materials in order to increase her output and grow her income. 

Abigil thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited and Kiva's lenders who are supportive of her venture. Hardworking and resilient, she is confident she will go a long way. Thank you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva es una joven estudiante que vive junto a sus padres y 2 hermanos menores. El distrito en el que se encuentra está a una hora fuera de Lima, llamado Huaycán y es uno de los distritos más pobres de la zona.

Ella está estudiando Administración Industrial, carrera que le gusta mucho porque piensa que es una de las mejores, con mayor oportunidad de trabajo, siendo una de las más demandadas. Sueña con tener su propia empresa para beneficiar a su familia en el ámbito económico.

De no tener el acceso al apoyo de KIVA, ella tendría que renunciar a su sueño de convertirse en una excelente profesional para trabajar y reunir el dinero suficiente que le permita continuar sus estudios.

Ella piensa que el programa de KIVA es uno de los mejores ya que ayuda a estudiantes como ella a solventar sus estudios y es algo muy importante porque les da muchas facilidades de pagar y ser grandes profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Eva is a young student who lives with her parents and two younger siblings. The district named Huaycán where she lives is an hour away from Lima and is one of the poorest districts in the area.

Eva is studying Industrial Management, a degree program that she enjoys greatly because she thinks it is one of the best for having plenty of job opportunities since it is one of several that are in most demand. She dreams of having her own business so that it will benefit her family’s financial situation.

Without the support of Kiva, she would have to abandon her dream of becoming a successful working professional and find some other way of earning enough money to continue her studies. Eva believes the Kiva program is one of the best for helping students afford their studies. It is very important to be given many payment options so that these students can become successful professionals in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her studies in Industrial Management.

loans.name: Las Ganadoras Group

texts.en:
The Department of Quiche is located in the Western Highlands of Guatemala and is home to many different communities and towns that are full of color, mature trees, and above all, a population that is kind and hardworking. They have goals and dreams for themselves, their families, and their communities. 

The 7 women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Ganadoras”, or “The Winners”, share these traits as well. The ladies have different kinds of commercial businesses which include the sale of food (spices, fruits, vegetables) and animals (chickens, pigs) as well as the purchase and sale of scrap metal. The women not only conduct business in their community but also in neighboring communities on market days. They share that one day each week, going to 3 nearby communities to sell their products.

Ana is the 23-year-old President of the Trust Bank who has been with the group for 2 years. She has one son. This will be her first loan via Kiva and she is quite excited. Ana is a lively, proactive and inspiring young woman who has strong leadership skills. Her parents were only able to send her to school up to the first grade, but she is motivated to learn as much as she can to raise her standard of living and give her child the best life that she can. With her loan, Ana would like to buy inventory for her business, including spices, chile, and coffee. She would like to sell in the nearby markets with the short-term goal of increasing clientele, realizing additional income, and helping her husband support the household.

The women benefit from the knowledge that they gain from their monthly meetings when a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares valuable and practical information with them. The ladies learn how to be successful in their businesses as they learn about designing a business plan, budgeting, pricing, marketing, and customer service.

Kiva investors are valuable partners in this effort and are much appreciated by the ladies of “Las Ganadoras”. They are readily stepping into themselves as “The Winners” benefitting themselves, their families, and their communities with their small loans and education. Thank you, Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business that includes spices, chile, and coffee

loans.name: Maripositas Group

texts.es:
Maripositas es el nombre de un grupo integrado por diez personas dedicadas a distintas actividades económicas con el propósito de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El grupo lo forman Luz y Julia que se dedican a vender antojitos; Karina, cosméticos; Maricela, comida; María, calzado y postres; Erika y Alicia, productos naturistas; Ismari, calzado; Omar, regrescos y Ciro ofrece servicio de carpintería.

Don Ciro Vicente es mejor conocido como “Chente” y por ser un hombre muy responsable y trabajador. Está casado con la señora Luz del Carmen y tienen cuatro hijos. Él trabajó durante treinta años para una empresa ferroviaria, ahora está jubilado y recibe una pensión. Sin embargo, Don Ciro no ha dejado de laborar ya que maneja su propia carpintería, actividad en la cual cuenta con veinte años de experiencia y que le ha ayudado a solventar sus gastos además de darles estudio a sus hijos. Ciro decidió seguir los pasos de su padre al transformar la madera ya que gracias a este trabajo pudo sostener a su familia sin descuidarla, “fue así como mi padre se convirtió en mi modelo a seguir y en mi más grande héroe.”

   La puntualidad, calidad y buen servicio que don “Chente” brinda son una garantía y atributos por los cuales sus clientes lo reconocen y pagan sin dudar una parte del precio previo a la realización del trabajo. 

   El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en barniz, lijas, brocas y triplay (madera comprimida). "Chente" está comprometido a seguir trabajando en el oficio que le gusta tanto además de que lo hace sentir útil y productivo. 
   
Don Ciro agradece la confianza y oportunidad de obtener un préstamo para seguir mejorando su negocio. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de doña Mari, don Ciro Vicente, "Chente" viste playera color rojo y está sentado en un sillón.
texts.en:
Maripositas is the name of a group made of 10 people dedicated to different professions with a goal of providing a better quality of life for their families. 

The group is made up of Luz and Julia, who sell glasses, Katrina, cosmetics; Maricela, food; Maria, shoes and desserts; Erika and Alicia, natural products; Ismari, footwear; Omar, drinks and Ciro, carpentry services.

Ciro Vicente is better known as "Chente", and known for being a very responsible and hardworking man. He's married to Luz del Carmen and they have four children.

For 30 years, he worked for a railroad company and is now retired and receiving a pension. Still, Ciro hasn't stopped working and now operated his own carpentry shop. He has 20 years of experience in this field, and has been able to pay for his expenses and provide his children with an education.

Ciro decided to follow in his father's footsteps in transforming wood. Thanks to his work, his father could support his family without neglecting them. "That was how my father became my role model and my biggest hero," Ciro says.

The punctuality, quality and good service that "Chente" provides are a guarantee, and attributes his customers recognize and pay a portion of the price prior to completion of the work without doubt.

He will invest the loan in varnish, sandpaper, files, drills and triplai (compressed wood). "Chente" is committed to continue working in this trade which he likes, plus it makes him feel useful and productive.

Ciro thanks the confidence and opportunity to get a loan to continue improving his business. 

The photo was taken in Mari's house. Ciro Vicente, "Chente," is wearing a red shirt and sitting in a chair.

loans.use: to buy varnish, sandpaper, files, drills and triplai (compressed wood).

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza se encuentra en el primer ciclo, la mayoría de las señoras se dedican a la cría de animales, una actividad rural, son de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona bastante alejada de la capital del país y aun está en crecimiento.
Luisa cría animales de corral, como gallinas, cerdos y otros, y con ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia, y luchar por darles una vida digna. Es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada.
Pide este este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y con ello poder seguir con la cría de sus animales como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The committee named “La Esperanza” (The Hope) is in its first loan cycle. Most of these women raise animals, which is a common rural business. They are from the city of Santaní, which is in a remote area that is a great distance from the national capital. However, it is experiencing a growth period.

Luisa raises farm animals such as chickens, pigs, and other livestock. This gives her the means to help her family and strive to provide them a decent life. She is a hardworking and self-sacrificing individual.

Luisa is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals. This will allow her to continue raising animals just as before. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Assa

texts.en: Assa is a hardworking man aged 45 years old and is a resident of Rushenyi Nyarubungo Mbaara. He has four children and four dependents for his late sister who died two years ago. All of his children and dependents are in school and depending on him for survival. Because of such a family and responsibilities, he resorted to serious banana plantation where he is supplying Mbarara. He seeks a 5,000,000 UGX loan for buying manure and other mulches to increase output from this plantation. He believes natural organics is the best way to healthy food, so he tries as much as possible not to adult them. His dream is to yield more matooke from his plantations, afford to pay school fees for his children, and adequately provide for his family. He is so appreciative of the financial boost from UGAFODE in collaboration with the generous Kiva lenders. Assa thanks you so much for the unwavering support.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 43 year-old married mother of three children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. 

In the beginning, she started selling clothes from her house, and Fatima worked hard to develop this business; and eight months ago she opened her own clothes shop.

Fatima is an ambitious lady who is now well-known in her region and has succeeded in gaining loyal customers. 

Today, Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise by buying a new collection of spring and summer clothes.

Fatima hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Nora Nicolasa

texts.es: Nora de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y es empleada de oficio domestico, tiene 8 años en la venta de cosméticos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro de contención en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero como no tiene de suficiente capital solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra y asi ella y su familia pueden vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
Nora is 50 years old and lives in her own home along with her family. She sells cosmetics and also works as a domestic employee. Nora has been selling cosmetics for eight years. With the income she earns from her sales, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

Nora wants to improve her home by building a retaining wall in the area that is shown in the photograph. However, she does not have sufficient capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral and will use the money to buy cement, sand, iron, and bricks. She will also pay for labor. As a result, she and her family can live more securely.

loans.use: to pay for cement, sand, iron, bricks, and labor in order to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MUJERES VALIENTES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Evangelina ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Valiant Women." This bank is located in the Cusco district, which is part of the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Evangelina is a member and is single, 40 years old and has one son. She works in her crafts business and sells fabrics, sweaters, blankets and weaving. She sells different fabrics and works from 8am until 7pm. She's worked in this business for 8 years and is doing very well. 

Her dream is to expand her business selling fabrics and looms. The member is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, sweaters and looms. 

The other members work in businesses selling sweets, clothes, groceries and books. The member thanks those who are part of this dream through this medium and agrees to comply with the payment of their dues by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Mercedes works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns income from a general store. Mercedes is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc for her restaurant business.

Mercedes has sustained her business through 17 previous loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty, 42, is a married woman with four children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Liberty has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment. Liberty has been in the fishing business for 23 years. 

In the future, Liberty would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Daisy Len

texts.en:
Daisy Len is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP through NWTF to purchase a fishing net for her business.

Daisy Len has been in this business for 15 years and also earns income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Daisy Len has sustained her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns income by buying and selling fish and from a general store.  

Rosalina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy seaweed to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and has requested another loan to build her businesses.

Rosalina has sustained her business through nine previous loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a hard working gentleman from Katete Nyamitanga, Mbarara district. He has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to add stock of charcoal in his business. He is assured of charcoal since most lay people can not afford gas and electricity, so they resort to the cheaper source of charcoal. Francis has been in this business for five years and he goes to shambas and employs many young people in the bush to cut trees and make charcoal. He supplies Mbarara town and hotels while his wife keeps at the store selling in retail. He is constructing a good house from his business and the business proceeds are educating his children in good schools in Mbarara town. He hopes to put them in a good university. He appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for the good vision and dream. He is forcused on working harder and resiliently.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 46 years old married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Marites has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

Marites has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en: Bonny is a 40 year old living in a rural area and a good cattle keeper.  He lives in Nyamiyaga Katenga Isingiro with his family of two children. He studied up to only primary school. He would have loved to go on to university but his parents are poor and could not afford meeting his school dues. However Bonny has now dedicated himself to paying for his children's tuition. This he is doing by working so hard buying cows and fattening and selling them when they have matured. He also does milk production by taking extra care of his cows through feeding and treating, especially the local cows whose milk and meat is offered. He is requesting for a loan to buy more cows for fattening and milk production. This will help boost his sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio es un productor de 54 años de edad con experiencia de toda su vida en la producción de café. El y su familia subsisten de lo que producen en su finca, la cual está certificada por comercio justo, siendo el café el principal rubro de ingresos.

Los principales retos para este pequeño productor hasta ahora, han sido las enfermedades que enfrenta el café, y la falta de recursos para garantizar el nivel de inversiones que requiere el rubro, lo cual ha venido enfrentando con el manejo integrado de finca.

Este año, Dionisio está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los insumos agrícolas que requiere su cafetal, y garantizar la implementación del plan de manejo de su finca, lo cual contribuirá a incrementar los rendimientos de su cafetal y con ello los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Dionisio is a 54 year old producer with an entire life's experience in coffee growing. He and his family subsist on what they produce on his farm, which is certified fair trade, coffee being the main source of income.

The main challenges for this small producer to date have been the sicknesses the coffee faces and the lack of resources to guarantee the level of investment the crop requires, which he has been facing with integrated farm management.

This year, Dionisio is seeking a loan to buy the agricultural inputs his coffee plantation requires and guarantee the implementation of the management plan for his farm. This will contribute to increasing his field's returns, and with this income, the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy inputs that will allow him to ensure maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.en: Maria Alejandra is 55 years old and has two independent sons. She has been working in sales for more than 20 years and last year she opened a food stall were she sells health shakes and vitamins for people that do not eat breakfast at their homes. She is asking for a loan to buy health products. Her neighbors describe her as hard working, honest, and someone that pays her debts.

loans.use: to buy health products for resale.

loans.name: Campesinos De Tzununá Group

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 51 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 6 y 16 años de edad, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
José (es el segundo del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de playera blanco) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 25 años, el eligió esta actividad porque es rentable, pero para poder mejorar sus ingresos también trabaja como jornalero con los vecinos de la comunidad.
José  con la experiencia que tiene se encuentra ahora muy preocupado porque ya llego la época de lluvia y con ello el cultivo ya necesita de su mantenimiento para protegerlo de la lluvia, pero el ahora no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar sus fertilizantes por tal motivo junto a un grupo de personas que tienen la misma necesidad solicita un crédito para cuidar su cultivo.
José guarda las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder cuidar el cultivo de café de la lluvia, para que cuando cosechen puedan obtener  sus ganancias y con ello comprar más terrenos pero también remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Jose is a 51 year old married man with a lovely family of five children between the ages of 6 and 16.  This lovely family lives in Solola.

Jose (second from the left, in a white shirt) with the desire to obtain an income and support his family works as a farmer and has been doing so for 25 years.  He chose this field because it’s profitable but he also works as a laborer within his community in order to obtain additional income.

Based on his experience, Jose is worried because the rainy season has arrived and his crops need maintenance to protect them from the rain.  He doesn’t have enough money to buy fertilizers, so he got together with a group of people with the same need to ask for a loan so he can care for his crops.

Jose is hopeful for getting the loan so he can protect his coffee plants from the rain so he can increase his earnings at harvest time and buy more land as well as remodel his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Patricia Concepción

texts.es:
Patricia es una pequeña productora de café en Jinotega. Es una mujer emprendedora dedicada a la caficultura, como principal actividad económica. Tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven, y a los cuales ha mantenido y provisto todo lo que han necesitado según su condición económica. Esta pequeña emprendedora está integrada en los procesos de certificación de comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, lo cual muestra el buen trabajo que ha realizado en su finca.

Ha tenido 4 financiamientos de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), y actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento para asegurar la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permitan darle un manejo tecnificado a sus plantaciones y obtener mejores rendimientos y calidad en el próximo ciclo de café. 

Ella menciona, que el amor a sus hijos y al trabajo, le ha ayudado a ser más fuerte cada día y a enfrentar los desafíos que se le presentan. Confía que con la gestión de este préstamo, podrá mejorar los rendimientos de su café y por tanto sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Patricia is a small coffee producer in Jinotega. She's an entrepreneurial woman dedicated to growing coffee as her main economic activity. 

She has three children who attend school in the community where they live. She has maintained them and provided them with everything they've needed according to their economic condition. 

This small entrepreneur is a certified member of the fair trade groups UTZ and CAFE Practices, which shows the good work she's done on her farm.

She has had four loans with the group People in Community Action (PAC, in Spanish) and is currently seeking a loan to ensure the purchase of inputs and fertilizers that well allow her to give her plantations technical management and get better yields and quality in the next round of coffee.

She mentions that love for her children and her work has helped her be stronger everyday and face the difficulties she's presented with. She's confident that by managing this loan, she can improve her coffee returns and thus her income for the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers she will apply to her coffee field and have more productive returns.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
EL JOVEN ES JEFE DE FAMILIA, ADEMAS DE ESTO MANTIENE A SU MAMA YA QUE ELLA ES VIUDA. ACTUALMENTE SU MAMA PRESENTA PROBLEMAS DENTALES SEVEROS AL GRADO DE NO PODER INGERIR ALIMENTOS LO QUE HA DETERIORADO SU SALUD.
EL QUISIERA PODER PAGARLE UN TRATAMIENTO A SU MAMA PARA QUE MEJORE SU CALIDAD DE VIDA, DESGRACIADAMENTE SUS INGRESOS  NO LE ALCANZAN.
texts.en:
This young man is the head of his family. He also supports his mother who is a widow. His mother currently suffers from severe dental problems, which is preventing her from eating and causing her health to deteriorate.

The borrower would like to pay for his mother’s treatment so that her quality of life will improve. Unfortunately, his income is not enough to cover this expense.

loans.use: to pay for his mother's dental treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: LA SEÑORA DE 67 AÑOS DE EDAD ES VIUDA, TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE ABARROTES, YA QUE ESTE ES EL UNICO INGRESO QUE ELLA TIENE. CON DIABETES TIPO DOS SUS NIVELES DE GLUCOSA SON MUY ALTOS EN OCASIONES DEBIDO A LA PREOCUPACION, EN SUS OJOS PRESENTA DESGARRES EN LA RETINA LO QUE PROVOCA VISION BORROSA Y MANCHAS NEGRAS DEBIDO AL SANGRADO QUE PRESENTA, DESGRACIADAMENTE ESTO PUEDE SER TRATADO SOLO QUIRURGICAMENTE DEBIDO A LA GRAVEDAD DEL DESGARRO QUE PRESENTA.
texts.en:
This 67-year-old woman is a widow who manages a small grocery store as her only source of income. She has type-2 diabetes and occasionally has to deal with high glucose levels, which is a cause for concern. She also has damage to her retina, which has resulted in blurred vision, dark spots, and even some bleeding.

Unfortunately, the only way this can be treated is through surgery due to the severity of the problem.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: San Hilarion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN HILARION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Curahuasi, perteneciente a la provincia de Abancay y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Genoveva ella es viuda y tiene 62 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “San Hilarion”, which is located in the District of Curahuasi in Abancay Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Genoveva, who is a 62-year-old widow. She works at her grocery business where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. Genoveva works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. She has been in this business for seven years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The other group members have businesses that involve selling animals, selling cereals, managing a grocery store, and selling food.

Genoveva appreciates those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase general merchandise

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 69 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three adult-age children.
 
Ligaya earns a living by procesing peanut butter and by raising hogs. She also receiving a monthly pension as a retired public school teacher.  Ligaya earns approximately PHP5, 000.00 each month. This amount is so helpful to meet her needs. 

She has requested a loan to purchasing feed and vitamins for her hog raising business.

Ligaya has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Ligaya hopes to expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor lives in Plaridel, Philippines. He is married and has six kids. He is a fisherman who never gets tired of supporting his big family. 

In 2011, Nestor applied for membership with Paglaum MPC after hearing about all the benefits. He maintains himself as a credible member in good standing, and he always pays his loans in a timely manner. 

Recently, Nestor asked for a loan of PHP 20,000.00 to buy new fishing nets and accessories and to pay for repairs to his boat's engine.  

Nestor hopes to raise his income by expanding his business.  

Nestor is very thankful to Paglaum MPC with all his heart.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, accessories and fix his boat's engine.

location.town: Plaridel-Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Roner Celso

texts.en:
Roner Celso runs a lumberyard in Pagadian and earns a promising income to support his family. 

He has signed up with PMPC to gain access to a loan.

Roner Celso wants to increase his inventory, so he applied for a loan to purchase more lumber to sell. 

Roner Celso hopes to sustain his business, dreams to send all his children to school and renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell.

loans.name: Jainny

texts.en:
Jainny has a food processing business. As a mother from Lopez Jaena, she never gets tired of supporting her family in any way she can, and helping her husband earn an income.

Jainny joined PMPC after she learned she could gain financial assistance and she decided to start a business. It has been doing well as she has worked to perfect the taste and quality of her product. Jainny has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family.

She has requested another loan from PMPC to purchase additional raw ingredients for her food processing business. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and continue to benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for her food processing business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married and lives in Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Mis.Occ. 

She joined PMPC in July, 2012 to access the programs and services of the co-op. 

Recently, Arlene accessed her third loan in the amount of PHP 14,000 to buy store inventory to sell. 

Arlene hopes to continue her business and save enough money for future business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy store inventory to sell.

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is from Lopez Jaena, in the Philippines. He is married, with four children. Leo is a fisherman. 

He manages his own fishing business and earns a good income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of his family, especially his children's education. 

Leo has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase 100 liters of diesel fuel and to pay for an engine repair and overhaul. 

In the future, Leo hopes to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand his fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase diesel fuel and to repair and overhaul his engine.

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, 44, is a married woman with four children; one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Carmelita has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in busines for five years.

Carmelita requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc., in her general store.

In the future, Carmelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 37 years old. She is married with six children aged between 3 and 18 years. 4 of them go to school. She sells domestic animals and has been in business for the past 10 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more goats to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more goats to resell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, 54, is a married woman with five children. One child attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Emma has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

Emma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 29 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 12 and 16 years. She owns a shop and she has been in business for the past 9 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more shoe polish, biscuits and sugar to resell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more shoe polish, biscuits and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 33 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 5 and 13 years. They all go to school. She owns a mini market and she has been in business for the past 4 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more cakes, milk and chapatti to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more cakes, milk and chapatti to sell.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra est une femme mariée et âgée de 33 ans qui habite à Tokoin. Abra est mère d’un seul enfant et travaille activement pour son épanouissement.
