Pour trouver son revenu, Abra vend des sceaux et objets plastiques en se promenant dans le quartier et gagne son bénéfice grâce à cette activité. Abra s’approvisionne une fois par mois et demande ce crédit pour commander des casseroles, des bassines et des sceaux en plastiques. Abra souhaite augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire et permettre une bonne éducation à son enfant.
texts.en: Abra is a married woman, 33 years old, who lives in Tokoin. She works actively for her only child to thrive. To make an income, Abra sells pails and plasticware by going door to door in her district, thus earning a profit, thanks to this business. She gets her supplies once a month and is asking for this loan to put in an order for plastic pots, tubs, and pails. Abra would like to increase her profit margin to enable her child to have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 3 plastic pots, 48 tubs, and 36 plastic pails

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is aged 39 years. She is married with four children aged between 7 and 14 years. She sells domestic animals and she has been in business for 6 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more goats to resell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more goats to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomato and vegetable seedlings for her horticultural project.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado Comité de Mujeres  “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS”, son  de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, ellas están contentas y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres para que puedan ellas aumentar sus ingresos y ser cada ves mas independientes.
La Sra. Carmen es la presidenta del grupo, ella es Peluquera,  ella vive con sus  hijos quienes son su principal motivo de lucha, ya que quiere darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener y así evitar que ella pase por las necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Es una persona muy sacrificada, que lucha por sus, hijos, para que el día de mañana sean personas de bien y útiles a la sociedad.
 La Sra. Solicita  este préstamo  para mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar para que sus clientas se sientan confortables cuando van a su salón ya que su peluquería la tiene en su casa.
texts.en:
The women’s committee group named “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) is from the city of San Ignacio. The members are unified and supportive of one another. They work together in their activities and are pleased to have the support of the Women’s Committee Program so that they can increase their incomes and have more independent lives.

Sra. Carmen is the president of her group and works as a beautician. She lives with her children who are her main motivation in life. Carmen wants to provide them with everything that she was not able to have and prevent them from going through the same experiences that she had. Carmen is a self-sacrificing individual who strives on behalf of her children so that they will become good people who will be useful to society someday.

She is requesting a loan in order to improve the infrastructure to her home so that her clients will be more comfortable when they come to her salon. Her business is located at her house.

loans.use: to pay for structural improvements to her salon, which is located in her house.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 40 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Philippines. She is married with four adult children.

She is good in doing her farming activities and has had this business for 15 years, since she and her husband were in their early years of marriage. This is how they raised their family.

Gemma has applied her membership in PMPC, after learning she can seek financial assistance for business start-ups. She requested a loan to buy bags of fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to grow more produce. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

In the future, Gemma hopes to engage in a new business to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to grow more produce.

loans.name: Abita

texts.en:
From Langatian, Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte, Abita earns a living by selling clothing. She seeks to have enough inventories to continuously provide for her family. 

For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by Abita since she started her business. 

Abita is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family is her inspiration. 

To earn more money, Abita applied for a loan to purchase more clothing to sell. 

Abita hopes to live comfortably with her two children as they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira lives in Ozamiz City. She has a sari-sari store business she has maintained for 20 years. She is a member of PMPC with good standing. She availed a loan amount of 24,000 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items for her business. Elvira is thankful to PMPC.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for 5 years and earns a monthly net income of 4,200 PHP. Lucy is 49 years old, a widow, and has three children. She is from Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena. In 2009, Lucy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to start up a business. She has successfully repaid her previous loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Now, Lucy is requesting her 12th loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda, a widow, has started a pottery business. As a mother from Lopez Jaena, she is persevering and determined to fulfill her dreams for her family.

She joined PMPC after she learned she could gain financial assistance and she decided to expand her pottery business. It has been doing well as she has worked hard to perfect the shape and quality of her pots. Luzminda has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family.

She has requested another loan from PMPC to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for her business to increase production and her sales.

She hopes to live a comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials and needed equipment for her business to increase production and her sales

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and lives in Mangidkid, Plaridel, Philippines. She is a farmer who wants start a piggery business. Helen has requested a loan to buy five piglets and feed, and to build a concrete pen, to start the business.

She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she wants to raise healthy pigs to earn money for her family.

loans.use: to buy five piglets and feed, and to build a concrete pen, to start the business.

loans.name: Nesel

texts.en:
Nesel, is making a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is 26 years old and single. 

She never gets tired of tending her store. Nesel's passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support her needs. 

Nesel is a full fledged member of PMPC and applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and sales. 

Nesel continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she is determined to pursue her goals.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Metzi

texts.en:
Metzi is 37 years old and lives in Plaridel, Philippines. She is a mother of four adult school-age children. 

Metzi is gaining a profit by making copra (dried coconut meat). She buys whole coconuts for this to supply her copra buyer. The business has been doing well for more than five years. It has helped to cover her basic necessities of those of her extended family members.

Metzi requested a loan to buy whole coconuts for her business. This will help her maximize her profits for her family. 

Metzi continues to look for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Lyzel

texts.en:
Lyzel is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 37 years old, separated, and has a snack vending business in Plaridel. This is how she supports her children with a meagre income of PHP 5,000 per month. 

Recently, Lyzel availed a loan to purchase plywood, nails, sticks and "amakan" for walling. 

She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, sticks and "amakan" for walling.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Filomena is 64 years old now.

Filomena has a buy and sell herbal products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more herbal products to sell.

Filomena has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Glades

texts.en:
Glades is 37 years old and has one child whom in school. Glades is a married woman.

Glades is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Glades has been in this business for four years, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to help sustain it.

In the future, Glades would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, age 29, is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Helen has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 42 years old and has five children. Lolita is married and has three children who attend school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lolita has been raising pigs for three years and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to help sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Nafissa

texts.fr: Nafissa est une femme mariée et âgée de 40 ans. Mère de trois enfants, Nafissa est très dynamique et vend du riz et du haricot préparé dans son quartier afin d’avoir son revenu nécessaire. Nafissa gagne son bénéfice à travers cette activité et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Nafissa demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de riz et un bidon d’huile afin de réaliser son achat et avoir plus de bénéfice pour aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Nafissa is a married woman, 40 years old, and the mother three. She is very energetic and sells cooked rice and beans in her district to make the necessary income. She earns a profit from this business and gets her supplies three times a month at the market. Nafissa is asking for this loan to put in an order for sacks of rice and a container of oil in order to realize her purchase and have more profit, so as to help out her husband in meeting the needs of their children.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice and a container of oil

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods and soft-drinks to sell in her sari sari store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business.

Gina dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to provide a secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Fara Domoina

texts.fr:
Fara est une femme mariée. Elle a trois enfants âgés de 15, 11 et 9 ans. Ces derniers vont tous à l'école actuellement. Fara est une femme travailleuse, impliquée avec un esprit créatif. 
Son mari est docker dont le revenu est faible est aléatoire. Pour aider ce dernier à soutenir la famille, Fara a eu l'idée, il y a huit années, de créer un petit centre d'appel téléphonique, appelé en général "taxi-phone" dans le pays.
Ce point d'appel se situe dans un endroit où beaucoup de gens passent. En plus, elle vend des œufs à coté.
Son plus grand rêve est de pouvoir soutenir ses enfants dans leurs études, qu'ils pourront aller jusqu'à l'université.
texts.en: Fara is a married woman and has three children, aged 15, 11 and 9, who are all going to school currently. She is a hard worker imbued with a creative spirit. Her husband is a dock worker, whose income is low and uncertain. To help him to support the family, Fara had the idea eight years ago to create a small call center, generally called "taxi-phone" in this country. This spot for making phone calls is located where many people go by. She also sells eggs on the side. Her greatest dream is to able to support her children’s education, so that they may attend university.

loans.use: to purchase phone minutes card (telma - orange - airtel)

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Etant une femme célibataire avec trois enfants. Adjowa vit à Attiégou et âgée de 40 ans. Pour exercer son activité et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants, Adjowa vend de l’igname frite accompagnée de spaghetti dans son quartier. Adjowa trouve son bénéfice grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois. Pour commander des calebasses d’ignames, des cartons de spaghettis et un bidon d’huile, Adjowa nécessite ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et assurer les charges de ses enfants.
texts.en: An unmarried woman with three children, Adjowa lives in Attiégou, and she is 40 years old. To operate her business and help meet the needs of her children, she sells fried yams served with spaghetti in her district. She makes a profit thanks to this business, and she gets her supplies three times a month. To put in an order for tubs of yams, boxes of spaghetti, and a container of oil, Adjowa needs this loan to realize her purchase and to ensure her children are cared for.

loans.use: to purchase a few tubs of yams, boxes of spaghetti, and a container of oil

loans.name: Se Di Allah Ma Group

texts.fr: Alimata, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés. Cette brave dame fait le commerce des céréales et cela depuis 10 ans. Elle voudrait un prêt pour acheter des céréales pour vendre et se faire un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son activité.Le groupe d'Alimata est à son 6ème prêt avec ACFIME et fait toujours les remboursements à la bonne.
texts.en: Alimata, a representative member, is a married mother of two children, who are in school. This good and honest lady has been doing commerce in grains for ten years. She would like this loan to purchase some grains to sell and make a profit enabling her to continue in her business. Alimata’s group is on its 6th loan with ACFIME  and always makes its payments correctly.

loans.use: to purchase grains (sorghum, pearl millet, corn, beans, ...) to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora manages her eatery business in Sindangan. She mastered her business when she and her husband were on the early years of their marriage. 

The business has been doing well, supporting the needs of the family.  She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. 

Recently, Flora received a loan to purchase meat and spices for her eatery business. 

She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro runs a lumberyard in Ozamiz City to earn a living. He is able to support his family. 

He signed up with PMPC to gain access to loans. He wants to buy more lumber to sell. 

Teodoro hopes to sustain his business.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy has mastered her swine production in Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. This is how she makes a living to support and raise her family. 

Joy was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. 

Just as Joy takes care of her swine production business, so it is with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always apply for the financing she needs. 

This loan of PHP 10,000 will be used to purchase bags of gestating feed for her swine. 

Joy hopes and prays that her business will grow because that will help her save enough money for future emergencies. She wishes to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gestating feed for her swine.

loans.name: Garry

texts.en:
Garry lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 27 years old and has been a motorcycle operator for many years. 

He is blessed with a child. Garry's business supports his family's daily needs. 

He has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for two years. He has availed a loan amount of Php 25,000.00 to purchase a new motorcycle to add additional income. 

Garry hopes to have more motorcycles of his own.

loans.use: to purchase new motorcycle.

loans.name: Ramazon

texts.ru: Рамазон 31 летный житель района Чиликул. Он женат и отец двоих детей. Рамазон умный человек. Жена домохозяйка. Дети еще маленькие. Рамазон работает учителем в средней школе. У него 10 летный опыт работы. Рамазон хочет улучшить условия жизни семьи, чтобы жить комфортно как другие жители района. Он планирует взять кредит, и за счет кредита хочет приобрести стройматериалы, чтобы  отремонтировать дом. Запрашиваемый кредит очень важно для него. Рамазон надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Ramazon is a 31-year-old resident of the Jilikul district.  He is married and the father of two children.  He is an intelligent man.  His wife is a homemaker.  His children are still young.  Ramazon works as a teacher in a secondary school.  He has 10 years of experience at his job.  He wants to improve his family's living conditions, so that they can live comfortably, like other residents in the district.  He is planning to take a loan and to use it to buy construction supplies to renovate his house.  The loan he is requesting means a lot to Ramazon.  He is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and renovate his house.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita makes a good earning on her coconut farm in Plaridel. This is the primary means of her income, supporting her needs. She wants to increase her farm yield. She approached Paglaum to loan an amount to pay and redeem the pawned coco land. She has high hopes that she will have more yield next cropping season.

loans.use: to pay and redeem the pawned coco land.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Jenalyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business.

Jenalyn dreams that one day, she will be able to expand her business and repair her family's home

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 49 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Agnes has a bakery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and ingredients for her bakery.

Agnes has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Agnes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Ma. Loreto

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ma. Loreto works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Loreto is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now requested a loan to further build her businesses.

Ma. Loreto has sustained her business through her eight previous loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries.

Ermelinda successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business.

Ermelinda dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel works hard to support her family. Ethel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ethel requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase utensils and ingredients for her food production business such as meat, fish, chicken, and spices.

Ethel has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and ingredients for her food production business such as meat, fish, chicken, and spices

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a hardworking woman and entrepreneur.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Visitacion dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 56 years old and married with two children. Felicitas works very hard to provide for them.

Felicitas runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, milk, sugar, coffee, and personal care products.

Felicitas has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, milk, sugar, coffee, and personal care products

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 42 years old, married and has four school-age children.

Jinky raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jinky has been in this business for three years and also earns income from general store. She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Luizminda

texts.en:
Luizminda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Luizminda requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at the food market. She has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La señora tiene 53 años y trabaja atendiendo un puesto en un mercado ambulante para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que ellos se hacen cargo de sus tres nietos.
Una de sus nietas de 12 años tiene un problema de salud bucal severo, el apiñamiento de piezas dentales trae como consecuencia que la niña  padezca desgaste prematuro de la articulacion temporomandibular y ademas le dificulte masticar sus alimentos, el deseo de la señora es poder pagarle a su nieta el tratamiento que necesita, y así evitar las burlas de que es objeto por parte de sus compañeros de escuela.
texts.en:
This 53-year-old woman works by managing a stall at a street market so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She also takes care of three grandchildren.

One of her granddaughters is 12 years old and suffers from severe dental problems. Her teeth have become crowded as a result of premature wear to the temporomandibular joint as such a young age. This makes it difficult for her to chew her food.

The borrower wants to pay for the treatment that her granddaughter needs so that she can avoid being teased by her classmates at school.

loans.use: to pay for her granddaughter's dental treatment.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila hails from the town of Macarthur, Leyte. She is 49 year old married woman with five children. Her eldest child is 26 and the youngest is 10. 

She owns and operates a video entertainment service.  Aside from that, Lucila also runs a computer shop. It's been almost two years since she engaged in her business. 

Lucila is in need of capital to sustained her livelihood.

Lucila is asking for a loan to buy a computer and printer. This will enable Lucila to cater to additional customer and slowly improve her earnings. 

Thus, Lucila could pay her obligation and start to balance her finances and support the needs of her growing children.

In the future, Lucila dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy a computer and printer

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old, married and has three children. 

Teresita raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for 24 years, and has borrowed 31 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 33 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosalie has been in this business for four years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 43 years old and married with six children. With one child still in school, Maricar works very hard to provide for them.

Maricar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, milk, sugar, coffee, and other personal care products.

Maricar has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, milk, sugar, coffee, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Charlotte Grace

texts.en:
Charlotte Grace is 32 years old and is married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Charlotte Grace has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

Charlotte Grace has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Robella

texts.en:
Robella is 52 years old and married with five children. With two children still in school, Robella works very hard to provide for them.

Robella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell.

Robella has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 39 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosalie has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Welmina

texts.en:
Welmina is 51 years old and married with four children. With two children presently in school, Welmina works very hard to provide for them.

Welmina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles, bread, spices, soft drinks, coffee, milk, and personal care products.

Welmina has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles, bread, spices, soft drinks, coffee, milk, and personal care products.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 61 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresa has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Teresa has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her furniture making business.

Teresa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Teresa would like to save money to expand her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 40-year-old woman, with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Sabina runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Sabina has been in this business for 4 years, and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Sabina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Renee

texts.en:
Renee is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Renee is 60 years old now.

Renee has a food vending business in the Philippines. Renee requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Renee has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Renee would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda is 51 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Emmalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Emmalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

Emmalinda has been in this business for 11 years now. 

In the future, Emmalinda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 50-year-old married woman, with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
Ana, pose una mini ferretería  y venta de repuestos para bicicletas, vive con sus hijos y su compañero de vida en casa de su papá, no tiene más ingresos que los que genera con su negocio, lo emprendió por iniciativa propia y lo atiende sola, en ocasiones le ayuda su hijo.
Comprará linternas, regletas, destornilladores, pedales, cadenas, etc., surtirá la ferretería y la venta de repuestos para bicicletas, pretende mejorar sus ingresos con la ayuda de la inversión, para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
Su objetivo es tener todo lo que sus clientes necesitan y tener una situación económica más favorable.
texts.en: Ana owns a small hardware store and sells spare parts for bicycles.  She lives with her children and life partner in her father's house.  She doesn't have income other than what she generates from her business, which she started by her own initiative and runs by herself, although her son occasionally helps out.  She will purchase lights, powerstrips, screwdrivers, pedals, chains, etc. to stock her hardware and spare bicycle parts store.  She intends to improve her income with the help of the investment, in order to have better living conditions.  Her goal is to have everything her customers need and to be in a better financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase lights, powerstrips, screwdrivers, pedals, chains etc. to stock her hardware and spare bicycle parts store.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Раъно молодая женщина 41 лет. Она родилась в  семье рабочего.  Раъно замужем и имеет четырёх  детей. У неё очень дружная и счастливая семья.  Раъно очень жизнерадостная и любящая мать. Раъно очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она швея. 
Раъно, вот уже несколько лет сотрудничает с Арванд. Она получала кредит на потребительские нужды, а также на развитие своего бизнеса. Раъно говорит, что после того, как она начала сотрудничать с Арванд, качество её жизни стало постепенно улучшаться. В данное время Раъно вместе со своим мужем хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Раъно обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Rano, age 41, is a young woman who was born in a working class family.  She is married and she has four children.  Her family is very friendly and happy.  Rano herself has a positive attitude in life and she is a loving mother.  She is a seamstress and she works very hard. 

Rano has been a client of MDO Arvand for a few years already.  She already took a loan to meet some personal needs and to grow her own business.  She says that her quality of live has gradually improved since she started her cooperation with MDO Arvand.  At the moment, she and her husband want to renovate their house and improve their living conditions.  However, they don't have the personal means to do so.  For this reason, Rano has turned to MDO Arvand.  She wants to take a loan to buy construction materials to renovate her house.  She is hoping for a positive outcome and thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en: Sokchea’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokchea makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Savoeurn's Group

texts.en: Savoeurn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Savoeurn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and teacher to support her family. She has one young son in her family, and in their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nov's Group

texts.en: Nov’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nov makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Tho's Group

texts.en: Tho’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Tho makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sreysras's Group

texts.en: Sreysras’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreysras does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Zaynyra

texts.ru:
Зайнура молодая женщина 40 лет.  Она замужем  и имеет троих детей.  Зайнура занимается животноводством и земледелием .   Она  добрая, понимающая , готовая помочь близкому человеку в любое время женщина.
 Зайнура обратилась   в  Арванд  узнав о  новом продукте «Тахсил» . Она   решила для  лучшего развития  своего ребенка  воспользоваться этим и оплатить учебу  своего ребёнка.   Она  обратилась в МДО Арванд  и заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Zaynyra, age 40, is a young married woman and the mother of three children.  She works in animal husbandry and agriculture.  She is kind, compassionate, and always ready to help others.

Zaynyra contacted MDO Arvand after she learned about a new loan product called "Taksil".  In order to give a good education to one of her children, she has decided to use this loan to pay for school tuition.  She turned to MDO Arvand and she thanks them in advance for their support and their trust.

loans.use: to pay for one of her children's education.

loans.name: Enoc

texts.es: Enoc de 40 años de edad habita en vivienda propia desde hace muchos años junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Enoc es un hombre trabajador  que se gana la vida en una panadería desde hace ocho años lo que le ha permitido sostener a su familia y apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios. Enoc siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia ha decidido realizar mejoras en su vivienda, pero por falta de liquidez económica no ha logrado realizarlas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual le permita invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir dos paredes en el corredor de su vivienda, y de esta manera ampliar su vivienda brindado una mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Enoc, 40 years old, has lived in this own house for many years together with his life partner and his children.  Enoc is a hardworking man who makes a living in a bakery.  For the past eight years, it has allowed him to sustain his family and support his children with their studies.  Enoc, always searching for the best for his family, has decided to makes improvements in his house; but for lack of liquid finances, he has not been able to make them.  

That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI that will allow him to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build two walls in the corridor of his house, and in this way expand his house, making it more comfortable for his family.

loans.use: To invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build two walls in the corridor of his house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MINIBANK.
La socia sigue dedicándose  al negocio de artesanía, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua realizando bordados para sus clientes que le solicitan, la  socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lanas entre otros.
texts.en:
She is a member of the MINIBANK communal bank.

This member continues her arts and crafts business and is a responsible and dedicated person who continues embroidering for her customers.  She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.  This is how she supports her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy yarn and other things.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary earns a living by operating a pedicab (a small three-wheeled vehicle, having a seat, pedals, and handlebars for the operator and a usually hooded cab for passengers). She is a 38-year-old married woman with a three-year-old dependent. She lives in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. Aside from operating her pedicab, she also raises and sells hogs for supplemental income. Mary lacks capital to continue to operate her pedicab transportation services.

She is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of her pedicab. This is very essential to the operation of her business. She could then transport passengers safely and without delays. Thus, her income would probably improve and she would be better able to handle her finances.

In the future, Mary hopes to be able to handle her two sources of income properly to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her pedicab

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is very flexible when it comes to managing her business. She operates three businesses at this moment and she profits well. Her variety store, computer shop and tailoring business help her provide for the everyday needs of her family.

Ana has already availed several loans through CCT, and she never failed to repay them. 

Ana dreams to grow her investments so she needs additional capital to make this happen. Ana is asking for another loan amounting to Php 50,000 to purchase additional grocery goods to sell, raw materials for her tailoring shop and an additional computer set. 

She expects to improve her earnings more as she expand her businesses. Ana sends you her thank you in advance for whatever amount you are willing to lend her.

God-willing, Ana hopes she could also teach her children how to manage their own business when they are grown-ups. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, raw materials for tailoring and a computer set.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 63 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Vivian is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Vivian has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vivian is 40 years old and both of her children are in school.

Vivian has a business buying and selling personal care products in the Philippines, and has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like lotion to sell.

Vivian has been in this business for five years. In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like lotion to sell

loans.name: Flordelita

texts.en:
Flordelita is a 46-year-old married woman, with five children, three of whom are in school.

Flordelita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Flordelita has been in this business for 25 years, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Flordelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 62-year-old widowed woman, with three children.

She earns a living by growing vegetables in the Philippines. Judith is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF, in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Judith has been growing vegetables for 40 years, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Cristina works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fattening pigs. 

Ma. Cristina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Ma. Cristina has sustained her business through five previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessica is 31 years old and all of her children attend school.

Jessica has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase snack foods, canned goods and other personal care products.

Jessica has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase items like snack foods, canned goods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has an E-loading (prepaid mobile phone) business in the Philippines, and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF, in order to buy additional prepaid phone plans to resell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, such as charcoal retailing.

Susan dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional prepaid phone plans to resell.

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer de 36 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos  a los que apoyan junto a su esposo para que estudien. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que ha instalado una carpintería en su vivienda, en la que se elaboran camas de madera y junco lo que permite sostener la economía de su hogar. Blanca desea mejorar la entrada de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía este es de tierra, y en época lluviosa se vuelve muy difícil el acceso, por lo que ella desea construir unas gradas en su vivienda, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir las gradas de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 36-year-old woman who lives in her own house with her husband and her children whom she supports along with her husband so that they can study.  She is an enterprising woman who has installed a carpenter's shop in her residence where they make beds from wood and reeds which allows them to sustain the household economy.
Blanca wants to improve the entrance to the residence since as one can see from the photograph it is dirt and in the rainy season it makes access difficult.  For this reason, she wishes to construct some steps to her house and therefore she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and rebar in order to construct the steps of her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and rebar in order to construct the steps of her residence.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a bathroom that he planned since he began his house, and thus give hygiene and safety to his family.

loans.name: Progresistas De Mollepata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROGRESISTAS DE MOLLEPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Mollepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia ella es soltera y tiene 33 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de ganaderia, negocio de agriculrura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Progresistas de Mollepata" (Progressive of Mollepata).  This bank is located in the district of Mollepata, pertaining to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Julia.  She is single, 33 years old, and has 3 children.  She works in her grocery store and restaurant.  She sells staples like rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.  Julia, through this business, wants to get ahead.  She is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman.  Her dream is to expand the grocery store.  

Julia is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.

The other members work in livestock, agriculture, grocery store, and selling animals.

Julia is thankful to those who form part of this dream through this medium, and she promises to fulfill the payment of her dues by their deadline.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs, like fertilizer and hybrid maize seeds.

loans.name: Karl

texts.en:
Karl has been a business owner since he was a teenager. Born in Cleveland, Ohio, his passion for cutting hair led him to start his own barber business, which he kept up for years. He attended college in Florida, and then decided to move to Atlanta, Georgia to pursue his dream as a master barber and business owner. 

For years, he worked as a master barber independent contractor at barbershops.  In 2014, he was able to open his own barbershop, offering services to men, women, and children. While he currently works with an independent contractor, he hopes to hire two more barbers/contractors in the near future. 

Being able to open the doors to his own establishment, "The House of Barbers", has been Karl’s greatest success. After all, it “has been a lifelong dream. My mother encouraged me to become a Master Barber and open my own business. I know that she would be proud of me for finally doing it.”

Karl’s greatest difficulty has been finding qualified master barbers to hire. He has also faced advertising challenges. With this loan he will increase advertising efforts to gain additional contractors and grow his customer base. He will also purchase more operating equipment such as a sink, dryer, mirrors, barber chairs, and additional supplies.

His goal is to have a complete staff of independent contractors, and be able to grow and operate as a reputable company. Further down the road, his vision is to open a barber school, providing continuing education and preparing potential barbers for the state exam. He would also like to operate in public schools as an integrated education system so that young men and women can begin exploring the profession as early as age 16.

loans.use: to purchase barbershop supplies and pay for advertising efforts to grow his customer base and bring in more contractors

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del estado de Oaxaca la mayor fuente de empleo es el campo. La mayoría de los habitantes entrega su esfuerzo y dedicación a la siembra y cosecha de caña de azúcar, maíz y frijol. Otra actividad importante es la cría de reces y borregos.

   Cabe destacar que la comunidad es apoyada con patrocinios para los niños y algunas familias han sido beneficiarias de proyectos en conjunto entre World Vision y VisionFund México como programas de seguridad alimentaria y de salud a través de la implementación de huertos familiares y estufas ahorradoras de leña. 

   En esta comunidad se consolidó el grupo Las Brisas integrado por siete mujeres: Isidora quien vende medicamentos y novedades; Mauricia, tamales, dulces y chicharrones; Yolanda, cosméticos; Floriberta, esquites, elotes y ropa; Luisa y Lorenza, refrescos y  Felipa quien se dedica a vender comida, refrescos y renta un molino de nixtamal.

   Doña Felipa es madre de cinco hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad; los más pequeños tienen ocho y quince años, esta última ha sido patrocinada World Vision durante nueve años. Felipa está casada con Don Crecencio y juntos trabajan para construir un mejor patrimonio para sus hijos. 

   Felipa comenzó a vender refrescos hace tiempo y con las ganancias obtenidas abrió un negocio de comida típica. Así, lo que en un inicio sólo era un negocio de fines de semana se convirtió en un negocio consolidado que permaneces abierto todos los días y cuyas ventas han incrementado. “Gracias a las ganancias pude asociarme con mi cuñada y también comenzamos con el servicio de molino de nixtamal desde hace ya dos años.”.

En esta ocasión el préstamo lo solicita para invertir en refrescos de distintas presentaciones y sabores para aprovechar la temporada de clima más cálido en la región en el cuál las personas siempre buscan refrescarse. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el molino de doña Felipa quien viste blusa color amarillo.*
texts.en:
In a community of the state of Oaxaca, the main source of employment is the countryside.  The majority of the inhabitants put in their effort and dedication to planting and harvesting sugar cane, corn, and beans.  Another important job is raising beef and sheep.

Note that the community is supported by sponsorships for the children and some families have been beneficiaries of projects together between the World Vision and VisionFund México, as food security programs and health through the implementations of family farms and wood-saving stoves.

In this community, the Las Brisas Group (The Breezes Group) is formed of seven women: Isidora who sells medicines and novelties; Mauricia, tamales, sweets, and pork rinds; Yolanda, cosmetics; Floriberta, popcorn, corn, and clothing; Luisa and Lorenza, soft drinks; and Felipa who works selling food, soft drinks, and rents a corn mill.

Doña Felipa is a mother of five children, three of whom are adults; the younger ones are eight and fifteen years old.  The latter has been sponsored by World Vision for nine years.  Felipa is married to Don Crecencio, and together they works to build a better heritage for their children.

Felipa began to sell soft drinks a while back and with the obtained earnings, she opened a business of typical food.  So, what started as only a business on the weekends, turned into an established business that is open every day and whose sales have increased.  "Thanks to the earnings, I could partner with my sister-in-law and we also began a service milling corn for the past two years now."

In this occasion the loan that she is requesting is to invest in soft drinks of different sizes and flavors to take advantage of the warm season in the region in which the people always look to refresh themselves.

*The photograph was taken at the mill of Doña Felipa who is dressed in the yellow blouse.*

loans.use: To buy soft drinks (of 600ml, 1 liter, 2 liters, 2.5 liters, and 3 liters) of different flavors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finance the summer collection for her online boutique, and start a new clothing collection

loans.name: Yandy

texts.en:
Yandy owns a management and technology consulting firm which evaluates business’ return on investments and helps clients improve business efficiency and increase profits. He decided to start the business because he realized he had a unique skill set that companies greatly valued and for which companies were willing to pay lots of money. He has owned the business for almost a year. He subcontracts people when needed, but has no business partners.

Originally from Cuba, Yandy moved to the US when he was 10 years old. He is passionate about making a positive impact on national businesses, and loves his business because his work directly impacts a company’s ability to generate revenues.

Yandy has a background in accounting, finance, software engineering and information systems, and it has been hard for him to find employees or contractors who have a similarly comprehensive set of skills and knowledge. However, he is dedicated to taking the necessary steps to expanding and improving his consulting company. With this loan, he will purchase equipment needed to complete an important revenue generating project. His future goal is to build his company into a nationwide innovator in business intelligence and solutions.

Check out his website at http://www.bisc-us.com

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed to complete an important revenue generating project for his management and technology consulting firm

loans.name: William

texts.en:
Ever since William was a teenager, he loved working at the local tennis and swim club. He worked there for years, putting in long hours to ensure its success and the well-being of its members. In 2008, he had the opportunity to become an owner, and he jumped on it. He currently employs tennis teachers and a seasonally variable number of house staff, such as lifeguards, grill staff, and swim instructors. His greatest success has been being able to grow membership in less than ten years from 76 members to over 300 members.

However, he has run into the challenge of obtaining enough working capital to improve and maintain the club. The purpose of this loan is to add sand volleyball courts to the club to bring in another stream of revenue with minimal construction expenses. He anticipates this will be a great way to add membership and increase revenue.

His future goals are to develop the tennis and swim club into one of the best in town, popular enough to have a wait-list for obtaining membership. Personally, he hopes to become financially secure, get married, and build a family.

loans.use: to add sand volleyball courts to his tennis and swim club

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open her own storefront and replace equpiment for her jewlery production and design business

loans.name: Clark

texts.en:
For many years in the book and newspaper industry, Clark realized he was in a disappearing market. He studied the market and found that insurance sales were increasing on a local level, and decided to go into the business. 

After just a year of selling insurance for another party, Clark decided to start his own insurance business.  He teamed up with American Family Insurance, and with their support, he started his own agency selling American Family Insurance policies. Since starting in December of 2013, his company has experienced steady growth.

Clark was born in Phoenix, Arizona and spent his youth traveling the world with his dad, who was in the US Navy, and the rest of his family.  He finally settled in Spokane, Washington where he currently lives with his wife. 

Clark’s business has seen base sale increases each month, which translates to increased income. However, he still must work hard to obtain clients. The purpose of this loan is to help Clark increase advertising efforts for his insurance sales company. In the future, his vision is to grow his agency to a four person operation and have a satellite agency in a nearby city.  

Check out his website at www.spokanesouthhillinsurance.com

loans.use: to increase advertising efforts for his insurance sales company

loans.name: Tiffany

texts.en:
Tiffany is an inspiring, ambitious individual who is working to become the CEO of a thriving business. Born and raised in Detroit, Michigan, she currently works as a paralegal and owns Breezy Belle Hair Company on the side. 

Her company sells 100% virgin hair extensions—hair extensions made from hair that is not chemically processed. After realizing that many salon owners were frustrated with sub-par extension products, Tiffany decided to fill the void. Her greatest joy in the business has been opportunities to work with great mentors and branding experts. 

However, she constantly has to deal with stiff competition from bigger companies that possess significantly more capital than hers. She will use this loan to increase inventory, and start a website and promotional campaigns. Her future vision is to be able to work from home, and build and head her own thriving company. 

Check out her Instagram at Instagram.com/breezybellehair

loans.use: to increase inventory, and start a website and promotional campaigns

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina and her family started ManiNuts Company two years ago out of popular demand for mani nuts, or sweet, dried fruits and nuts popular in her native Colombia. Back in Colombia, her family owned supermarkets and sold sweets that her grandmother and aunt would make. After moving to the US, her family decided to continue the family business in the food industry.

Lina dreams big, and it is her passion to be a businesswoman. Her work helps her support herself and her son. She wants to establish a company where she can help others to be providers for their family. This business has turned into a dream that she wants to continue. Mani nuts are typical products in Latin American countries, and by selling it in the US, she is helping Latin Americans living in the US to remember and retain some of their own culture.

Lina’s greatest success has been the positive reception of her products in her community. However, one of her greatest difficulties has been obtaining enough funds to acquire necessary products and equipment at wholesale prices—currently she is buying smaller quantities at higher prices per supply.

The purpose of this loan is to pay outstanding debts, purchase more products and equipment, and pay to incorporate the company. Her future goals are to expand distribution and production throughout the New England area and later expand throughout the nation. She wants to give job opportunities to people in need and help as many families as possible. She also wants to provide Latin Americans living in the US with an opportunity to experience a bit of their home country. Perhaps, later, she will expand her business to other countries. “Why not?” she says, “ManiNuts Global!”

Check out her website at www.ManiNuts.com

loans.use: to pay outstanding debts, purchase more products and equipment, and pay to incorporate the company

loans.name: Keith

texts.en:
Keith has been creating websites as a hobby since 2012, but recently he decided to make it a reality. He wanted the freedom that owning a business would bring him to think and act for himself, and moreover, he was passionate about helping local small businesses grow and market themselves. The company is in its nascent stages, and he currently has no partners or employees. Keith lives with his wife and two kids, who depend on him for financial support.

His greatest success has been helping a startup business with creating a website and logo, then later seeing their logo in vehicles, in newspapers, and other advertisements. However, he has found that only offering website design and online marketing to local businesses isn’t enough. Many small businesses do want to market themselves, but may want physical promotional products instead of online digital products. Keith would like to offer both of those types of products.

With this loan, Keith will purchase heat press equipment, printer, and dye in an effort to expand the services offered by his promotional product services company.  He believes that being able to create physical promotional products will have a tremendous impact on his business. His potential clients will be able to see examples of products he can offer.

In the future Keith wants to work for himself full time and growing his business, Towpath Media into the go‐to company for local businesses who want anything related to online and offline marketing.

Check out his website at www.TowpathMedia.com

loans.use: to purchase printing equipment to expand the services offered by his advertising company

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 38 years old and married with three children, all attending school, and works very hard to provide for them.

For 5 years Alberta has operated a general store in the Philippines.  She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional grocery stock such as canned goods, noodles, spices, soft-drinks and other personal care products, to sell.

Alberta would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stock such as canned goods, noodles, spices, soft-drinks and other personal care products, to sell.
